text: A 750ml bottle, bottled on 14th November 2016. Poured into a wine glass. It was a very nice lightly cloudy ruby red colour with a two finger pinkish head that dissipated fairly quickly to a settled thin layer with only sparse lacing. Aromas of lots of tart red berries, raspberry and strawberry plus grapes and lemon. Nice barrel and oak character with a hint of red wine vinegar and only light funk and barnyard-iness. Tastes moderately sour, cherry, raspberry, strawberry, grape juice and oak with hints of grapefruit and funk. Dry, light to medium bodied with moderate to high carbonation. Overall with less than a year since bottling, there was lots of really nice fruit flavours bursting out while the funk was quite light. Although this particular bottle was quite young, it also taste great with age. Cant wait to try more of this wonderful goodness.

2016 vintage poored into wineglass
When I opened the bottle it was like opening the door to the brewery. That recognizable funk fills the nose. Poors a beautiful raspberry pink with some Bordeaux hues.
Mouthfilling fruitiness and, slightly tannic, lots of grapeskins and ripe berries.
On tap @ Akkurat, Stockholm. Tart, cherries, some hough, tannins, blanket. Quite nice.
On tap at Akkurat Sthlm. Medium/high tartness. Taste is unripe grapes, grape juice, bamboo shoots, red wine and dry wood.
Great mix of Lambiek and wine. Best of both worlds. Very juicy lambiek and grapes. Awesome combination: the puckering effect of the Lambiek and grapes.
Bottle - Red fruit and vinous notes. Deep ruby red with a decent white head. Soft red juicy fruit and light tartness. Very vinous and a dry finish.
Certo se dovessi abitare dalle parti di Bruxelles, sarebbe un bel casino, perchè penso che mi attaccherei al bancone di questa spina e spenderei un patrimonio...

Excellente.
Le raisin frais pète littéralement : on croirait sentir et goûter à même la grappe fraîche. Des notes plus vineuses et pommes équilibrent bien. Superbe longueur interminable de fruits et de sour.
From a 75 cl bottle vintage 2014 courtesy of Kermis. Thanks, Bro! Pours a cloudy rose with an ecru head. Funky vinous aroma. Flavors of tart grapes and oak. Tasty.

750ml bottle thanks to Sam. Pours a beautiful plum/deep purple. Hazy and full. White micro bubbles throughout the glass. Foamy and frothy all around. Smells like grape juice. Very fruity and sweet. Winey, tart and oaky. Very smooth aroma. Lovely lambic profile. Tastes beautifully fruity. Grape, plums and lambic oak barrel. Has a winey grape flavor and it works amazingly. The fermentation and bacteria/yeast is sublime. The sour and tart finish is perfect. Great full mouthfeel. Fully enveloping and delicious. Exactly what I want in a lambic. Perfect.
Bottle thanks to James. Pours vibrant pink/purple, thin white lace. Aroma is grape, tart fruits, jam, must. Flavor is sour grapes, cherries, quite acidic/medium funk. Lovely.

Rami Rami is drinking a Saint Lamvinus (2016) by Brasserie Cantillon at Saska Kępa

Aromat delikatny, glownie jakies ziemisto-serowo-skorzane brety. W smaku slodko dosc i kwasno lekko i owocowo - nie zgadlbym ze winogrona.

750ml bottle. Pours a beautiful hazy deep red with a small, fizzy, short lived, pink head that leaves spotty lacing. Aroma of sour red grapes, red wine, brett and oak. Sweet fruity flavour of red grapes, red wine, vinegar and oak with a crisp, dry, tart finish. Medium body with a watery texture and soft carbonation. Excellent.

75 cl bottle at Wild Turkey, Castelgomberto (VI), Italy. Colour is unclear ruby/reddish with a tiny fast disappearing pink head. Aroma is grapes, lemon, red barries, acidic. Taste is medium sourness and medium to heavy sweetness. Lot of fruits sugars. Light to medium bodied, thin feel, soft carbonation.
Backlog. 2016 Vintage. Red grapes, berries, barnyard, lemon, tannin. Medium sour.

Bottled in 2016
Great aroma, with funk, leather, grapes, lemon zest, red berries. Very intensive.
Very fruity, with pleasant astringency. No vinegar at all.

Bottle
Aroma-fruits, red wine, barnyard
Appearance-red, hazy, rouge foam
Taste-medium sour, light sweetness, light bitter
Palate-medium body, sticky, lively, long finish
Overall-very good

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 Pink with fine little bubbles. Light really tart sour candy taste. Raspberry, merlot, light fine wine. Sour but angelic balance. Great complex winey lambic. Randomly shared at the local watering hole.
Pours beautiful clear raspberry-red colour with a white 0,5 cm head. Intense winey aromas of grape and raspbeeries. Long acidic finish. Legendary lambic!
Bottle from a friend. Fruity and tart smell with a slight chemical touch and also a farty aroma. Better taste, very tart with an earthy aroma and some funk.

Rosso rubino opalescente, schiuma rosa chiarissima di buona persistenza.
Aroma di stallatico, cantina, polvere, frumento, leggera buccia d'uva.
Al palato astringente, stallatico, barrique, finale con frumento, legno, cantina e astringenza che può ricordare un vino.
Texture oleosa, mediamente carbonata, corpo poco più che leggero.
Fresh red wine grapes with noticeable horsey velvet funk, dry and superbly balanced between malic and lactic acid. Vanilla and fruit tannins.
A: Nice light red coloured with a teo finger white head N: Grapes, raspberry, oak T: Grapes, funk, raspberry O: Very complex and veeeery nice!

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2016 Pours clear read with no head. Aroma; Funk, cherries, redcurrants, grapes, cranberries, hay, and barnyard. Flavours; Some, grapes, cherries, redcurrant, cranberries, minerals, yeast and rasberries.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Przy mojej całej miłości do Cantillon - to piwo jest delikatnie przehajpowane :)

Bottle, 75cL. 2015 millesime. 1 year old. Home. A shining dark red garnet beer with a medium pinkish head ; medium retention. Red berries (cherry), red wine, vinegar, barnyard, wood. Light to medium sweet, medium to heavy dry sour refreshing, light bitter. Medium body, average texture, average to soft carbonation, fruity sour dry medium lasting finish. Overall, simply delicious. Very fruity, refreshing.
Bottle at Cantillon. Pours red color, small white head. Aroma of cherries, grapes, wine. Taste is sour, sour cherries, grapes.

F: thin, pink, quick gone.
C: red, hazy.
A: red fruits, red grapes, barnyard, woody, berries, vinous.
T: red grapes, horse blanket, barnyard, woody, berries, vinous, not so sour as the others Cantillons, medium body, good carbonation, good one, jug from the brewery owner.

0,75l bottle at home. Bottled 26.10.2015. bordeaux / pinkish quite cloudy color, small white head. smells of barnyard, dog poo, spices, light vinous, musty, nutty, marzipan, sweaty, some blue cheese. quite weird / rather unpleasant smell, but still kinda good. :P medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of green apples, grapes, light cherry notes, some wood, spices, rather barnyardy, a bit leathery, nutty, light marzipan, grassy. finishes quite dry and lightly sour with notes of barnyard, leather and some green apples. quite musty, actually rather weird smell, exptected a bit more but might store in the fridge for a couple days of breathing.
Jug from the brewery owner. A hint of sweetness remains to spice up the fresh grape fruitiness. Easy drinking, quite thin bodied, but very enjoyable with a clean lactic grapey finish.
Bottle 2013 at Himmeriget. Pours clear pale red with white head. Aroma of barnyard! Sweet fruits/grapes. Taste funky, barnyard, tart and dry, hint of sweet grapes. Super clean and crispy.
24 oct 2016, bottle. Hazy raspberry. Nose is raspberry or maybe grape, certainly musty. Thin body, dry, moderately fuzzy. Moderately tart, is probably still say raspberry over grape.

Fat på Akkurat på Zwanze Day. Djupröd, lätt disig med litet vitrosa skum. Frisk bärig doft av hallon, röd vindruva, röda vinbär, citronkoncentrat och stall. Välbalanserad, fyllig kropp med lagom torrhet och syrlighet. Friska bäriga toner i smaken med röda vinbär, röda vindruvor och fina, sträva ekfatstoner. Briljant god!

Draught at Akkurat. Zwanse Day 2016.
Deep hazy red.
Soft mix of tart red berries, cherries and dark grapes with soft oak and funk.
Taste is in the same line but its major feature is how smooth and nicely mixed it is. Super clean.
Medium, soft, soft and dry.
Super good.
caramel, basement aromas, hay, red berries, little oak, sweet. Well balanced. Complex. Medium dry. Medium sweet.

At Akkurat zwanze day 2016
Red, clear white head. 
Aroma cherry, cellar
Taste sour, medicin, cherry alcoholic.
Nice feel.

Grapefruit and grape husks. Some cherry and raspberry with light oak. Pinkish red pour with ok head and lacing. Light tangy finish. Big lambi bretta smell here. Bottle pour thanks to Matt at Sovereign.

750 mL bottle. Bottle dated 11/21/2010, I believe. Tough to read as its smudged. Originally reviewed 7/26/2012.
Murky/hazy pinkish purple. Not quite a burgundy. The head is gone before I even get a chance to look at it.
Acidic and musty grape smell. The fruit isnt a bright aroma, but rather a general aura of grape surrounding the lemongrass and other lambic aromas.

Sour, but not overly so. The grape flavor again isnt bright, but more of a background flavor cutting some of the acidity. Oak and tannins dry it out in the finish, but theres a deep musty character in the finish that comes across as a deep barnyard funk.

Heavyish, even though it really isnt. Lower carbonation. Drinks like a wine.

Not the most amazing fruit flavor Ive had in a lambic, but it certainly doesnt detract from the beer. I feel as though the Cantillon lambic profile calls for lighter fruits, a la Fou Foune.

Bouteille: Rosé coloured, nearly clear, big - but quickly collapsing - pinkish head, lively carbonation; solid dry fruity (a bit cherry-like) nose, presumably some wood underneath, distinctive cellary and bretty aromas in the background, malic and/or citric acid detectable as expected; solid dry - fortunately not extremely dry, as expected - sour flavour, medium bodied and - surprise - quite soft by Cantillon standards; dry sour-fruity finish, balanced by a little residual sweetness. Superb stuff, pretty well drinkable...

Draught at Akkurat. 
Pours red clear. 
Aroma of strawberries. 
Very fruity, balanced tartness and rather sweet. Grapes, raspberry and a little vanilla.
Bottleshare at EBBC, cloudy deep purple with a thin ring, clean acidic nose, puckering sourness with lemon and soft fruit emerging in the finish.

Bottle. Pours cherry in colour, very small head. Aroma of tart cherries, grapes, wood, green apples, barnyard. In taste sour with citrusy and berries flavour, notes of leather and light note of sour cucumbers (just in the back). The beer is light bodied, carbonation is high, the finish is very tart and dry. Great brew.

Keg @ Akkurat. Pours like a hazy red wine with a small pink/white head. Mild tart aroma, funky, barnyard, grapes, lactose, green apple and red vine vinegar. Really smooth and rounded mouthfeel medium carbonated. Fruity and tart taste, raspberries, ripe red grapes, ripe fresh figs, merlot vine is presented with a nice mature rounded oak barrel taste. Mild tart finish.
750ml bottle from Legacy. Bottled October 26, 2015. Tasting at Brians. Pours a hazy red grapes color with a white head. Medium carbonation. Aroma and taste are very red wine and fruity. Very good.

Meget smuk rødblå og ufiltreret Lambic Style / Fruit med minimal skumtop og kun kant samt overflade. Rolig. 
Dette brygs aroma er præget af en vinøs surhed henad rosévin og vindruer. Plus røde bær bl.a. kirsebær og hindbær. 
Smagen er sur og syrlig, men på en meget elegant og lidt stille måde og noter af træfadlagringen er tydeligt til stede. Vedhæftet en lille bitterhed og ligeså lille sødme. 
Munden snører sig sammen og mængden af mundvand øges - så ved man, at man er i Sour-land. Fint lidt afdæmpet karbonering og middel fyldig krop. En vis blød mundfølelse, olieret konsistens og en afbalanceret sur afslutning. 
Overall: Elegant frugt-Lambic og Cantillon lever op til sit rygte. Druer og fadlagring giver dette bryg et særkende, og blandt surøl er dette verdensklasse.
75 cl, flaske, 5.0 % ABV, Bottled: 28/10/15, BB: 28/10/2025, købt i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,75 Bottleshare. Thanks @Haavard ! - Slightly sour and funky aroma. Quite an unique characteristic. Vanilla, raisins and more funk. The flavor is incredibly complex with raisins, dry, expensive red wine. The aftertaste is quite balanced with notes of peach and apricot/papaya. Incredibly good. World Class.

15 botitle in 16. Muddled purple/maroon. Nose is grape skin and must, lightly cheesy funk. Taste is sour buy much less than I expected with lots of fruity fresh grape notes and young red wineye character. Very drinkable.
Flaska märkt 2013 på Himmeriget. Dimmig röd öl med lila inslag och lätt rosa skum. Doften är syrlig med inslag av brett, druvor och fat. I smaken tillkommer mjölksyra och druvskal.
Red bit hazy with medium pink head. Slightly sour aroma. Moderate sourness, not too strong, rich fruity notes. Some dry sweetness and bitter later. Tart fruity sourness in the aftertaste.
Not s lambic fan I am. But feels good one. Red color. Cloudy. Almost no cap. Sour cherry both in aroma and taste. Some grape nuances
From 75 cl bottle. Aroma of brett, grapes, red wine and oak. Red colour with pink head, not lasting. Taste is light+ sour. Light+ body, dry oily feel, wine finish.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 Red-purple color, white lacing. Funk, indistinct fruits, and musk. Mild sweetness and tartness. Light body, lively carb, and vinous texture.

Perfect blend of fruits, wine and lambic. Sour, tart and a bit sweet. Oak, wine and grapes clearly present. Fantastic!


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the Koelschip, Copenhagen, courtesy of FX. Poured a hazy reddish pink with a thin broken off white head. The aroma is big acid citrus, red berry fruit, yeast, mineral. The flavour is moderate sour with a smooth, flavourful, fruity yeast acid vinous palate. Light bodied with soft carbonation. Super smooth and lots of fruit. A big funky lambic.

The aroma of cherries and red currants. The taste is quite similar. Quite right amount of flavor. Good bitterness which fills the upper part of the mouth a weak moment. It becomes more acidic to end. But good anyway. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
One of the best Cantillons. Deep purple with moderate head. The nose is dense grape aroma with wood and dark fruit. Mouth feel is heavier than most lambics and it is very complex.

Thanks for sharing @Klimaet. pour intense red colored without head. light aroma notes of, black current, and rasberrys, taste medium to heavy sour, with sweet notes. lots of tannins medium bodied, lively carbonation.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hazy red amber pour with thin light pink head. Sour cherries, grapes, grape stones, woody, young green, berries, strawberry, apricot, brier. Over medium sour, medium mineral/salty and sweet underlaying. Soft smooth chalky texture, light bubbly carbonation, very nice.

Birra acida maestosa. Aromi di vino, uva e fragole. In bocca é ben bilanciata con una punta di acido lattico e di salato che fanno contrappunto alla caratteristica acidità.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle shared by Rask0lnikov, thanks a lot! Bottled 28.10.2015. Beautiful purple-red colour, bright. Horseblanket and manure, sweet dark grapes and bitterish grape skin, wood, red wine, apples and cherries. Acidic, tart, fruty, dusty and woody dry. Apple vinegar or balsamic acid in the throat. Mellow crispness, yet somewhat sticky. I really appreciate this, and Im glad I got to try it, but Im not falling in love. Perhaps because of the dryness and acidity - and yea I know its supposed to be like this. It is very good still, and Id love to try it again one day.

750ml (thanks Raskolnikov). Clear ruby red color. Burnt rubber, acidic, faint leather, grape must and faint acetone in aroma. Sour, red grape skins, sweetish, fruity, bit of sweet cherries in taste. Sharp and yet mellow. Nice balance. I like it.

Bottle, shared by rask0lnikov, thanks. Pours red with beige pinkish head. The head stays. Aroma is sour, funky, grapes, horse manor, fruits. Flavor is sour, grapes, fruits, funky, red berries, somewhat acidic. Overall: great brew.

Shared by Rasmus. Deep red beer, small white head. Nose is wet horse blanket, barnyard, manure, tart notes, grapes. Flavor is tart, grapes, grape skins, fruit, mild bitterness. Tart and dry finish, almost vinous, apple skins, red berries. Lingering mild balsamico in the throat. Tart, balanced, characteristic, dry, lovely.

Redwine like color with pinkish fast disappearing head, funky barnyard and grape aroma with slightly sour touch, taste is fruit, grape, some barnyard with little smooth sourness and little to no bitterness, nice vinelike mouthfeel, smooth carbonation

28/10/2015 Vintage which was consumed in March 2016. I bought this beer directly from the brewery. I had one at the brewery and took three home and this is now my third bottle consumed at home. 

AROMA: Berries and mild funk of the horse blanket type. 

APPEARANCE: Creme de la creme. This thing really does look unreal. It poured with a very light pink head which forms into a thin ring. Its translucent with a pinkish hue.

TASTE: Grapes. Grape skin. Lambic.Funk. 

PALATE: Gentle, sophisticated, pure. Poetic. Sourish. Finishes with a dry pleasant astringents which seems like a tannic combination of grape skin and oak.

OVERALL: World class material.

75cl bottle at home, bottled 21/10/2014. Beautiful murky pinkish red colour, foamy light pink head. Funky and highly tard nose and taste, cherry and vinous fruity reminiscent of Rodenbach. Aftertaste lingers nicely, tard and fruity too. Light-medium body, low carbonation.

Butelka. Rocznik 2014.
Kolor mętny i ciemno czerwony, piana jest różowa, ale szybko znika. Typowe dla lambika. 
Aromat bardzo stajenny, dziki jak tylko można, winny, jest też trochę octu. Po zamieszaniu wychodzą winogrona, agrest, ziemistość, beczka dębowa. Po dokładniejszym wwąchaniu się, przy ogrzanym piwie, wychodzi fajny zapach słodkich owoców, kojarzący się z dojrzałym czereśniami, słodkimi winogronami. 
Smak jest średnio kwaśny, ale w górnych granicach zakresu, jest też spora słodycz octu winnego. Wytrawność wysoka, lekko ściągająca. W smaku mamy ocet winny, trochę kieszonki, skórki winogron, niedojrzały agrest, kwaśne wiśnie, lekko zaznaczony kwas mlekowy. Posmak wytrawny, kwaśny, cytrynowy, przewija się też ocet i dębina. Ciało dosyć pełne, ostra faktura, wysycenie średnie. Bardzo smaczne, ale po Cantillon jednak spodziewam się więcej. Sporo przykrywa ocet, dodatkowo dosyć pali w przełyku.

2012 bottle sent by bytemesis way back when. Thanks a bunch Mike! Pours a hazy rose-amber with a small fuschia/copper tinged head. Breaks into spotty lacing. Aromas are loaded with oak, red white, some vinegar, barnyard, light hay, light floral. Taste is a full-on assault of the palate. Has a lot of vinous character. Oaky, light acidic wine grape note, light dry-Brett with a balance of sour Lacto/wild Pedio. Really nice character that showcases the merlot aspect nicely. Finish is long and has plenty more oak and funk to couple with light bitter and light acidic notes. A fine offering from Cantillon. Top shelf!

duft: sur mandelmel masipan rød duft.
smag: frisk rød frugt. bær sur funkey stikkelsbær. krisebær

Keg at La Capsule, Lille, France. Clouded red to brown with white head. There is a fruity sweetness which is cut through by a tannin tartness. Woody notes, sharp and tangy, rich on the palate. Very pleasant.

0.75 l bottle at RBBWG 2016 in Antwerpen. Slightly hazy, golden reddish amber with a white head. Sweetish, sourish, fruity aroma of red grapes, vinegar and some oak. Sweet-sourish, fruity aroma of red grapes, some oak and vinegar, followed by a short, slightly bitter, tart finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent and astringent mouthfeel. Great!

75cl bottle shared at Uiltje Bar. Somewhat hazy red/dark pink with almost no head. Light to medium body with low carbonation. Nice sourness with subtle sweet tones. Ripe fruits, oak, grapes, tart, red wine and spices. Very good.
Ruby red colour. Nice pinkish head. Aroma of red wine, hay and wood. Red wine at first. Fresh red grapes. Really nice silky mouth feel. Red grapes and hints of oak in the end. This blows your mind.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2016 Update: drank again with SlovakSniper. So good, so fruity. Perfect mouthfeel. Perfect break between a few imperial stouts. Perfect palate. To me this one of the best best Cantillon. old rating: 750ml bottle from trade with Fred and shared with wife on this Valentines day. 2014 cork, lot B. Aroma: woody, dusty, nose of funky red grapes, tartness. App: hazy pinkish, small white head, no retention as expected. Taste and palate: light body, quite dry, sweet fruits, soft to no carbonation, medium acidity finish. Overall: this is impressively dry. I want to drink a full glass of water after each sip but I dont mind. I, in fact, like it. The lack of carbonation is well hidden behind this harsh dryness. Pretty good. So fruity and good.
Meest perfecte bier dat ik ooit gedronken heb. Echt mijn lievelingsbier! Kan dit blijven drinken!

Poured into a wineglass showing well filtered dark rose red with a head of clear white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of malt with bretty funk and very subtle notes of dark fruit typical of red wine - think plums, boysenberries, and cassis. 

The palate is moderately carbonated and medium bodied. A moderate tartness throughout with a slight tannic astringency. Red wine bitterness on the finish. After the initial flavors, the dark fruit flavors come forward upon the linger and stay on the palate for a long finish.
Shared bottle. Pours a somewhat hazy reddish purple with a small pink head. Aroma of tart fruit and funk. Taste is tart grapes, apples, funk, and oak. Delightful.

75cl bottle. Pours a deep violet, hazy, with a light violet head. Smells acrid, of vinegar, macerated grapes, apple cider, caramel. Very one-dimensional taste, sour, with notes of macerated fruit, funky lambic, vinegar. A well done lambic, I just thought Id feel the grapes more.

2013 bottle aquired in a trade in Brussels. Pours a slightly hazy beautiful purplish pink with a light pink head. Aromas of musty basement, funky cheese, vinegar, cherries, vanilla, wet grain, red wine. Taste is medium high sourness. Right at the upper end of what I enjoy. Finishes fairly clean. Able to keep drinking. This was one of my favorite Cantillons. Quite nice.

May 29, 2015. Bottles, vintage 2007 and 2014.

2007 version: 
Cloudy brownish red with an off-white head. Aroma is funky with leather, barnyard and cellar notes, tart, light sweet and deep fruity notes. Taste is soft tart, vinous and funky. Soft tart finish with grape, green apples, funky cellar, barnyard with some damp cellar and wet wood notes. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation, soft dry texture. 
9-4-8-4-17=43


2014 version: 
Deep red with a white head. Aroma is fruity with juicy and tart grapes, some apple, oak, lemon, soft funky barnyard. Taste is sour fruity, dry tannins and some funky notes. Finish is dry, sour with grape skins, green apples, tannins, vinous with some barnyard notes. Medium bodied, average carbonaton, dry texture. 
8-4-8-4-17=41


2014 has a much more vibrant fruity note whereas the 2007 is more funky with some cellar, leather and wet wood notes. Also less tart, more complex and rounded mouthfeel than 2007, which is no surprise considering the aging. Both are great but prefer the older one.
Bottle @ Cantillon 15/5-15. Fruity with grapes and red berries, also bretty and vineous with oak and some lacto. Dry finish.

Dégustée en compagnie de Mademoiselle Irina en accompagnement dun cassoulet maison. Tête typiquement lambique qui ne tient pas. Mon verre de bière ressemble vite à un verre de jus rouge. Nul besoin nest dapprocher le loquide de mon visage pour en respirer les parfaites arômes. Un vieux baril de vin oublié suant dans le grenier dune grange de campagne. Cest funky à souhait, plein de jus de raisins, acétique, pourri, bactérien... Dune infinie richesse. Liquide bien acétique, fruité... Ce fruit! La Signature de la Maison est notable. Le liquide est acide et le lambic caresse tant mes papilles que ma gorge en le réchauffant de cette douce touche de raisin rouge. Sage, intelligente, structurée et dominante, cette bière commande tant le respect que ladmiration.
Dark red-purple pour. Red grapes, syrupy body, medium-high acidity / medium sour. Good full body. Notes of grape, maybe plums, raisins. Great.

Aroma of berries and cellar winery. Taste Vinicius and funky with mild tartness. Fairly carbonated, more so than may I have had. I believed the carbonation helped out the grape must as the Merlot grapes fro fruit lambic so can be more subdued. I though overall it was a great balance.

Un nez franchement irréprochable : dune complexité que jai très rarement vue! Le raison rouge côtoit les arômes sauvages à merveille. Le fruité et le sauvage entrent en synergie. Dune orange foncé/rosé, le liquide est un peu moins foncé que ce que jimaginais. La mousse, typique dune belle gueuze de ce calibre, est petite mais soyeuse et étincellante. Limpession en bouche, bien que sûrette, nest jamais exagérée. Le raisin est ici très présent et prend peut-être un peu trop de place pour quelquun qui, comme moi, préfère en général les gueuzes non fruitées. La complexité du nez ne se retrouve pas assez en bouche et ça me déçoit un tout petit peu. Quoique le dernier verre a été le meilleur : je me fait tout le temps avoir... À ne pas boire trop froide!!

Spina @ eurhop.
Rossa senza schiuma.
Acida, limone, leggero acetico.
Vinosa un po di botte.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Mi4i

(Cantillon Saint Lamvinus) Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas during Zwanze Day, 20 ml into a tumbler.deep ruby red colour on the body, slightl hazy, with a small pinkish head on top. 
Lots of red grapes and vinous notes on the aroma.
Nicely sour taste, red grapes, wood, vinous notes.
Medium thin body, a bit high carbonation.
Good, expected a bit more to be honest.

bottle at the brewery
wan gold greenish with thin bubbley lacing, sharp, tart with some white grape fruitiness, well melded grape and beer character, quite smooth,

Aroma of redcurrants, cherry, raspberry, plum, with a soft herbal complexity. Taste is not so tart, but with clear tannin, funk, leather, earthy with a berry layer on top, very nice, a bit salty, like calciumchloride,

Tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, vintage 2014, ABV 7%. Pours a dark ruby red with a decent, reddish head. Aroma is sulfur, eggs, not very nice. Taste is sour, red berries, balsamic vinegar, light cherry, caramel. Sour and good.
Bottle at La Fine Mousse. Poured bright red purple no head. Aroma musky funk dry red grape wine. Light carb med bod. Tastes semisweet dry red wine astringent.

Bottle. Pours all hazy deep red with slight purple shine, very nice 1 finger light pink head, fizzy. Aroma is crazy delicious. Packed eyes grapes and merlot. Cherie candy, raspberries, oak, vanilla, red wine and tannins. Light wheat, some yam, fruity, yet dry brett, Cantillon funk, leather, subtle barnyard. Taste is super fresh, fruity and tart. Really sour, some lemon and lime, lactic acidity, funk, sour cherries, sweet grapes and raspberry yam. Candy at first. Packed with red grapes and oak, almost spicy oak. Fruity most grapes turns more towards red wine. Fizzy body and oaky tannins in finish. Wood and long tart finish, ever-lasting. Really dry oak and brett. Best Cantillon Ive had so far...

2014 from bottle to glass. Red hue with delicate pink head that dissipated. Aroma is wine, lactic, oak, straw, sweat. Mouthfeel is refreshing with a light body and zesty carbonation. Taste is dry with a tart following. Overall this is a nice brew.

Pours a beautiful deep rubine with pink head. The smell is must, red grapes, hearty crispness. The taste is red wine, wood, tart fruit, ending dry and fruity crisp. Light in body with elegant carbonation. Great stuff!!

Pours red with a small head.
Nose shows musty red wine barrels, lots of funk and woody oak.
Similar flavours: musty, woody oak, berry notes, soft red wine and a little astringency.

On tap at bier Markt. Pours hazy pale red with appetizing whitish pink head. Nose is funky oak, cherries some lactic acidic notes. Lots of tartness, long lactic finish that just resonates. Yeah, way to be

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle in the garden, 18th July 15. Pours clear and clean, aroma, vinous, some tart cherry, straw, funk, the taste is complex, grape, not too sour, massive flavour, straw, base geuze on the finish, love it!

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2016 Blåbær street tasting 2015. Pours muddy reddish, with a fine head. Aroma of red grape, horse, tart, funk. Taste is grape, tart, funk, very clean, very refreshing.wauw

Rerate Bullerup puppen cheers mads. Pours couldy reddish with a fine white head. Aroma of funk, barnyard, grapes, redgrapes, sour, horseblanjet, tarty. Taste is very tart, jammy, fruity, barn. Sour finish, very well balanced and without popcorn and sesam. World class

Bottle @ moeder lambic. Slightly hazy red, reddish head, some lacing. Aroma, red berries, red wine notes, apples, cherry candy. Taste, red wine, apples, grass, citrus, lime, . Dry mouth feel. Light fine carbonation.

Bottle, 2012 ed. Pours cloudy brown/ruby. No retention/lace. Aroma of grape, funk, barrel, berry, dust. Taste is tart, funky, earth, vinous, berry, dust. Palate is soft, slick, tart finish. Excellent.
29/03/14. 75cl bottle, thanks to k0mpsa. Cloudy dark brown color with light red head. Nose has exotic fruits and red berries. Sour taste, grapes, some sweet berries with lenghty finish.
Bottle shared at Anchorage tasting group Jun 15: Poured a dark reddish with a white thin head. Aroma is strong funky grapes and fruit. Taste is tongue twisting sour with loads of fruit tang.
2013 bottle. Sour, with oak and grape character. Crisp, dry, tart and refreshing.
Pours a hazy reddish color with off-white head. Red blend wine like aromas on the nose with some funk and tartness; follows onto the palate. Finishes tart and dry.
Mild grape sourness. Slight green apple. Sour Mellon in aftertaste. Crisp dry finish with some white wine character.

Bottle at Cantillon. Pour is murky red/purple with a small pink head. Aroma and flavor of grape vines, cherries, wood, slight barnyard, and acidic grapes. Finish has a bit of salt/vinegar in it but it is masked nicely by the sour red grapes. Good.

Red light muggy color with no foam. The smell is light sour and a tiny bit grapy. The taste is moderately sour for a cantillon and has a light blurry feeling on the tounge. Dry and sour aftertaste. Very pleasant.

Bottled November 21 2010. Clear chrystalline seemingly confected red glow in colour. Nose of sharp must, cherry and fermented grape wrapped in cheese cloth. Gentle acidic lip smacking tartness followed by more extreme elements of red currant,cherry, wood and wild yeast.Leaves a lingering puckering chewiness in the mouth. An experience.
Bottle (750 ml) @ Cantillon 150515. Fruity, bretty and vinous with red grapes and cherries, some woody notes, sour, medium body with a watery texture. The finish is dry, sour and fruity.
Bottle at Cantillon - Pours red. Lots of grapes in the nose plus lemons, sour and tart. The taste is jammy, grapes, acidic

Bottle boxing bottle share May v pac. Dark red colour. Aroma is lots of dark red fruits acidic notes. Taste very sour red fruits acidic lots of mouthwatering sours woody dry bitter in in the finish. Nice mouthfeel. Very good this.

May vs pac boxing night. Bottle shared with Richthevillan and s_hartshorne. Burgundy beer with small head. Aroma of light cherry drops and some funk. Taste is cherry, funk and blackberrys. Nice palate. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Friends of Ham, Leeds. Dark pink, with a light haze. Fine halo of pale pink head. Softly sour, black grape. Cherry stone woodiness. Not massively complex, but very juicy, and inviting. Taste is lightly acetic. Not far off bone dry, apart from a hint of sweetness on the lips. Very refreshing, easy drinking, and clean. Lovely balance of flavours. The barrel ageing comes through right at the end. Could drink this all day.
Bottle to glass at Chez Moeder. Pours a beautiful ruby red color with a slight pinkish head. Aroma and flavor are a wonderful mix of sour and sweet, excellent grape character. Very nice beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Dark red with pinkish head. Dark red fruity aroma with that typical Cantillon barnyard fun. Quite fruity taste with some red berries, funky barnyard, tart grapes and dark grape finish.

750 ml, bottled 22 October 2014, from a trade with Orson0368. Thanks a lot Paul!
Wine red to purple, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, fizzy, pink head, that dissipates to a small, stable ring.
Fresh, complex aroma of barnyard, mild cheese, sour grapes, sweet berries, green apples, wine, barrel notes, subtle malt sweetness.
Taste is sour, dry, with wine barrel notes, barnyard, sour grapes, sour berries, earth, sweet and sour apples, some sugar.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average, fizzy carbonation.
Finishes complex again, sour, dry, wooden, somehow salty, but also a bit sweet, fruity and wine like.

Very tasty. The nose is the highlight for me, fresh and really complex, where you get more and more aromas the longer you put your nose in. The taste is more common, sour and dry, really well balanced and with nice wine barrel notes. One of the best Lambics Ive had so far.

750ml bottle shared at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Dark reddish unclear color with off white - pinkish head. Tart, funky aroma, wineous, barnyard, fruity, wood. Light sweet and acidic taste, tart fruity funky, wineous and wood again. Light oily body with soft carbonation.

Reddish color with a minimal and medium to quick diminishing white head. Aroma is tart, with notes of grapes, wine and sour. Flavor is slightly sweet, slightly barrel notes and vinous and fruits. Light sweetness on palate with medium sourish mouthfeel. Very enjoyable beer!!

Pours a transparent burgundy red with a pink head which soon recedes to a formation of bubbles. Aroma is very rustic - barnyard, basement aromas, earthy, horse blanket and grape skin. Taste is barnyard, funk, light sourness of lemons and tartness of green apples, slight red grape. Long and sour finish. Full body with light-medium carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2015 Bottled October 2014. Red color with small pink head that goes down quickly. Funk and tartness, grapes, oak, refreshing. Nice full body feeling. Not too sour, nice carbonation. Amazing! Wow!

Bottle @ home watching House of Cards:-) deep red body with a small pink head. Aroma is grapes, oak, tart, funk, wine vinegar, fruity, yeast. Flavour is tart, fruity, grapes, oak, vinegar, basement, yeast. Wow This is so delicious. Im officially a huge fan of Cantillon now!

On tap at Moeder Lambic.
Dark pink with a head that reduces quickly.
Aroma: veyr sour and funky. 
Taste: very complex, a high degree of "verwovenheid" (sorry for the Dutch). Sour, fruity, very hard to describe. 
Finish: long and very sour, only just on the right side of the border of being too acidic. Excellent!

Rating 1000 at my fathers birthday. Hazy dark red with small light pink head. Funky, dead leaves, yoghurt, elderberrries and grapes, young red wine, oak tannins, berry pits. Medium tart, a hint of sweetness and light to medium bitter finish. Medium bodied with nice fresh feeling carbonation. Very nice.

07/03/2015 18cl sample from 75 cl bottle @ Nuetnigenough popup ACBF 2015, Vichte. Thanks Pieter for sharing
Red colour with small pink head. Aroma : fruitiness all over, sourness. Taste : berries, grapes, wood, sourness.
Six ounce pour from Pangaea at Shelton Bros. night, mild fruity aroma, slight blanket, medium, disappearing, foamy head. Slight tartness with grape finish.
HMOG 2015. Despite the hype, all cantillions ive had a great and a treat to try. This one is no excpetion. Floral, berries, lightly tart, some funk, fruity. Dry. Interesting.

Bottle, 13, split a few ways. Rating #900. Slightly hazy dark red pour with a small head. Nose has some funk, lots of berries, grapes, leather and light balsamico. Taste is smooth, moldy, grapes, blueberries, dusty, funk and some leathery notes. Delicious stuff!

Pours a hazy ruby tinged tea color with an off white head and decent lacing. Aroma is tart with some barnyard and wine grapes. Some mild sweetness at the beginning that is overtaken by a moderate vinegar sourness. Some grape and raspberry flavor along with some wood and a mild funk. Mouthfeel is crisp with a light/medium body and high carbonation. Very good.

Color of cranberry juice no head. Smells of tart grape, sour, perm, candy. Taste is sour bubbly rush, grape, cranberry, red wine, that finishes dry with a vanilla caramel taste with a little woodiness. Refreshing with a good sour that finishes with some sweetness and barrel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2015 bottle. Hazy raspberry red color. Aroma is raspberry vinegar, tart and fart. Taste is pomegranate and raspberry tartness with a little sweetness in the beginning. Vanilla and wood flavor with some grape skin. Fizzy and dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Backlogging, notes from memory. Bottle shared at Mikkeller Bar. Purple burgondy pour with a small film of head. The nose was very in-your-face sour, about as vinous as they get, berries and oak. Taste was great, red grapes, funky and mouth-puckeringly sour. Lingering vinous and oaky taste.

Bomber to a snifter for my Bday. Clear deep ruby red with frothy pink head and minimal lacing. Merlot grape, Brett funk and oakiness. Plenty of fruit up front, then dank with a tart sour finish. Best lambic I have had to date.

Bottle from the brewery, 2014 vintage. Dfificult to open - fresh cork! Pours pink-purple, light white head. Rotting raspberries and soft berry fruit aroma, hint of sweat. Tart, medium sourness, some sweet fruity jamminess, berries, tannic grape skin, some slightly cheesy funk.

2012 btl - from cellar
Looks... rouge red, sml head reduces to ring around the glass producing a fine lacing.
Smells..lambic dank characters and loads of floral grape presence.
Tastes..refreshing, grapes from light bodied merlot, blending with more rounded sour lambic characteristics and finishing with a real oakyness. Outstanding #Cantillon greatness

Bottle fresh from the brewery. Bottled 22 october 2014. Pours a very sirupy viscosey pink red, murky. No sound during pouring even & hardly any carbonation! Interesting! Pinkish tiny head. I smell raspberry marmelade, forest fruit, some carbo hits the nose... And slight oak and tannins. Very soft to the palate and mildly sour & fruity in aftertaste. Slight sour Grape at first, then raspberry and some cherry pop up, followed by sugarry strawberry jam. Love the melassey structure, will age beautifully but should be tasted fresh from the counter too. Compare! The Saint Lamvinus is a beauty; soft, complex and different! Maybe misses some carbo, but its real nice for a change. Perfect to pair with certain meat dishes; skip the red wine.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours ruby, nose is blackcurrant, berry, taste is fruity, dry, funky.
Nice grape aroma. Amazing deep purple Red colour. Horseblanket Red vinous grape taste. Not realy dry in the aftertaste-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Vintage 2013, vieillit un an. Très fruitée. Jai détecté un goût dolives vertes lors des 2-3 premières gorgées mais cela sest estompé par la suite. Le goût du raisin est très présent. Léquilibre avec le côté acidulé des lambics est parfait. Une des meilleures de Cantillon.
Sampled during RBSG. From notes. Fruity and funky with a long, dry finish.

Bottle from Cantillon. Red color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, acidic notes, toast, sour apple, earthy notes and tannins. Sour finish with toast, sour apple, acidic notes and tannins. Excellent lambic.

Schöne rote Farbe durch die Merlot-Trauben, fruchtig-säuerlicher Geruch, eigentlich weniger nach Trauben. Der Antrunk ist vollmundig-mild, angenehm säuerlich. Zum Hauptteil toll lambic-typisch trocken und dabei treten auch die ersten Frucht-Töne auf. Zum Nachgeschmack hin wird auch die angenehme Note roter Trauben deutlicher, dabei angenehm säuerlich und herb. Der Nachgeschmack ist lang anhaltend, sehr angenehm mild-saauer mit rotem Traubenunterton.  → mal wieder ein klasse Cantillon-Bier!! 15/12/14/15

5oz. pour at the Flying Saucer St. Louis. It poured a nice red color with a small white head. The aroma was funky tart cherry, raspberry and light oak. The taste was very tart cherry, grape, sour apple and a long tart finish. Just awesome.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2015 Bottle. Pours deep dark hazy red with a thick white head. Aromas of tart, dark red berries. Raspberry, cherries, red grapes. Lots of red wine notes and alot of sourness, some leather and funk. Taste is tart rich red berries up front, dry oaky notes, funk, slight barnyard, leather, vinous notes, balsamico. God damn, this beer!

(2013 bottle @ barVolo for Zwanze Day, Sept 20 2014) Lightly hazed dark rosé colour with a lacy pink-white head. Aroma of red wine, grape, bitter herbs, barnyard funk. On the palate, acidic red fruit wine character, woody, slightly spicy herbs, drying and barrel/tannic red wine quality in the finish, There is fruit sweetness at the core. Feels like some hop bittering and something like light grain in the aftertaste. Medium bodied with high active carb. Very harmonious combination of fruit and barrel with the underlying lambic, this is a fantastic sipper that sits somewhere between a fruit lambic and a stronger-flavoured rose wine and is probably better than most examples of either.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2015 750ml bottle served in a tulip glass. 
A: First of all, beautiful bottle art. Beautiful label in a nice corked and capped bottle. Pours a slightly hazy dark pinkish color forming a medium and very bubbled fizzy pink head. Low retention and practically no lacings left in the glass. 
S: Very fruity nose. Strong notes of grapes, oak and red wine. Tart with some notes of sweet malt. Lambic Brett yeasts. Metallic hints. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront that becomes quickly sour and light bitter. A very fruity, tart and dry ale. Strong notes of grapes. Grapes vinegar. Lambic yeasts. Metallic finish.
M: Light body. Medium carbonation. Tart and fruity aftertaste. Again, strong and persistent notes of grapes.
O: Very drinkable beer. Just another amazing Cantillon... 
[ BA Review @ 1/30/2010 ]

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 Cantillons red grape lambic, referring to a 19th-century tradition from Hoeilaart where grapes were and are still grown, but where lambic has ceased to exist since then. This product is made in very limited quantities and not easy to find on the Belgian market. It is a ravishing purple red beauty with lilac foam and champenoise sparkles, very complex, extremely fruity, lovely funkiness, and one of the most elegant lambics I ever tasted, though I do prefer the white grape version called Vigneronne over this (but only very slightly so).

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Dark red. Dark red fruity nose, barnyard, funk, the cantillon flavour. Very nice nose. Quite pronounced fruits, not as much as a kriek, but stull notecable berryness. Dry tart body, wonderful dark grape finish. Really nice. Probably the best fruited cantillon Ive had. Its more dark harmoneous fruity than krieks or otherd.-- bb
Incredible opaque plum color and yeasty vinegar aroma. Has a well developed sour flavor with sweet notes and a slight fizz long finish.

Bottle from Edmunds Oast. Amber red pour with some pinkish highlights and a bubbly white head. Big aroma of layered deep yeast funk, sourdough, pizza shop, hay, lemons zest, plums, dark fruits, oak and wine. Complex flavor of oak wood, dark fruits, yeast funk, pizza shop, sourdough, lemon zest and citrus. Medium bodied and wonderful carbonation. So fucking delicious.

Shared pint in Homosibaris bar. Dark red color beer with a strong aroma of wine and fruits. This was my first Lambic beer and was an amazing experience. For sure I will drink it again combined with some cheese or ham.
Shared bottle at home. Pours red with pale pink head. Aroma of red berries and hay. Taste sour with a little sweetness. Tart, fresh, little body. (White)wine aftertaste.

Fresh red colour, foam is white which lasts quite long.
Smell is fresh sour, kinda barnyard smell. Also a little sweetness to it.
Mouthfeel is nice, tart. Medium body. Carbonation is little. 
Very nice fruit lambic. A good combination between the lambic and the grapes. Taste is sour as well as a little sweet. Aftertaste is like a red whine.
This is a beer you should have had.

"from wish list. Sweet funky cheesy aroma of berry-ish fruit. Body is fizzy at first but turns a little flat. Flavor is nice. Very complex...less cheese, more lemony tart in the mouth. Nice sweet-tart finish. Not among their best, but quite enjoyable."

Bottle shared by Dan at the Pig. Small snifters. Pours an amazing dark red with an ample lasting head. Some small lacing. The aroma is funky yeasts, oak barrels, red wine, fermented grapes, and apricots. The taste was so good with the red grapes, tart funky yeasts, oak barrel, and tannins. Perky, sprite, and funky finish. Light body, crisp. Somewhat dry. Very good.
UPDATED: SEP 21, 2014 Sour and funk smell. Medium carbonation with light foam. Vinous sour that is half acetic and half lactic.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade, july 24th 2014. Clear dark red body with a white pink tinted head. Nice. Aroma of red grapes, wood, barnyard, resembling red wine a bit. Taste is quite sour, cherries, grapes, again a bit wineish, long tart sour berry finish. Lovely!

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Limpido color vinaccia con fragile velo di schiuma rosata. Aroma acetico ma non pungente con sentori di uva, lievito e cantina. Gusto acidulo, vinoso e rotondo con spiccate note di uva e un finale asciutto dove compaiono luppolo e legno da botte. Corpo medio-lieve, effervescenza vivace, struttura vellutata: ottimo lambic!

Taylors birthday tasting! Ruby ted pink pour not much head. Aroma of cheese funk and light raspberry red fruit. Tastes same with sour dry blue cheese and funk. Red fruit jam over cheese funk. Good stuff, a bit simplistic but very cohesive. A fine beer for sharing with friends.

750 mL bottle, 2011 vintage, shared by jackl at the WWGT2D2U? tasting, 5/29/14. Pours a murky berry color with a large creamy off-white head. Good head retention. Aroma of intense funk, tart jammy fruits, pepper, horseblanket. The taste is intense tartness, jammy fruits, pepper, funk, wood, an almost musty note. Medium bodied, high carbonation, lingering tartness. Exceptional.

On tap at Mikkeller SF. Pours a nice purple-red with matching foam. The aroma is strong barn, grass, wine, and funk aromas. The flavor is tart wine and and fruit flavors up front leading to a nice sour finish over a medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2014 Apologies for my own feelings and sensitivities but theyve been insulted by this beer that is overwhelmed by enteric flavours. Drain pour. This is the same beer people are loving and raving about here in the same room. To me, this beers very strong bathroom aromas are insurmountable. I prefer beers with Brett and lactic acid bacteria character and not dominated by a wall of enteric.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2014 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Dégustation super délicieuse. Elle offre un nez assez complexe ample développant des senteurs de rasin rouge, de barrique avec une amertume herbacée et une pointe de levure argileuse. La bouche est super bien équilibrée entre les malts, le merlot et lacidé: le tout envahit le palais avec un égale bonheur. Le corps malté assez doux et rond goûte le raisin rouge suret accompagné de saveurs boisé se finissant sur une amertume surette minérale avec une belle longueur. Du pipi de Jésus! Jen reveux!!
75 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark red with an off-white head that leaves no lacing. Aroma and flavour are red berries, grapes, vinegar, oak, red wine, and sweet malt - with a tart finish.

on cask @ La Capsule, Lille - FR. Color: clear red beer with no carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: acid nose with grapes and red fruits as raspberry. Taste: nice sour taste with good balance of fruit. Really tasty and with a good balance. Not so sour. Aftertaste: fruity taste, strawberry and raspberry.

Shared bottle with a friend. Poured a light purple red colour with a non lasting white head. Full aroma of grapes, apples, tart, oak, vineous notes, Brett, light carbonated, with a full sour mouthfeel combined with some sweet fruity grapes. Very complex! Awesome beer! Delicious

pours hazy burgundy-purple with a tall frothy off-white-purplish head, good retention and lacing. tart cherries and appreciable funk - kind of like plastered cherries, reminiscent of krieks; light acidity - lactic, citric and quite acetic too - ruins a bit my pleasure, very astringent and vinous, fruity phenolic esters, pepper and other spices. lively carbonation, light body - never watery, dry, fairly tart and grassy-spicy finish. very nice and tasty but the best cantillon fruit lambic.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015 Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Bottle at Jeremys very sour tasting. Thanks Matt. Lots of red grape and sour. Doesnt have the funk or acidity I was expecting.
Amazing gueuze lambic, very complex and full of different tastes, so enjoyable, very sour, grains, cereals, wild fruity and flowery notes. Grapes. Niceeeee again, uau!
Slight grape, wetting oak, slight pond water, wonderful sour with oak receiving a second run in the end. Fabulous example.

Bottle share.... Thanks, Mar!!! Aroma is sour with some hints towards grape. Appearance is purple with pink foam. Taste is sour with grape undertones. Palate is sour as balls. Overall, a great beer. Wish I could have it all the time.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cheesy, funky, toe jam raspberry nose. Cloudy rose, medium pink head. Intensely sour, less funky, but still feety, more fruity, oaky raspberry. Tannic., but lots of wild character.

Pours a crystal clear ruby red with a fat finger of pink head diminishing gradually to a thin skim and minimal lacing. Nose is tart cherries, apple cider vinegar, vinous oak and barnyard funk. Taste is tart berry (cherry and grape) with a perfect balance of sweet and sour, slight oak and funk on the finish. Mouth feel is light and lively, with a persistent prickly carbonation and a great dry finish.

Wow. Even better than the Cantillon Kriek. The flavour is less intense, but more complex. Beautifully restrained tartness and wonderful fruity sweetness. Unlike the Kriek, I dont get the impression of exuberant youth and the promise of future improvement; rather, its perfect just as it is.

Pours a dark red with a medium pink head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of fruits (white grapes?!), lemons, hay and light wet socks. Taste is dry and fruity, tart cherries is what I would have said but fine, merlot grapes. This is pretty subtle and not completely unlike the best oude krieks Ive had. It is not too acid like most oude krieks, though. This is really classy. Body is light, carbonation medium-high. Mouthfeel is fortunately vinous. Finish offers some grapes and raw wheat. A great libation! P.S. Grape character gets more evident as it warms.

Bottiglia da 75 cl 2013, colore rosso rubino con una schiuma poco persistente, lodore richiama subito vino e mosto, al sapore altrettanto insieme alle note di legno delle botti di fermentazione. Un capolavoro
Nose is cherry, decent dry yeast, weak bitter almond, feel is watery, taste is decent mediumdry cherry, some urinal cakes,

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 Cloudy ruby red, bloody red. Aroma of very young green apple, sour grapes, citrus and basket of cherries. Interesting flavours with soft cherry-plum aftertaste. One of my favorite Cantillons.
Bottle @ Home. One of my favorites. Lots of dark berries, grapes jam and vinous oaky bitterness. The acidic sourness and Cantillon funk is as always present.

Clear amber body with low frosty head. Aroma has cherry sourness with woody character, light wine oak notes too. Taste has high sweet sourness with woody after taste. Body is full, low carbonation. Pretty dry.

Corked and capped 750 ml from Tipples dated October 31, 2013. Pours a super bright almost neon purplish pink color with a massive fizzy pink head that recedes quickly. Lots of vinegar on the aroma, berries, vinous notes, and an interesting mint leaf that I get from Geueze and Faro sometimes. Really nice. The flavor is sweet berries and wine, vinegar, sourness, some dry oaky presence, and maybe even a little vanilla. The fruit doesnt overpower here which is nice. Light bodied, spritzy carbonation, dry finish with some wine like warmth on the way down. Beautiful beer.
At quintessence. Red colour with white head. Fruity, brett, wine aroma. Sweet, fruity, wine, grape taste, with some brett. Medium body.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2016 75cl bottle shared by the Italian canzone crew @NachtvdGrote Dorst, Eizeringen 25/04. Pours an appealing milky deep pink with pastel rosé froth. Lucent aromas of mature ruby grapes, sedate funk and balsamico rosso. Taste suavely combines those aromas over lemon peel and old hop funk into a supremely drinkable, cask-dry rosé of a geuze experience, perfectly impromptu-paired with pecorino and Oud Brugge - grazie a tutti! // 2013? vintage shared @Bier ohne [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2016-IV: upfront tart red grapes dunked in funky Cantillon lemon sulphurs makes refreshing lemony grape juice with a young vinous touch (must meets musk).

Bottle. Pours clear candy apple red, gets quite murky as the bottom of the bottle is reached though, small pink head and nice lacing. Aroma is initially very funky - lots of blue cheese and barnyard. That fades as the beer breathes which brings out red grapes and vinous musty fruity notes. Flavor is quite tart, puckering and mouth drying, funkiness is fairly light and subdued. Lots of vinous notes and what seems like some saltiness. Medium body, nice.
Bottle with bytemesis, big thanks. Bright red color. Fruity aroma and horse blanket. Dry taste, tart, fruity, cherry, oak. Tasty.

Opaque, vinous and tart with heavy fruit presence and purple tinged foam, grape skin residue mixed with a healthy yeast sediment after some years, complex and multilayered.. One of the most tart and beautifully integrated fruit lambics available. Truly among my favorite Cantillon offerings, and perhaps the one that got me hooked early on to grape lambics. Exemplary vintages include the 03 Cabarnet Sauvignon fruiting shared by Sean at the JF Vonck tasting NYC, with an extremely balanced profile aging gracefully for many years, the remarkably tannic and juicy 05 375 bottling i acquired from Ølbutikken, and 08 - 11 vintages aged in my cellar that Ive slowly watched develop over the last half a decade and had the pleasure of trying along the way.
Bottle sample @Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Pours red with a light pink head. Fruity aroma, bit sour, grapes. Taste is bit sour, fruity, grapes, bit sour finish.

Darkish pink with a light pinkish white head. Aroma is sour plums, muscat grapes, red currants. Light bodied, refreshing on the palate with subtle sweetness, fruitiness and tartness. Taste is grape juice, malt vinegar, sour plums. Yum

Tap at The Trappist, Oakland. Deep ruby red. Dark berries, light lemon rind, woody notes and solid vinegary funk on the nose. Wonderful depth of flavour: great berries (cranberries and blackberries), some cherry, definite woodiness, fairly moderate funk - lemon juice and light barnyard. Juicy berries continue towards the finish, lingering funk, great tartness. Delicious.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2015 Pours clear dark ruby red with minimal head. The nose is complex with clear wine similarities. Red grape and barrel comes through nicely along with funk and sweeter berries and raspberry yoghurt. The mouthfeel is light of course with prickly carbonation. The taste is sour initially with tart winey flavours. Sippable and zesty with good amounts of brett to hit the spot. Nice crispy, sour, slightly drying aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours a ruby red with white head. Aroma is tart, a bit funky. Very tart, a bit grape. Taste is light, tart, smooth, not sour, just tart. The more I sip the more I like. Very drinkable. Very grape/wine action going on. Tasty as hell.

Bottle: Really old one, approx. 10 or more years. Hazy, reddish, light pink color, very fizzy, no head. Notes of red wine, vinegar, cider. Flavor is also very sour with intensive notes of vinegar, citrus and citrus peel, red wine, barrels. For sure a good beer but too sour for me.
Bottle from cantillon brewey, brussels. Hazy dark color, light red head. Light aroma of fruits, berries, sour notes. Sour taste, grapes, some sweet berries.

Bottle sampled at churchkey march 2014 
2013 vintage
pours dark red hue with a small pink head and no lacing. S pritzy head and some moderate carbonation. Nose is sharp lots of barrel sharp cheddar wood very nice!!! Flavors exhibit the sharp red wine character with tons of tart notes. Damn this is sharp. Damn! Long woody and berries on the finish. Wish I had a whole bottle of this! Very complex and unique!
dark pink into red. Vinegary aroma with loads of funk and sour grapes. A bit vineous although I think that the type of grape does not matter. Refreshing and good.

On tap at M&F. Pours a hazy red with a tiny head. Quite tart with aromas of sour grapes and a very light sweetness. Hints of black pepper. Medium to soft carbonation. Medium bodied. Long tart finish with aromas of red grapes.

Bottle. Pours a clear pink beer with a small sparkling pinkish had on top that leaves really quick. Aroma is fruity, vineous, oak and funky Brett. Flavor is medium sour, fruity and has a big oak presence with vineous characters. Soft, light carbonated mouthfeel. Quite a nice lambic, lacks some complexity. Nice.

Aroma: Dry Merlot, Red Grape, Mild Red Plum

Appearance: Ruby Hue, Passes Mild Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Merlot, Deep Red Grape, Red Plum

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Dry
Bottled 2013. Dark wine red colour, some pink foam. Very complex beer with aroma of lemon, vinegar and a lot of grapes. Very fruity, easy drinkable. Very well balanced.
Sweet berry aroma of raspberries, strawberries & cherries. Cloudy pink with pink head. Fruity animal sour sweet taste. Medium body & lively carbonation.

Sample shared by a friend. Slightly hazy reddish-plum color with a medium fizzy pinkish-white head that evaporates steadily to an outer ring. Strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of vinous oak, yeast and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of tart berries, peppery yeast, wood and grapes. The finish is moderately sour with a wine and yeast aftertaste. Good all around.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2015 St. Lamvinus 14 vintage

Has a beautiful, vibrant color of red grapes, revealing a ruby note, and a fizzy, soon vanishing head.

Has aromas of a distinct leathery funkiness, paired with ripe grapes, pulling out their stone qualities in the best way, due to the supportive, wooden barrel. The funky barnyard tartness blends extremely well into the fermented, vinous, sour grapes. The fruitiness, as well as the wooden oakiness illustrate the acidic tartness in a very intriguing way, evoking the feeling of this being more wine than beer. 

Begins with prickly, unripe grapes among earthy, leathery malts. The grapes turn sweeter, riper as the malts stand out against the tart sourness, adding stone fruit qualities to the taste. At the same time, carried by a lively carbonation, the sourness becomes quite intense, with a vinegar note, evoked by the fermented grape sourness, while both tastes blend well together, wrapped up by the wooden barrel. Finishes with a tongue quenching, slightly dry sourness, along with lemon zest and grape pulp. The beer still reminds me in many ways of a young wine, while missing its typical sweetness, replaced by the typical lambic tartness, with a refreshing, high carbonation.
Incredible red color. Equal smell. Could just smell it for long times. Sour taste. Long long finish. Incredible lambic sour.
100. Not bad for a week. Bottle to paron to mouth. Pours a dark purple with almost no head. Smells funky and sweet. Tastes fruity with a mild funk. Love it!!! Who noticed the paron?

Sample bottle courtesy of and shared with kermis. 
Funky aroma. Hazy red pour. . Subtle sourness. Quite decent.

2010 Draft at craft ale house. Pours clear red with a small head that dissipates quickly to nothing. The aroma is funky tart cherry, raspberry, light oak. The taste is very tart cherry, grape, sour apple, long tart finish.

Bottle 0.75l. Pours hazy dark red with pink head. Aroma has sour berries, grapes, cherries, red wine. Taste is heavily sour, tart, grapes, red wine. Balanced with some bitterness and malt. Very good and refreshing fruit lambic. Perfectly balanced.
750ml bottle In a tulip. Pours ruby/amber with a pinkish head. Aroma of sourness, funk, grapes, oak, and light malts. The grapes and sour notes blend well. Average texture. A great beer.

Very tannic, the tartness is minimal. Strong grapeskin character. Beautiful purple color. A bit oaky. Mild sweetness. Very tasty, a great example of how Cantillon can capture just a wide variety of fruits and make each lambic unique.

La birra più simile al vino che abbia mai bevuto, ma con unacidità tutta sua propria delle fermentazioni spontanee marchiate Cantillon. Già allaroma si percepiscono le note intense di vino rosso, mosto e frutta rossa. Tutto confermato e anzi ampliato nel gusto, dove frutta rossa, note vinose e di legno maturo si intrecciano in unincantesimo che ammalia i sensi. Saint Lamvinus è lunico santo che potrei mai pensare di adorare.
Just a fantastically complex beer, the funk/sourness melds so well with the grapes. Best trade Ive ever made

Red pour, good sized pinkish head. Lots of funk in the aroma, red wine, vinegar, earthy. Superlative taste...... Red wine, tart cherry, funk, merlot, quite sour, oak, red grape. Long finish. Im not doing this one justice.

0.75l bottle from trade with Countbeer, many thanks my friend. Hazy dark red color with thick pink head. Tart aroma of red wine, cherries, barnyard, earthy notes, oak. Dry tart taste witch red grape, cherries, tart apples, red wine, oak, wild yeast. Dry, vinous finish.

Draft at Brouwers for Sour Fest last year. Just found these notes when looking through my research notebook. Taken pretty much word for word with no editing, because this was 8 months ago when I was in the midst of dissertation-writing and am in no position to argue with anything I wrote down then. Anyway ...  
Aroma: Beautiful -- earthy ripe fruit; diaper; a lot of earth / funk in this, which I like. Appearance: Light ruby red, pinkish ring of bubbles, hazy. Taste: A lot more earty, fruit/tart - wine, grapes. Palate: long fruity, tart finish. Slick, mouth-coating texture. Overall: Burping up diaper, fruit, and (on the second glass at least) cheese. Yum. Great.

Bottle.
Magenta body, light purple, fizzy head. 
Fresh baby diaper. Wild. Oak. Explosive flavor, striking tannins but still smooth. Happy New Year.

Bottle shared by drowland, pours a clear dark purple with a pink head and some lacing, the aroma has tons of fruit, grapes, cherries, god knows what else is in her, amazing, the flavor has a tart front end with a ton of fruit through out the entire drink, a little bit of barnyard mixed in too, its sour, but not over the top sour, nice smooth mouthfeel, loved it.

Rating #1500, thanks Alen! 750 ml corked green bottle, bottled on 10/18/11, best before October 2014. Aroma is a little skunky, some rubber (thanks Cantillon for your use of green glass), barnyard funk, sour fruit. Pours a gorgeous ruby red with a one finger white-pink head; has only decent retention. Taste is perfect sour Cantillon (10/10 on a sour scale, this is serious mouth-puckering shit). Delicious!

750 ml bottle- Pours a beautiful hazy reddish burgundy with a nice off white head that reduces to a collar and a thin blanket. Aroma is a little skunk, rubber (stupid green bottles!), funk, cherries. The taste is much better than the aroma, funky, tart, cherries (or is it merlot grapes?), the finish that skunk kind of tries to ruin the party. Cantillon never disappoints, not yet anyways!

Bottle - 750ml (2007). Hazy pink/peach bosy with a thin white foamy head. Fresh hoppy/herbal aroma with fruity (grapes, cherries), malty, and woody hints. Its sharp, robust, well balanced hoppy taste carries fruity (grapes, citrus), malty, and herbal notes. Ends with a long, strong, sour finish. Perfect example of lambic.

750ml Bottle - Red/purple in colour. Grapes and cherries in the aroma. Grapes, blackcurrants and raspberries feature in the fruity, tart and sour taste. This vintage is from around 2005 and has held up well.

Bottled 2010

A: pours a beautiful deep rose read with a finger of transient pink foam and brilliant clarity. No lace. Beautiful beer. Normally, some of the characteristics here would take away, but this appearance is simply stunning. Great looking beer.
S: Mmmmm. Spicy blend of yeast, dry sour, farm funk (the most Ive smelled in a cantillon), lots of lacto. Nice.
T: Dry, puckering, tart and fruity. The fruit tone is really surprising provided the time in bottle. Plenty of signature Cantillon sour puckering flavors. Hints of white vinegar. Really nice.
M: Thin, moderately low carbonation allows for the tannic dryness in the beer to shine. Make me water and want more.
O: I really, really enjoyed this beer, but I think I might prefer some of the others from the crew there in Brussels to this one.

Serving type: bottle

11-19-2011
Burgundy pour, some white fizzy head, looks almost still once its gone. Raunchy aroma, lots of funk, a bit of grape. Taste is lemon funk, sour grapes,lots of sour on the finish.

On tap at CBC, Clapham. Pours a cherry colour with a pinkish head. Aroma is lovely - wine, cherry, custard. a little raspberry. Light body, full carbonation. Dry and pleasantly sour with grapes, a little woodiness, lemon, strawberry... and more besides. Lovely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750mL. 2009 bottling.

A: Plum tinted red. Thin whisp of head.

N: Sour grapefruit , wine grape, oak, peppercorn, lemon, hints of cherry and leather. Earth.

T: Home run hitter. Plenty sour, some malt and fruit to balance.

M: Light, carbed, drinkable. Wonderful as the Cantillon wont.

O: Another excellent beer, albeit not as fruit forward anymore. Delicious.

Bottle. Pours slight haze bold ruby, dark red with thin reddish white head. Smell is merlot grapes, citrus, light brett funk. Taste is sour grape, fresh red berries, cherry, strawberries juice, merlot tannins, a little acidic, slight dry wood towards the end. Would love to try again with more age. Delicious.
Notes from backlog. Was my second Cantillon, and I guess I had hyped it a bit too much. Very tart, but the grapes did not affect it to the degree I had expected.
Red. Aroma is subtle funk and grape. Taste is oak, grape, tartness, mild sweetness; lots going on. Overall, one of the best fruit lambics Ive yet had.
Well its nice to find my favourite ever beer (so far). The weight, texture flavours and complexities of this one are all.......my favourite. Thanks
Bottle share thanks to droofus. Slightly tart nose with tons of fruitiness.. Not very tannin like. This is awesome. Almost like a very tart grape soda. Perfect balance of grape and sourness.

Pours a deep ruby color. Big barnyardy, horse blanket, funky sour aroma. Big funky flavor as well, barnyard gueuze character. Fruity flavor, grape and sour cherry like in the finish. Big sourness throughout but balances well with fruity character.

2010 75 cl bottle bought directly from the brewery. Sharp, sour taste. Merlot grapes added to lambic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2006 bottle pours muddled brown purple. Big funk nose. Big tart and acidic start. Grape sweetness appears. Solid body.

Again an extremely nice one from Cantillon. Unbelievably sour, took the most of the glass for my tongue to get used to it and get into the more refined tastes. Fruity flowery feel and a lot of red grapes. Beautiful!
Bottle in front of line at SARA. Aroma and flavor of fecal and grapes. Palate was good carbonated lambic. Great beer.
På fad, Mikkeller & Friends. Tåget rødlig uden skum. Pivfrisk. Skarp træet næse. Rødvinsnoter. Prut. Meget harmonisk og vinøs i munden. Frugtsyre. Let frugtsødme. Mere, tak.

Fad: Lys rødlig let diset øl med et fint lille skumhoved. Duften er let syrlig med en smule stald.Duften af kirsebær er tydelig. Denne går igen i smagen der er fantastisk afbalanceret. >Virkelig en lækkerbisken.

Tap. Pours hazy orange golden with a small white head. Aroma of grapes, berries, yeast, barnyard and wood. Sour/sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily text. and average carb. An excellent fruit lambic.
Bottle pours a red burgundy with a small reddish purple head. Aroma is sweet and fruity with some horse blanket. Nice and dry light fruit, sour, grapes, and berries. Nice!

2012 bottle for my birthday no sharing lol. Aroma is lemon sour with sweet grape notes. Smells like candy. Appears beautiful strawberry jam colored. Pinkish white head. Light head spotty lacing sturdy ring towards the edges of the glass. Taste of sourness, citric acidity, and slightly bitter berry.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Kevin! Ruby and indigo all over with decent clarity and a pink tinted head that makes no attempt to be quiet as it fizzes away into nothing. Aroma is funk-heavy up front; musty cork, sweaty blankets, dirt, earth, must, & damp barnyard backed by wonderful vinous notes of wet oak barrels, sour grapes, wine-like acidity, tannins, & vinegar. Taste is loaded with tart, sour grapes, bitter acidity, faint cherry skins, heaps of oak, & the funk of one thousand barnyard floors. Horsey and cork-y with a note of sweaty socks. Truly great beer, this brewery is simply outstanding.

75cl bottle bought at Cantillon brewery. Color is dark red with medium head. Body is medium. Taste is medium to high bitter and sour. Aroma is red fruits, grapes and wines. Its a good beer, slightly the same the level as kriek and rosé.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 [2013-10-11] Tämä vuonna 1995 pullotettu yksilö oli ehtinyt jo täysi-ikäiseksi ja maku oli sen mukainen: kypsän hedelmäinen, jopa omenainen ja hieman suolainen tuoksu sekä täyteläinen ja kypsän hedelmäinen maku olivat oivallisessa tasapainossa. Vielä happamampi kuin saman panimon muut lambicit.

How: Draught.
Where: Akkurat, Stockholm.
Appearance: Ruby colour with a small head.
Aroma: Sour, currants, berries.
Body: Medium body, almost no carbonation.
Flavour: Sour, red wine, grapes, citric.
@RBWG-JAX Grand Tasting shared by Brad-ygtttt-750 bottle-tan-hazy amber. A-tart/sweet fruit. T-tart/sweet fruit, acidic, med malt.
On tap. Bright slightly hazy red/pink with pinkish head. Aroma and taste has oak, grapes, tart, tangy, acidity, red wine, funk, some basement notes, grapes, melon,

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2013 Zwanze Day 2013 at Avenue Pub! Pours a hazy reddish purple with thin ring of lacy pink head and good carbonation, but no lacing. Aroma is awesome tart fruits, musty grape and sour cherries. Taste follows, tart awesomeness with a hint of funk, nice and thick but still refreshing. Awesome!

Zwanze Day 2013. Pours dirty peache orange. Aroma is meh, sour red wine cherry fruity. Taste is big tart sour medium heavy acidity, sour wine. Finish is long and acidic tart. Mouth feel is full and medium.
Beautiful deep red, no head or lacing. Smell of grape, red wine. Taste is well balanced sweetness to sour. Vineous, with very little funk(2012)

St. Lamvinus s is surprisingly accessible. It does not require the palate adjustment that other Cantillon beers require. The sourness and fruit are balanced allowing complexity to open and sing. Contribution to flavor by grapes and wine are subtle. This is a fantastic beer.

750ml bottle, 2012 vintage. Pours bright semi-clear ruby red/pink into tulip. 1 finger head, medium carbonation, very fine lacing. Nose is oak, grapes, tart, tangy, light acidity. Mouthfeel is moderate carbonation, has some crispness which plays off the funk nicely. Taste is oak, woody, red wine, funky, dank, fruity, tart up front, light sweetness, grapes, berries, melon, red pepper, earthy, many layers. Finish is sour/tart, funky, complex, barrel notes, red wine. Superb.

Vacker, rubinröd och härlig lyster. Lite funkig i doften som förväntat. Påminner snarast om en elegant kriek. Vinfatens bidrag kan anas lite lagom subtilt. Världsklass som så ofta från detta underbara bryggeri. Delar en flarra med Isabel en vanlig måndag.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 16.06.2013, cask @ Alewife Queens:
Tiny shortlasting head. Aroma is more like a fresh nice Sangria actually, red grapes, redwine barrel, citrus peel, grass. Taste is also in the fresh Sangria range, nicely balanced sour and fruity, red grapes, grass, citrus peel, sorrel, oak. Even as room temperatured this was just excellent. Ice cold with ice cubes in the summer warm would just be perfect!

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2013 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours blood red with a small beige head leaving fantastic spotty lacing. Nose shows sweet, acidic berries with light tart and doughy yeast. Taste is rather easy going for a Cantillon. Sessionable sour and tartiness with heavy sweet citric and acidic berry notes. Perfectly balanced. Very good
On tap. Pours cloudy orange. aroma is grapes, red fruits and barnyard. Taste is light sour and definite brett flavours. Medium body with average carbonation.
On TAP at pikkulintu. Pours hazy red with white red tan creamy head. Notes of apple, red wine, fruits. Nice sour sweet smooth taste. Goes down easy on this summer day.-- bb/wp

750 ml bottle (2012 vintage)

Considering how cheap this is at the brewery I wish I would have been able to bring back more. A phenomenal release is among not only the best lambics in the world but the best (so far) from Cantillon. I am glad I have at least one more to drink at some point in the future because it should keep for a very long time.

Aroma / Appearance - The carbonated cherry base is trapped by a stark white head. Sweet bing cherries, white wine, and a playful tartness sting the air. This is not overly acidic or vinegary but is perfect even relatively fresh.

Flavor / Palate - Vinegar and sea salt chips mix with a generous scoop of cherries and raspberries. Fruity and tart, it is not intense. That makes it disappear almost immediately until the bottle is down to the dregs.

2011 bottle. Pours amber with a thin tight white head that fades to a collar. Aroma is dirty cheese rotten grapes and wood tones. Taste is bitter sour and funky with cheese wood rotten grapes and wet corks. Palate is medium slick and drying.

2011 bottle. Medium red wine pour, nice lasting carbonation and an aroma of decent lactic acid. Flavor is light sour red grapes, very tart, woody and dry. Worth picking up at least once, even at the price point.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2013 Bottle, pours pinkish light haze. Notes off heavy merlot skin, funk, barn, acid, cherry, cheesecake, geuze, cranberry, and oak. Medium body. Sour barrel and grains. Always been on of my favorite Cantys. Tasty
A brilliant marriage of lambiek and red grapes. Tastes like a fresh, sour and fruity red wine. Amazing beer.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2013 28/8/2013. Tap at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is cloudy red with thick tiny white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, grapes, berries, raspberries, sourness and some sweetness.
11/10/2013. Bottle 0.75l at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Vintage 1995. Colour is cloudy orange with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Berries, raspberries, sourness and some sweetness. So soft and gentle. Points based on this bottle.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Bottle at Mikkeller Bar. Clear reddish orange pour with a white head. Lots of Brett, barnyard funk, fruit, grapes and red wine, slightly dry and slightly tart. Absolutely awesome.

Pours a nice violet color with pinkish-red head. Aromas of ripe grapes, oak, tannin, barnyard, and some acid. The palate is light to medium bodied and tasted of wine grapes, oak, soft tannin, lactic acid, and bit of citrus. Finishes dry, soft carbonation. Balances the vinous and lambic characteristics very well.

Bottle from the brewery, sipped at home in Australia. Pours clear rosy pink, bottom of the bottle is a touch darker. Immediate aroma of grapes, red wine, sour cherries and cheese. Tart citric notes. Taste is upfront grapes, an acidic lemon peel tartness backed by sweet and sour dark fruits. Touch of sherbet. Dry, sour finish made me thirsty for more. Cantillon havent let me down.

At Mikkeller opening in SF. A- screaming unfiltered red with a 1/4 finger of light red head that quickly dissipate. S- raspberries, cherries, vinegar, cheese funk, urinal cake, musty oak, salt, lemon and assorted tartness. M- light and acidic palate with a mild body and a good carbonation.
