T- more raspberries, funk and oak to start. Vinegar, bell pepper, lemon juice assist. Tart apple, tannins and white grapes as well. Ending is a Sweetart candy flavor that lasts. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

5% bottle opened to celebrate my wedding anniversary. Wow, this was capped & corked! Vintage 2012, Lot A12. Great carbonation, light pink head on a ruby red body. The aroma is grapes, a bit of mustiness, very reminiscent of a red wine. Incredibly sour, very tart, highly acidic. I think it might need more aging... I am getting some musty grape notes with a bit of earthy or woodyness as well. Interesting but it hasnt reached its best I think, if I had another bottle Id hang onto it for awhile... I feel it is a kind of wine/beer hybrid that is more on the wine side. I am not a wine drinker so it isnt really for me. Well made and fairly tasty though.

750ml bottle on 10-09-09.

Pours dark reddish with a light purple hue. An off-white head fizzes up on a semi-aggressive pour and quickly slows down until a thin layer of white bubbles remain on top. As soon as I opened this one up, the barynard must hit me in the back of my head. Lots of cheese, horse blanket, and tart, nostril-opening sour. A nice tart/sour funk mixed in with some dark fruity notes. A nice blend of the awesome funkyness, some oak backbone, and fruity sweetness. Not quite as sour as I was expecting, but the sweet grape notes really make up for that. I am digging this. Light bodied and fizzy carbonation reminds me of a gentle champagne. Smooth and refreshing, really covers the palate well and finishes dry.

So easy to drink and so damn good. I really dig the funk, grapes, and oak mixed together. A perfect combination worthy of its top 100 rating.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2015 Sample from 750 ml bottle at tasting. Bottled Oct 2011. Pretty sure this is my first fruit lambic. Pours ruby red with a nice foamy head that fades slowly. Very nice appearance. Unpleasant aroma of barnyard, cheese, sour red fruit, and red wine. Taste is better than the aroma suggests. Red wine, vinegar, wood, red fruit and apples. Fairly intense tart finish. Hard to rate this with a big different between aroma and taste. My overall number leans more towards taste than aroma.  Update from 1/4/15 tasting.  Lots of brett and funky cheese.  I like this a little more than before but Id never seek out a bottle myself.

Poors a wonderfull ruby red beer, with a good foamy head for its kind. In the smell there is soureness, fruit and some sweetness. The taste is soft sour, softer then most cantillon. It is fresh a bit sweet and sour. You definitly taste hop and the sweetness of the grapes. The aftertaste is again very soft, and is mostly sour, with a touch of sweet. A very good beer from cantillon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Smelling funky, red fruits, leather and stable.Appearance: A clear ruby colored beer. A low pink head with small lacing and some curtains.Taste: Tasting red grapes, vinegar, leather and grape peel.Palate: Low carbonation, a fresh texture. A medium body with a very dry finish.Overall: Very lovely.Note: On-tap at Bierproeflokaal In de Wildeman. (Vintage 2012) Reviewed 2013-07-03.

750mL. Best before 12/12. Very sour. Finishes with grape juice. Not super funky for Cantillon. Or perhaps it is real funky, but its covered up by the grapiness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at the craft beer company 2nd birthday. Bright red, crimson purple colour . Light acid horse and raspberry aromas. Flavour is dry grape skin tanin. Pluckering acidity. Prickly carb. Dry but not bone dry. Long berry duration. Very nice.

75cl bottle from the brewery. Pours a deep reddish brown colored body with a finger-width, creamy and soft, purple head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is tart and acidic black grapes with some wood, red wine, a good amount of funk, and a touch of vinegar. Flavor is similar. Lots of tart, funky, acidic black grapes with a touch of malt sweetness showing up. Vinous fruits and red wine with a some oak and hints of vinegar before this finishes dry, tart, woody, acidic, and funky. Lengthy aftertaste following a light body and a very soft, somewhat lively carbonation. Overall, a damn good beer. Tart and funky, but well balanced and very easy drinking. Delicious.
Poured a reddish brown with minimal head. Aroma of sour raspberry. Medium body, flavour of sour, bitter berries and a lingering bitter, sourness.

Keg in Craft Beer Co. for 2nd Birthday. Pours hazy darker shade of red/purple, but bright with bubbly white head. Taste is cherry, raspberry, slight red wine vinous, apple sour. Im getting some tannins which take the edge of the sharpness of the sour. Quite restrained and refined.

on tap at alewifes beers gone wild event. it was decanted from a key keg via a modified connector, which helped increase the roundness of the lambic. beautiful clear garnet red color, no head, enticing sour note in the nose, very smooth sourness -- not sharp at all. some red wine character in the background.
0,75l bottle from Kaisla. Pours cloudy red with a low head. Aroma is sour malts with some grapes. Flavor is very sour malts with some merlot wine. Exquisite.

fizzy pink head that bursts open and just disappears with lacing. ruby-red turbid colour. aroma of red fruit and sourness. taste is red fruit, raspberry, sour aftertaste sour with bitter finish and slight wry (perhaps due to the skin of the grapes and tanines?). good, but not cantillons best imho.  bottle 75 cl / best before 12/-2022
Bottle. Hazy/unclear red with a small off white head. Sour red berries, oak, light red grapes. Taste is medium sweet and medium/heavy sour. Medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation.
Pours a hazy purple with little punk head and no lacing. Aroma pf grapes, vinous, funk. Taste is grapes, berries, funk, oak, barnyard. Low to medium body and medium carb. Delicious.

16/04 A 0.75 l bottle, courtesy of Marko, great thanks for sharing! Bottled in 2012, poured hazy dark red with pink head. Berry fruit aroma, some cherries, generally French red wine with touch of wood and yeast. Flavor was slightly acidic, also only a little bit sweetish, again more similar to wine, tart with berry fruitiness. Medium bodied with moderate, slightly sweet and mostly astringent finish with lot of tannins. A great blend, actually most similar thing to an elegant, complex wine Ive ever rated on RB.

A - Slightly hazy red with a touch of orange and a thin finger of slightly reddish head. Fades normal.

S - Sweet wheat, merlot grapes, oak, vanilla, barnyard funky tart yeast, tartness, sourness, with some other sweet berries.

T - Sweet wheat, merlot grapes, oak, vanilla, barnyard funk, funky yeast, tartness and sourness, other sweet berries, and lactic acid.

M - Medium bodied, moderate carbonation. Smooth with a tart, funky, sour, dry, and lightly sweet finish.

D - Fantastic complexity and balance.

Pours fuchsia with a fast fading pink head. Smells exceptionally vinous, clearly like merlot. Taste is sour and fruity, without a doubt sour grapes. Medium-bodied with an astringent texture and prickly mouth-carbonation, Cantillon Saint Lamvinus finishes with a soft tartness.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours clear red/pink with almost no head (very low pink). Aroma is of sourness, grapes, fruits. Taste is sour, fruits, grapes. Palate: Ligth body. Overall: Very interesting grapes. Reminiscent of a clear young table wine. As the sourness feeling fade out, sips besome more and more interesting (imo). Not quite as complex as I would have expected. Very easily drinkable. A somewhat unique beer. I was surprised I didnt get any barnyard/funk, maybe hidden by the grapes.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2015 75cl bottle. Tasted blind. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: red beer, little to no foam.
Nose: red fruits, cherry, wood, very sweet, very little grapes noticeable.
Taste: sweet, little sour towards the end, rather balanced, wood. very fruity in total, but hard to say which fruits.
re-rate

Bottle from Belgium in a Box, clear vimto like pour with foam pink head, big funk aroma, forward taste is sweet but the first taste is a wow sour glorious blackberry pie sweet want to visit again lambic. Wished I was more to give this beer the write it deserves.

Clear deep pink, with a light pink head. Aroma of fresh grapes, red berries, orange peel and some barnyard funk. Taste is tart to mellow tart, with a fruity, grape/berry aftertaste. Prickly mouthfeel due to the rather feisty carbonation. Marvellous beer.

Bottled 750 ml. -Courtesy of Marko, shared with him and heavy. Hazy red coloured, medium sized pinkish head, sourish nose. Sour fruity and cherries taste with acidic grapes notes. Dryish finish. Not the best Cantillon but pleasant one.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2013 Bottle bought @ brewery consumed in Hotel room after refrigeration.
dark as red wine, smells vinegar cheese sour grapes cantillon house geuze flavour, puckeringly sour on taste medium carbonation this bottle is fresh. Extraordinary beer.

2012 version that I got at the brewery. Poured a hazy red body with a pinkish head. Light smooth aroma, wine, some malt maybe, sweetish, and some butter. Hm. Mild fruity taste, slightly dusty, somewhat sweetish, a bit funky, peppery, very light acidity/bitterness. More or less balanced and very pleasant, though it might not be my favorite Cantillon, its yet another great beer from the brewery.
Årgång 2006. Smak och doft av svavel, ek, syrlig och vinös. Sur, torr och med en trevlig beska. Gott.

Bottle shared with Bruce and Leighton at DHVL, 22/03/13.
Hazed light crimson with a pinky white head that clears edgeward then retains.
Nose is grapes, light raspberries, woody, tarte berry fruits, light smoke, dank wood, grandads shed.
Taste is dry berry fruits, red grape skins, woody tones, light sugars, tarte and soured berry, light fruit balsams.
Medium in body, soft and still on the palate, dry finish.
Excellent!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Chilled 75 cl green bottle poured into a tulip.  Pours crimson with small pink head.  Small lacing, low carbonation, and medium body.  Taste is slightly sweet red grapes, some tartness, and a hint of oak.  Good, but I expected more from this one.  I think I need to try this again near the beginning of the tasting.

750 ml bottle thanks to nightfall. Thanks a ton, man! Pours a darker red with a white head of foam. Aroma is grapes and funky tartness with a nice fruity sweetness reigning throughout. Taste is that nice tartness again with a subtle sweetness in the finish. Really a nice beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */&Friends (2011 vintage) Colour is burgundy ruby red with a very thin bubbly fast dissipating head. Fruity sour fruit wine like aroma and taste, acidic, cherry, woody oak a tart finish. Nice mix of both sour and sharpness on the palate, really enjoyed this experience.
Clear light red with bit violet, off-white long thin head. Bit sour aroma has much junk. Sour, dry, light body and feel, long sour finish, funky, pure, nice berries. Pure sour tasty and personal.

750 ml bottle purchased at the brewery. A few months past the recommended drinking date. Dark ruby.  Sour gueze. Notes of red wine vinegar acidity. Dry. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Moeder Lambic-Fontainas. Bordeaux-red colour with a nice foam which dissapear fast. Typical sour nose as well the first sip. Its a Cantillion for sure. The sourness is quiet dominant. The aftertaste is a mixture of lambik and grape.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2013 Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... Light aroma of grapes, like a sugary red wine... Purple magenta in color, light white foam... Flavor is much more subtle and less tart than the other lambics, grape flavor is apparent, kind of a winey palate... Really cool beer
Poopy tangy dusty misty awesomeness. Pours hazy red thin head.  Flavors of poopy sour grape wood notes.  Shir tons of sour poop tangy. Jesus. Nice.

750ml bottle shared at RBWG, hotel lobby 
Appearance: Dirty brown with a small beige head 
Tart fruit and vinegar with a dry finish 
Very nice and tasty

750 ml bottle. Pours a dark red with full head that dissipates quickly with no lacing. Aromas of urine, yeast, red wine vinegar, and funk. Hard to get past the nose. Luckily the taste and flavors make it worthwhile. Sour and tart with lots of funk. Flavors of grapes and berries,  fresh oak, green apples, and sulfur.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy copper with medium frothy white head. The aroma is oak funk and tart. Medium mouthfeel with nice sour fruit and tart in the finish. Really enjoyed this one.
Really tart. I can see a bit of grapes, but the acidity rules all in this beer for me.
750ml bottle at RBWG! YO Brad! You da bomb! Lambic funk, grapes, more funk and then some damn sour. This is the shit.

2/23/12. RBWG. 750mL bottle thanks to Brad! (ymgtbrbce2338484). Hazy amber pour with a small soapy khaki head. Rich funk aroma with smooth wood, tart, and so much more. Lovely tart flavor with plenty of funk, sour, lots of sour, acidic, and delicious. Thanks, Brad$

2011 vintage poured into a Duvel art glass. Pours hazy brilliant red of shade with a tight, thin white head. Head quickly dissipates and doesnt leave any lacing. Nose is grape, oak, some band aid (this might be because I didnt wash my glass from the last beer), lemon, and must. The flavor is where Lamnivus shines. Its balance between the lemon and grape is superb, they complement each other perfectly. In addition, Lamnivus has some nice mineral characters as well as a good amount of must. Light mouthfeel, moderate acidity, prickly carbonation, and a nice enduring finish. One of the best fruit lambics around, Im hard pressed to name many I would take over this. Really wish bottles werent so hard to come by.

Bottle2005@ Præstemosen. Merlot grapes. Small fine head. Hazy rhubarb red. Intense red fruit aromas. In my nose its redcurrant. Very tart but mild. Dry dry finish. What a bomb. I am sold love lambics now.

Bottled 21/11/2012 so really young. Pours really attractive cheery red with a syrupy consitency. Hardly any head probably due to the syrupy nature. Aroma is typical Cantillon funk with cherry. Taste is delicious sour, cherry and some grape. The finish is quite bitter. Light carbo. Really good Canti.

Bottled 2005. label says to drink it one year after bottling but atleast i like this 7 year old bottle. aroma surprisingly is cherries. taste is very sour and complex seeming taste that i have a hard time describing. very refreshing and sour lingering palate.

delicious.

Bottle.  31st bday and shared amongst friends which is really nice.  Anyway, gorgeous ruby red with pinkish tones and a thin bubbly head.  Sour dark grapes, fruity, cobweb, musty, beyond vinous and lovely aroma.  Restarined but beautiful, vinous, tart, woody, dark tart grape skin.  Lively dry as a bone.  Done rating and on to falling in love.  Wow.

750 ml corked and capped bottle served in a Zwanze Day 2012 flute. 2011 cork. Thanks to kevanb for sharing.

A: Pours a hazy pinkish and grapefruit-like color combination with an off-white pinkish head forming on the pour.

S: A ton of Cantillon funk, light cheesy aspects with a nice dark grape tartness. Nice red wine tannins going on as well.

T: Big sourness up front. Grapey, red wine drying tannin. Oaky, with a light sweetness on the finish. Not as funky as the nose, but it is underlying throughout. Acidic as well.

M: Enamel stripping, bubbly and lively carbonation with a light body.

O: Very delicious. Sour, funky and really drinkable.

Serving type: bottle

Draught@ Akkurat. Deep reddish coloured beer with no carbonation and a very small white-pink head. Nice fruity sweet red grape hinted clear lambic overtone hinted aroma. Medium to full palate. Finish i sour sweet slightly fruity with a clear lambic sour grainy touch. Not bad at all.

Draught @ Akkurat. Beautiful color, amazing aroma and taste. Very sour and a kind of green grassy bitterness (which I like) at first sip before the taste buds accustom. I couldt find any hints or notes at all that bothered me, which is rare. Pure pleasure untill the end. like a hybrid between gueuze and kriek.
Pours a dark pinkish red. Strong aroma, you can really smell and taste the wine barrel. Nice sharp clean sourness. Very good beer.
Dark red colour. Tart grape aroma. Taste is dry, fruity, tart, bit sour, complex.

Dark, pink, reddish color.
Sharp aromas.
Dry sour taste with an amazing fruity finish.
Excellent beer, once again.

Bottle thanks to Bacterial...what a treat Jeff!  Of the three or four bottles of this I have tried, this one was BY FAR my favorite. 2011 Vintage.  Pour is a clear light red/dark pink, with a nice head that fades rather quickly but leaves some nice lacing.  Aroma is not quite so heavy on the barnyard as other samples I have had (read: Not as much "Authentic Fecal Aroma"), and the subtle nature of the funk really worked for me.  Some nice damp basement dustyness, light fruit, light acid, and some tannin to finish.  Dry mouthfeel.  Really, really nice beer, I wish all the samples of this that I have had were so great!
Bottle for science! 2011 bottle. Beautiful rosé pour. Tart nose with some grape. Slightly tart, a little earthy, really fun and complex. Fruits subtle, but there.

Kaatuu lasiin kirkkaanpunaisena ja kirkkaana, vaahto on hyvin niukka ja katoava. Haju on vahvan punaisen viinimarjainen ja hapan, myös lambicmaisia tallimaisia, nahkaisia ja maisia hajuja löytyy. Maku on hyvin hapan, jopa sitruunaisen hapan (tuntumalta, sitrusta ei maussa kuitenkaan hirveästi ole, vähän kylläkin), punaisen viinimarjainen, mainen, marjapensainen ja vain hieman nahkainen. Happamuus sopii tähän vallan mainiosti, vaikka yllättääkin. Suutuntuma on hyvin hiilihappoinen ja valtavan hapan. Kokonaisuutena jälleen kerran Cantillonilta hieno tuotos, huonoa ei vastaan ole vielä tullut. Happamuus oli todella iskevä, sanottakoon se vielä kerran.
Pours red small white foam , smell is geuze more than graprs . Taste is dry , cantillon funk , sweetness. Dry ,. Very nice

A funky sour scent, oak, yeast, and fruit grapes. There is a nice tartness and sour flavor. The fruit was acidic but complex with raspberry, dates, grape flavor. The St. Lamvinus left a slight dryness which was very pleasing in combination with its drinkability. Overall I enjoyed this and will gladly welcome another bottle in the future.

750mL bottle, from McBerko Thanks Dude, shared at Mikes, cool off beat color, with the traditional cantillon sourness, easy drinking at 5% but leaving me wanting more flavor, rather than just the oak tartness. Hype Train... Depart
Bottle. Pours light purple with frothy head. Aroma  of funky cheese. Taste is vineous and funky grapes

375ml bottle, 2005 vintage. This seven year-old pours murky brownish red with a small off-white head. Aroma is tart and slightly sweet with funky barnyard, red sour berries, some oak, wood and slightly tannic. Taste is first up slightly sweet with oak but quickly turns incredibly sour and acidic. Notes of funk, wood and really tart berries. Finish is slightly vinous and dry as bone. The tartness is absolutely mouthpuckering. Medium carbonation, moutfeel is soft and tingly. Dries the mouth like no other beer Ive previously had, like sucking on a piece if wood. Crazy. Great stuff.

Beautiful purple deep pink color. Slightly pink head. Aroma: classic Cantillon funk, hay, barnyard, sour grapes, oak, a hint of some stinky cheese in there, vinous, fruity. Lovely! Taste: tar grapes, grapes, cherries, hay, cheesse, sour, classic Cantillon funk, barnyard, funk. I LOVED this one. One of my favourites from Cantillon so far!

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2014 2011 Vintage, at home with my wife to bring in the New Year. Pour is hazy crimson/maroon with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Big oak, dark fruits, grapes, funk, light band-aid, raspberry, medicinal aroma. The first thing you notice in the taste is huge grape, plum, and dark fruits, playing off nice dust and funk notes. Great wood/oak notes and big acidity that cuts through the sweetness, leading to a dry tart finish. Light body with medium carbonation. Fairly sour lambic, with still a ton of fresh fruit notes. Nice sipper and a great beer.

Pours a ripe red berry color with a finger of pink foam. On the nose its tart, earthy and very vinous. Great aromas of raspberry, grape juice, wet wood and a touch of basement funk. On the palate its ripe and refreshing with nice balance between tart earthy fruit and woody malt backbone that add to a gorgeous mouth-feel. I really enjoy the lingering finish where everything seems to harmoniously connect and great vinous notes keep flowing.
750 from Shenanigans. Tart in aroma and taste. Grape presence but not sticky sweet. Pretty dry overall and very tasty.

Probada en Homo Sibaris, Barcelona. Puesta en porrón gana sorprendentemente. Color de vino, espuma poco persistente, poco gas. De aroma complejo y sabor sutil, vínico y con el justo ácido. Postgusto muy largo. Una cerveza excepcional.

Bottle, 2010 vintage. Pours ruby caramel, thin large-bubbled head, nice ring of lacing left lining the glass. Aroma is sharply tart, dark berries and grapes there but not overly prominent,  huge oaky leathey wood notes, citrus rinds and barnyard. Taste is tart,juicy dark grapes, a bit sweet, mild lemon acidity and vinegar, more oak notes to finish, vinous aftertaste.  Light palate, not overly puckering. Interesting grape skin-like texture at times in the mouth.  Eh, not too shabby at all.

Fresh vintage on tap at Zwanze Day 12.

Fizzy purple body is dark and ominous, supporting a thin layer of protective off-white head. Acetic fruits and bright, spritzy yeast dance among my nostrils. The marriage between soured grapes and oaky red wine barrels is perfect. Finishes clean and dry with just the right amount of puckering tartness.

We opened an 06 alongside this fresh pour and were surprised how vastly different the two were. This metamorphosis is unlike any other aged Cantillon Ive tried: the other fruit lambics still typically retain some fruity characteristics as they age, but the grapes are totally gone in this bottle of Lamvinus. Its instead transformed into a cheesy, super funky, gueuze-like lambic with grassy, farmyard funk and high acidity. The color has even faded to a more amber color compared to the deep purple of the original.

Both are absolutely delicious; still hard to believe how wildly different they are.

On tap @ Spuyten Duyvil for Zwanze Day 2012.  Pours a pale purple with orange hues.  Very little head to speak of, but clearly carbonated.  The aroma is mostly dominated by a sweet grape juice note but it is balanced out by a good deal of lactic sourness and a tinge of barrel.  On the palate, the lambic tartness starts out strong and on the end a more acidic, grape sweetness and tartness come in to balance it out.  Very delicate.  Possibly my favorite Cantillon.

Bottle generously shared by a kind soul on the party bus to Fort Collins.  Pours a hazy red-orange with a white head.  Nose is some light malt with grapes. grape skins, and some oak, and light funk with bit of vinous character.  Flavor follows with oak, light malt, grapes, grape skins, and vinous character.  Very nice lambic with lingering red grapes and slight tartness.  Very nice.

Bottle at home. Bottled 2011. Pours a slightly hazy red amber colour with a sparkly light pink medium head that fades fast. Nice aromas of bitter berries, red currants, rowanberries, horse blanket and oak. More sour flavours with more of the same but I can really sence the wine-like grapes with is sweetness and tartness. In addition theres some apple cider vinegar and lemon juice. Nice slick and semi-rich mouthfeel, and a great light berry bitterness. A fantastic fruit lambic which is fresh, rich and sour-sweet at the same time.

Pours a bright beautiful red with no head. Aroma of funk, oak and red wine. Taste follows, dry funky oak and sour. So good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep red, almost like a red wine colour, with a small, light red/pink head which dissipates. Aroma is a bit of funk, acidity and some cherry and other fruit notes. Taste is very tart and quite sour, some lemon and sharp citrus flavours, I also picked up a very, very slight minty flavour, which was unexpected, also quite earthy. Has a lingering, bitter finish, quite acidic. Very highly carbonated, medium body. An enjoyable beer, not sure lambics in general would be my favourite style but I do enjoy them, maybe I need to get more into them and taste more to appreciate them more.

Bottle.  Clear dark red with a fizzy white head.  Pungent earthy lemon, green apple, and grape aroma.  Tart sour lemon, green apple, and red wine taste with a dry acidic finish and a very bright lively palate.

From Hophead, DK.
Bottled, 141112.
Red with small head. Aroma of sourness and fruit. Flavour with tannins and lemon.

Nose is amazing, its a tart citrus smell laced with wine, grapes, touch of orange peel and lovely brett aromas. Appearance is a beautiful transparent scarlet red under proper light, topped off with a quick-disappearing pink head. Taste is sensational, i get cherry, raspberry, grapes, tantiising tart citrus flavour with lots of brett and delicious effervescent tang. Palate keeps that evervescence everywhere and lets the mouthfeel evolve as you sit on it, even a number of minutes after having a sip. I also get a bit of citric and malic acid on the palate, which is very welcome. I LOVE THIS.
Flippin amazing beer!

Bottle from etre gourmet.

Great Cantillion i really like when they add grapes. Glad i got a couple of these in my cellar.

Special flight at Provisions. Pours pale red with thin white head. Aroma of sour grapes, oak and sour yeast. Flavor is sour fruit with a lot more oak than some of the others. This I like.Finishes very, very sour.

Pours hazy red with a hint of brown. Light red head. Smell is sour and wild with a little hint of vinegar and grapes. Agressive fresh sour with a lot of the red wines bitterness and fruits. Perfectly fizzy. Really fresh and nice beer!

Pours cloudy reddish, with small pink head. Aroma of blackcurrant, sour grapes, yeast. Very, very sour. Taste is incredibly sour from the start, a bit too much for my liking, and I can't really pick out the merlot. Light body and medium to high carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle, purchased through Être Gourmet, split with my wife.  Pours a deep, ruby red color with a thin white head.  Aroma is fruity, red wine, oak, some typical Cantillon sour funk.  Very delicate on the palate with soft, fine carbonation.  Flavor is lightly sour, balanced very nicely with a touch of fruity sweetness, a touch red wine, more typical Cantillon funk and tartness, with a light fruity finish.  I like this better than a lot of fruit Lambics as the fruitiness is there, but its subdued.  Excellent!
160512@DØE Århus Syd Lambic tasting:  Dark red color with a small white foam. Tart flavor. Mysterious red wine like tart taste.

July 24th, 2010 - The Cantillon Saint Lamvinus was not my first Cantillon, but like my first, it was an incredible beverage, memorable both for its symbolism, rarity and above all, the brew itself. Out in Colorado Cantillon is a rare beast, and one has to go on safari to track and hunt it. Fortunately, I know where one of the fine hunting spots is (Liquor Max in Loveland), and my parents always deign to give me a few moments in the store on the way to my birthday weekend in September up to the Estes Park Irish & Celtic Music Festival. Rather than purchase a broad smattering of beers, I concentrated my budget and splurged on a few beers whose names are whispered with reverence on the beer forums, including this Saint Lamvinus. And drinking it in July, I am surely toasting the summer zenith, but also the end of a wonderful 2 year stint in Seattle. It was a fitting beer for the occasion - a mouth puckering salute to genuine Belgian lambics, and an adumbration of the tumultuous years to come. A beautiful dark pomegranate and overripe raspberry color, I dont think Ive ever seen  beer take on quite this color - a shade of purple found in Monets take on the lily, accented by a 1cm roseate head. Its a gorgeous brew, with a delicate aroma. Raspberries and wet cherries form the bulk of the bouquet, with a touch of  a light, fruity sweetness of watermelon, giving this aroma an extra welcome touch on a July evening. The aromas chicanery is soon revealed, when the flavor reveals that hardcore, hard-nosed, traditional limbic sourness. My lips curl in, cratering around my teeth, and my eyes begin to water as the oak aging takes its toll on the inside of my mouth. Withered, dehydrated berry flavors join in the fray, flavoring this beer as if it were a carbonated fruit vinegar. As the flavor progresses the intensity rises until it is a loud chirping of berry fruits and a peal of oak and acidity. Not for the faint of heart, the Saint Lamvinus is a beautiful ode to the style, and a reminder of the orthodox Lambic style - unforgiving, stern, but rewarding when imbibed with patience and diligence.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2013 Bottle, 75cl brewed 2007 - Red semi hazy beer with a small be consistent head. Aroma is fruity sour with notes of red wine, oak, red berries, leather, barnyard and cassis. Flavor is sour fruity with heavy notes of oak and leather as well as hints of red wine, tannins and earth. Highly enjoyable, not the best lambic Ive had but definitely in the top.

Bottle. Pours a matte red, with an invigorating but quickly disappearing head. Aroma is very funky with sweaty socks and horse as well as sour brett, berries and a sweet vinous fruitiness. Body is light with a soft to non-existent carbonation. Flavour is sour with brett, as well as oak barrels. Heres lots of fruits with both sour apples and plums, and nice, sweet and fruity vinous notes.
nice cantillon but there are in my opinion some better ones out there. but i will give it another go!

Bottle at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival 2012. Hazy red/brown liquid with minimal pink head. Aroma of lemons, red berries, grapes, funk (barnyard), apples and some light lacto. Taste is dry and medium to high sour with notes of grapes, berries and lemons. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Just awesome, very complex and balanced.

En 2006-flaska köpt i Ölbutikken i Köpenhamn. Vacker ljus varmt röd färg. Oxiderad doft med svavelinslag, syrlig och stallkaraktär. Smaken är något oxiderat och den mår bra av att luftas en stund. Balansen perfekt, druvsmakerna inte tydliga men en liten fruktighet märks som balanserar syra sötma väl. En riktigt bra geuze.

750 bottle to flute glass...

Aroma: Similar to Cantillon fruit lambic but more winey, no doubt because of the grapes. More sweet aromas than the aforementioned and less latexy...quite floral with notes of grape, blackcurrant, cherry, and some grapefruit. 

Appearance: Cloudy dark reddy color, the head left quickly and was pinkish white.

Taste: Quite like a merlot wine, and very complex too with lots of fruit and citrus flavours. Aftertaste is definitely grapes and classic lambic flavours.

Palate: Spritzy and dry, slight sour aftertaste and slightly tannic. Quite good.

Overall: Probably my favorite lambic of the ones Ive tried though Im not a fan of the price tag. Perfect balance of sweet and sour with lots of character.
2012.10.06 - sample at brewery (brouwkwintessens Cantillon) - very pleasant acquaintance with this beer of red grapes

Bottled. Poured ruby red in colour with a small head. Berries, earth and some sour notes in taste. Lemon also with some woody notes in aftertaste. Dry finish. One of the best fruit lambics Ive had so far.

75 cl bottled Oct. 12, 2011. Bright pink/red with a pink-white head. Nose is berries (mostly strawberry), leather furniture, some vinegar, vinous. Tart fruits, oak, wine, star fruit, bitter grapefruit. Tickling tartness. Not incredibly tart but left my mouth pretty numb 2/3 through. Soft spritzy body. Probably the driest finish of any beer Ive ever had. Leaves the pleasant chalky dryness you get in your mouth after eating a banana or two. Just an incredible palate.

En botella.Rojiza con fina espuma rosacea,con cuerpo medio aromas a vino,madera....pinot....
Acida,con final un poco balsamico.

750 ml Bottle, Vintage 2011 on cork. BIG thanks to Adam Jackson for this brew! Used a tall pilsner glass. Delightful Purple wine color with steady carbonation. Head produced by carbonation is reminiscent of champagne. Nose is sour fruit. Mostly grape and raspberry. Notes of funky oak. Taste is a sour blend of the nose with a major puckering effect. The oak flavor comes through like the scent of old wood saturated from a rain storm. The first taste made me salivate so hard, there was pain in my salivary glands: like when biting in to an unripened, fresh, green apple. The carbonation leaves a prickliness on my tongue which was quickly replaced by the very drying, cotton-mouth finish. Overall: once the bottle was gone, I was disheartened that I did not have another.

Échantillon bouteille 750ml au Bières et Saveurs de Chambly. Couleur rouge vin opaque, peu de mousse laissant un léger anneau autour du verre. Arôme vineux, boisé, avec une note rappelant la ferme. Goût vineux, boisé avec une grande acidité. Faible carbonation. Toute une expérience, elle est excellente.

2009 vintage

reddish pink color, off white head. Pretty looking beer.
Straw, horse blanket, vinegar, grape, lemon, plumb. Solid nose. 
More like a sour grape tart in the mouth. Zesty and lively. 
Fun beer to drink

Bottle shared at a tasting at idonis place. Pours tan red with a nice head, aroma of brett, lemon, grapes, wine, some vinegar and plums, flavor is sour with vinous tones, pickled cucumber, light fruitiness with plums, lots of barnyard, medium to full bodied, amazing
sampled at bieres et saveurs A: vinous, wood cherry, barnyard. App: darkish pink no head. T/p: light body with acidic long finish soft carbonation. O: amazing complex an experience, unique.

Bottle (750 ml). Clear red with a medium diminishing pink head that leaves a small fully lasting pink neck. Some lacing. Aroma is soft with raisins, vinous, barnyard and tart. Taste is slightly sweet with raisins, good sourness, red wine notes and some earthy notes. Acidic and vinous mouthfeel that leaves the mouth dry. Great balance and wonderful complexity. The red wine notes are different from beers that have only matured in wine barrels (because of the grapes used) and it make this beer unique. Truly a masterpiece!

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2012 Sample on tap at Bières et saveurs (Chambly). Pours dark red. Aroma: barnyard, wine acidity, red fruits. Tastes is very reminescent of red wine. Refreshing, easily drinkable. Amazing sourness. On style. Excellent beer!

375ml bottle. No date on the label but I pop the cork to reveal the number 2005. Pours a lovely ruby red shade and thankfully some head forms on top. The aroma jumps out of the glass like no Cantillon Ive had up until now. At its core vinegar and red grape entwine and cling to the nostrils. Around them a whirlwind of earthy, organic scents can barely be contained by the glass. Its the usual Cantillon experience on the tongue, except the years have stolen some carbonation. Only once Im down to the hazy dregs does it become bracingly sour. A wonderful fruit lambic overall; I only hope Im lucky enough to sample even better ones in the future.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2013 Bottle from bitter virtue. Red with lacy head.  Tart red fruit aromas.  Taste is sour but very clean, full of red grape and tannic red wine notes.  Good carbonation and thickness.  Very nice beer, probably my favorite fruit lambic besides Lou Pepe Framboise.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2017 Bottle sample at a tasting at idonis place. Thanks zvikar. Pours cloudy red, no fizz, no head. Sour grapes aroma, ammonia and raspberry. Tastes delicately sour and acidic. Light body, a little carbonated, sour finish.  7/4/6/3/11=3.1 Bottle sample at The Local Pub, Athens, 10.2.17. Thanks people from the next table! Hazy red. Pungent aroma of vomit and rotten cheese, strong, pungent sour taste. Medium body, powerful sour finish. 7/3/7/4/14=3.5

2011 Vintage purchased at De Hopduvel Gent in May of this year. Enjoyed with my GF in our HIll Farmstead stemware at around 65 Degrees F. 

A - Poured with half a finger solid white head that faded fast to nothing. Looks very soft and still in the glass. Burgundy purple/red appearance, murky and very "raw" in appearance. 

S - I get the scent from 2 feet away. Up front tart and funky scent. Lots of weird characteristics that were unexpected. Sort of rubbery and heavy birch wood scent. Hints of berries and rotten grapes. 

T - Wow. This is delicious. Of course, theres this funky tart bitter-sweet taste up front. its followed by this astringent grape skin sort of tannins dryness. Hint of very standard grocery store grape fruit juice taste. Hint of lemon juice and this heavy oak / birch finish. Worth mentioning too that its less fruity than expected and slightly too much acidity and I wasnt expecting that much from a Cantillon. 

M - 40% carbonation on my mouth swish. Medium body (surprising for a Fruit Lambic) and a puckering dry finish.

O - As usual, the cork comes out of the bottle after uncapping. Its more grape like than expected but a solid lambic. When i was in Belgium, I bought the most of this beer and Im glad I did. Its very enjoyable and worth sipping on.
Reddish/purple pour with a white head.  Aroma is tart grapes, wood and funkiness.  Taste is tart grapes with sour and funk flavor.  Beautiful and tasty.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 Pours a concord grape purple with a white head. Aromas of grapes, oak, funk. Taste is tart grapes, sour funkiness, dry finish. Oakiness is very apparent. This is world class stuff. Fuck.
En arôme comme en bouche, cest impitoyablement vineux avec le raisin surette qui prend charge de la coupe. Belle effervescence au départ et se boit comme un vin plus les bulles se dispersent.

75 cl bottle (shared with the Mrs.; 2011 vintage) to oversized snifter. Looks good; an opaque, deep mohagony with a slightly tinted lacing of the same color. Smells good too; fruity and funky. Tastes like it smells, only more robust and funkier with barrel flavor present. Very good on the palate. Delicious!

(bottle, 75cl, bottled in 2011) Hazy, red colour with a pinky and short foamy head. Cellary and oaky notes upfront, accompanied by a mild acidity and a vinous fruity touch of dark grapes. Moderately sour and slightly tart flavour, medium to light bodied with a matured and well-carbonated mouthfeel. Present Lambic-character with genuine notes of barnyard and a rather delicate fruity touch of grapes, raspberries and citrus, combined with oaky, tannic and a bit iodinic flavours; dry and moderately acidic and tart finish with a lasting aftertaste of barnyard, oak and a balanced vinous fruitiness. Excellent. Probably there are some other grape varieties which were even more suitable for a brew like this, e.g. the extremely rare and dark variant of the aromatic Muscatel, the Rosenmuskateller/Muscat rose à petits grains. 21.VII.12

Apariencia: color muy similar al del vino rosado, es decir, un rojo suave, muy poco turbio, poca espuma blanca, poco carbónico. 
Aroma: muy intenso y complejo, vinagre de Módena, vino, uva, madera, manzana verde y toque funky. 
Sabor: complejísimo, en un primer momento predominan los sabores propios de las lámbicas, para luego pasar a predominar los del vino, por lo tanto empieza con ese funky terroso, manzana verde, vinagre de Módena y luego se nota más el dulzor de la uva y la madera. Alcohol muy bien integrado. Retrogusto larguísimo. Punto agrio, pero compensado, equilibrado, no es excesivo.
muy compleja, con muchos matices, pero nada exagerados, compensados. Excepcional

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2015 Bottle: Vintage 2008:
A sparkling and very quick disappearing off white creamy creme light tan head leaves a headless (light) hazy amber with red ish tints colored beer in the glass.
Smell old flowers, vinegar, leather, berries and grapes, wild yeast, a fine crispy tartness, barn, some crispy yoghurt and tart fruit notes and a hint of yeast infected wood.
Taste is another fine mix of the typical Cantillon ingredients like the wild yeast, old wood and nice tartness, there are also hints of old vegetables, something like old wet wood with a light light light smokey tar tint, lot of sour yeasty berries and grape notes, vinous, light dry, stingy in a different and finer way (better way than any other beer), some dried hops and hay and some candy sour times five...
Aftertaste of wood, yoghurt tartness times two (still medium and lower than many other beers of Cantillon), berries and some grapes and a nice woody dryness.
Medium to fuller carbo, lively tingly and sparkling tart mouthfeel, medium to full body and a vinous texture.
Another lovely beer, well balanced, (t)art and tasty.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 750 bottle.... poured into Cantillon tulip glass.... shared with Karin.....It pours hazy dark red with a quick disappearing medium pink head but with a forever lasting sparkling small head..... The aroma is sour, berries and fresh fruit.... The flavor is sour, grapes, berries and citrus....nice sparkling mouthfeel....very nice.....

On bottle at Olympen.
Red color, good foam.
Fruity aromas & intense stable aromas.
Medium body & high complexity.
Intense sour
Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Expected a bit more from this Cantillon actually. It really is a wine-geuze, you can taste the wine grapes very good, but overall I miss the acidity. Its not my favorite Cantillon creation, or maybe it was the batch, Ill try next year.

2011 decanted bottle to wine glass
Aroma of hay and wine. Semi transparent red with a white head. Tastes like a slightly sour red wine with a nice warm burn.

Basunen: trevlig bärig doft av hallon och svarta vinbär. Smaken er trevlig syrlig med fina bäriga toner. Lite kort eftersmak, men ack så gott. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 mL bottle @ De Heeren van Liedekercke. Pours a plum purple appearance with no head. Pretty funky, mild red grape, rich oaky, plum, date aroma. Fairly sour, quite tart, dark grape, dry, vinous, oaky, mild vanilla flavor with a tart, dry finish.

2010 vintage. This one pours a lighter bodied dark cranberry red in color with a one finger slightly pink head. The nose is dry and musty with a nice amount of funk and acidity. The flavors are dry and tart and it has nice acidity. As a wine drinker, I must say that this has zero characteristics of a Merlot so its nice to see the difference between the beer and wine. This one is musty as hell. It drinks light with nice acidity but I cant really like the flavor. It doesnt have enough fruit character for my liking. This is the best vintage Ive had so far. The 07 smells like puppy farts in my opinion, as in "I just fed my dog too many rawhides" puppy farts. I definitely prefer this vintage to that one.

Bottle picked up at de Bier Tempel in Brussels, consumed later on in our room at tKeizershof in Brugge. 

The beer pours a deep purple color with a small head that fades fairly quickly. 

The aroma is very funky, barnyardy, with some light citrus rind, and fruit forward notes like bright grapes. 

The beer is very dry in flavor and is also very sour, not unlike gueuze in this regard but certainly different. The light fruit and leathery tannic character of the grapes is skillfully matched & balanced with the character of the Lambic. In fact the grapiness starts with a touch of sweetness that passes very quickly allowing for the tartness and dryness of the beer to take center stage. The grape character and the funky sour lambic really interweave and at times lean on each other to become something truly greater than the sum of their parts. Making a rich, bold beer that is at times subtle, and elegant all around. 

Easily among the finest and the most enjoyable beers I have ever tried.

75cl Bottle at WWT, from De Bierwinkel. Hazy reddish amber/burgundy colour, dense light pink head. Aroma is sour, grapes, lemon, very fruity, vanilla, wood. Flavour is light sweet, sour, fruity, grapes, wood, light vanilla, light sour fruity finish. Light bodied, full carbonation. Nice, even for a non-gueuze drinker.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2012 Pours pink red with low white frizzy head
Exploding aromas of sourness, grapes, hints of oakyness as well
Distinct sourness in taste, ending is almost like a red wine and you can really feel the grapes and the burgundy barrels making its effect.
Its an extremely fine tuned and nice lambic!

Bottle shared by drabmuh. Thanks Matt!

Dec. 2008 vintage.

A: Bright purple color with a slight haze. There is but a wee head that fades quickly, leaving no lacing.

S: A noticeably different aroma than the draft serving. I detected more of Cantillons distinct, funky barnyard scent in the bottled version. Aromas also consist of berries, grapes, oak.

T: Though the serving type altered some of the characteristics of this beer slightly, this is a world class fruit lambic nonetheless. Fabulous grape flavors, though more subtle than the draft version, wrapped in a sour farm blanket make for a truly delicious beverage. There is a nice tannic presence to the beer, as well. This is extremely well-crafted, with a myriad of flavors coming through. Balanced to perfection, I give this beer my highest recommendation.

M: Nice and tart. Lip smacking, puckering and fabulous.

D: A terrific example of what a fruit lambic can and should be. A another masterpiece from one of the worlds finest breweries.
Red to even purple, small bubbly pink head. Red grapes, wine vinegar, cherry. Pretty sour, some fruit. Fruity geuze and tasty total taste. (At WWT Leiden)

Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Pours hazy ruby red color with minimal head. Aroma of grape fruits, some sour cherries, berries and grass. Flavor of sour cherries, berries, mild grape fruits, some goose berries and yeast. Quite nice balance between the fruity berryness and sour cherries. Very nice.
3355

Fresher vintage (2010 or 11) rated from notes in fall 2011. Pours raspberry red with fluffy clouded white heading. Smell is sweet wine grapes and raspberries. Taste is much more mild than typical aged Cantillon (fruit or otherwise). Very enjoyable tart finish thats not too acidic. Incredibly unique and love how fruit forward the fresh vintages are.

16-JUN-2012, draft @Un Mare di Birra.
Hazy red with white/pink head.
Very berryfresh - raspberry? Sour cherries, funk, barnyard, wood.
Sour with no carbonation. Very fine.

As usual for Cantillon, I loved this.  dark burgundy with a head of a lighter shade.  As always, the great balance of tart, sour, dry, sweet, funk.  This time with some wood interplay and a slight sweetness at the finish.
(Bottle 16/05-2012) Low white head, clear red color, sour aroma, light sour red wine taste.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 bottle at home ... thanks  to ben ... deep red ... thin white head ...  deep fruity ... light farmyard funk ... soft fruits ... light mellow fruits ... loads of grape ...  soft tartness ... light juicy fruits ... its ok i supose ... really just not me.. Tk x at dinas.. Yeah pretty much previous

Bottle. Vibrant beetroot purple with a slightly pink head, looks tremendous. Distinct lambic aroma, funky, some blackcurrant berry fruitiness. Taste has super funky lambic flavour offset by blackcurrant fruitiness. Slightly sweet followed by a massive tart finish. Excellent

In bottle at Craigs, thanks Ben! Pours a ruby colour with a fair pinkish head. A lovely tannic aroma, reminds me a little of cider. Cherries, lemon, balsamic vinegar, oak and red wine characters also. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. A lovely dry finish. Superb!

2008 bottle...Pours a clear amber with light reddish hues...some sediment...thin white head.  Aroma is tart...lightly floral...touch of honey...with very mild merlot notes.  Flavor is very tart...lemony with funk and faint leather...touch of vinegar...all atop oakiness...not getting much merlot but still tastes fabulous!!  Motuhfeel is light and very lively with a dry, oaky/lemony finish.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2014 05/14 Re-rate: This has become one of my favorite beers from Cantillon. 2011 bottle on this occasion. Such wonderful, sharp wood character. Biting acetic funk. Still plenty of grape must and jammy blackberry tartness. Effortlessly drinkable. Wonderful. Moving this on up to 4.2
	
Bottle @ Craft. Deep cherry red color with a small pink head. The nose is bright sugar and funk, yeast, light lactose. The taste is lightly yeasty red grape skin, refined sugar, puckering funk. Loads of tangy grape fruit cordial. Light and easy to drink, soft. Very nice. 3.9

750ml cork and capped bottle.  Bottled in 2010.

Cork pops with a nice hiss.  Pours deep clear reddish purple with a surprisingly big pinkish beige head that shows decent retention.

Aroma is a great combo of oaky tannins, overripe red grapes JD an emerging funky barnyard character.  There is a light acidity but its not overpowering by any means.

Initial taste is a light acidity with a lot of oak and fruity red wine.  The finish is really musty with some funk mixed with the oak barrel.  Maybe some sugary sweetness underneath the sourness.

The mouthfeel is dry and fruity, dry much like a red wine in its feel.

This is one of those beers you take for granted in the chase for all the "rarer" Cantillons and 3F.  Its fantastic, enough fruit to balance the acidity and funk.  Big fan.

Draft from a well aged keg at Eulogy. Poured a dark pink with a light pink head. Rich full flavors. Red wine sour. Deep and complex. Mellowed with some aged barrel funk. Very vineous sour. Some earthy notes. Medium full body. Interesting dry bitterness at the finish. Have had younger versions and this one only seems to get better with age!

Bottled on 10/18/11, tasted on 6/2/12. It pours a nice purplish red color with a pink head that disappears quickly. The aroma has nots of barnyard, hay, minerals, berry fruit (mostly red grapes) and mild notes of cheese and oak. The flavor is less acidic than other Cantillon offerings Ive had. It starts with red berry fruit, red grapes, raspberries, strawberries followed by a nice tart, citric finish. The aftertaste brings some welcome notes of graham cracker maltiness. Theres just the right amount of acetic acid for added sharpness without being noticeable. This is really a good example of how a fruit lambic should be done. I appreciated the subdued sour character in favor of more fruit. Well done indeed! If I take anything from this bottle, its that I will try to drink Cantillon bottles within a couple years rather than age them.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2012 75cl bottle @ Kaisla. Bottled 11/2011. Poured reddish color with a thin pink head that quickly disappears. Aroma is heavenly, sour, barnyard notes, vinegar, grapes. Flavor is grapes, very tart, vinegar, barnyard. Very dry. Cant put into words how good this was. My top 3 all time.

Pours a nearly opaque rose color. 3-4 finger head that quickly dissipates. You can really smell the fruit and oak on the nose. Taste is like delicious sour grapes. Light carbonation. Nice tartness with a crisp mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Surprisingly bitter.  Almost cider-like -- in the Austurian-natural tradition.  Aroma has grapes but the taste is more mellow in that regard.  Drinks a bit like a gutturnio frizzante.  Wow.
Pours ruby with no head, decent carbonation. Smell is dry like wine, fruity. Taste is sour, acidic, medicinal, almost painful, destroys the palate, dont let this be the first beer in your day/night.
Queensday 12 gedronken bij dutchdrebus samen met benzai. Mooi kleurtje rood, niet helder. Geen schuim. Ruikt zoet. Smaakt zoet, fruitig (rood fruit).

Bottle. Reddish, cloudy, small and fully diminishing head. Moderate, dryish and sour aroma, fruitiness, some vinous - dark fruits. Moderate, dry and sour flavor, vinous with some fruitiness, light notes of wood. Finish is average, dry and sour, some fruitiness, vinous - dark fruits, light notes of wood. Fruity and vinous lambic with notes of wood/oak.

Head: small pinkish thats away fast 
Colour: watermelon red 
Smell: red fruits, cherrys, wineously sour ,bit sweet 
Taste: start is pretty acidic but then hits in a very very nice flavour of grapes with a small bitterness of the tipical bitterness you taste when "biting" a grape/skin of a grape, vinegary acidity runs thru the whole flavour as well as and underneath small dose of bitterness, end is cherrys and a little bit sweet banana like , very very nice !!!

Bottle @ DØE meeting. Pours reddish golden with a s white head. Aroma of grapes, dust, bread, yeast, oak. Taste is rather sour with grapes, barnyard notes, dusty, yeast, oak. Thin body, lively carbonation, dry and tart finish. Lovely. 160512

Bottle coaxed out of MrPickles cellar by Tooch4321...thanks Andy and Adam! - Pours rosy amber wit a thin ring of white head. Nose is red wine, a bit of cheese, and a touch of shower curtain. Earth and hay. Taste brings in the tartness, with vinegar, dry red wine, and citrus rind on the finish. Very tart. Soft carbonation and a fairly light body. Glad I tried this.

75cl bottle shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah at QDT12. Hazy, murky, almost opaque dark (bordeaux) red color, small off-white to lightly pink, mostly diminishing head that leaves fair lacing. Smell lightly sour, lightly grapes, lightly yeast. Taste moderately acidic and grapes. Dry finish of avergae duration. Low to medium body, dry texture, medium but soft carbonation. Nice balance.

Bottle at Monks in Sioux Falls back in SoDak, via notes.  A bar with several Cantillon bottles on the menu for really good prices, for a bar. ($30)  Pours a deep purple red with some frothy pink bubbles.  Aroma is wine grape skin, oak and some sour notes. Taste is much more wine like than almost any beer Ive had.  The grape skin and tannins come through here with a slight lactic sourness and some funk at the end. Overall, I liked this a lot to have a glass here and there but I would call this one of my least favorite Cantillon bottles. (Not that I wouldnt buy this again if I saw it, when shared.)
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Big bottle @ QDT?12 thx to benzai. Very unique red and purple opague colour with a small lacing pinkish head. Smells grapes, not even sour, fruity, fresh. Tastes slightly sour, very refreshing, fruity, balanced.. Great cantillon brew. Medium body, lovely carbo.

A: Poured a very light purple color with good carbonation leaving a nice cap and some bubbles

S: Big grape character on the nose with funk and old oak/wood spirals

T: A musty but big and rich load of purple grapes with some oak, light vinegar and Earthiness. I believe a little tartness from a white grape was provided for good measure

M: Nice dry, medium body and well carbonated. The sourness really hangs in there as does the grapes. 

O: Delicous!

Bottle at home bought at the brewery. Browny red dark amber colour, small white head. Aroma is weird, smells a bit like our cat toilet, but in a nice way. Lots of wood, something vinous, bit of sourness. Fruity too, and a bit musty. Taste, nice and sour, some faro like sweetness. Fruit, bit of lemon, bit of grapefruit, vinous. Rising sourness. Some maltiness too. Quite unusual and pretty nice. Usual Cantillon sour spritz kick. Very nice.
750ml bottle split with mcberko. Pours murky red with a small head. Aroma of sour fruits, red wine and oak. Flavour of soured fruits, red wine, oak, funk. Full bodied, and complex. Really nice.
Bottle. Cloudy cherry with thin bubbly white head. Funk, raspberries, grapes, oak, vinegar. Sour with lasting tartness. Low carbonation, balanced.

2011 vintage. Grape skins, slight acetic, sour is at the forefront with very low funk. Delicate, light aromatics with a touch of bandied/phenolic. Not ridiculously sour but it will pucker the mouth. very refreshing. I could drink this all night.

05/04/2011 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Rosso ciliegia, intenso, torbido e denso, con bellissima schiuma rossiccia. Al naso note dolciastre, acide, balsamiche. In bocca è acida, con note citriche, balsamiche, resinose. Si percepiscono note di uva, che conferiscono un sapore quasi da vino. Corpo medio, consistenza mielosa liquida, lievemente astringente. Spettacolare.

75 cl bottle thanks to Nisse666! Sampled on March 8, 2012

Poured a cloudy red with thin white head.  Loads of funk, sweaty wool socks, musty cellar, sour grapes.  Taste of red wine vinegar, sour raspberries.

Appearance:  Pours dark red no head. Sparse bubbles.

Aroma:  Red fruit, lemonade as well as passion fruit.

Taste. Cork. Apple skin, unripe brambles, light red white vinegar.

Mouthfeel:  Full bodied with low carbonation.

Overall: Very tasty, balanced and refreshing.

Reviewed on: 05-13-2011. not sure the vintage, but I would suspect its the most recent (2010). pour was a dirty ruby red with no head. some of the pours had about an inch of ruby head and some had none. no lacing or retention. very complex on the nose. heavy red wine and bordeaux, fresh grape, and sufficient amount of still vinegar. light oak. very similar to the smell. heavy on the red wine characteristics and this is where the bordeaux really shines. lots of varying grape flavor. a fairly mild sourness through out. a very strong oak finish. very flat and smooth. light puckering sourness and a very dry bone dry finish. quite delicious. lots of red wine and grape flavor and mild sourness just make this so drinkable. quite different from the aged version of this.

0.75l bottle shared with ClubGonzo, Storemy and Inbreak. Pours a nice cloudy red-pink looking body with a small mildly pinkish head. The aroma is lovely as it often is from Cantillon. Mildly sour and tart with wood, berries and funky basement. Its average carbonated and has a oily texture. Lots of vinous red berries in the flavor. Red currants, grapes and perhaps even some sour strawberries? Interestingly tart - but never to much. Really light drinkable and quite good. I guess if you did not know better youd might confuse this for a really really good roséwine 12.02.2012

Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated on 11.04.2011
Aroma has grapes, some red wine notes and sour, earthy notes. Flavour is rather sour with earthy notes, some grapes and grapefruit juice.
There is rather big difference between draught and bottle versions; the 1,5 year old bottle was more flat and less sour. Id give it a 3.7.

Rating 2000# Big bottle 2009 vintage share with friends cons 2012-03-08 Göteborg
Ar: bit tart, tingling sweetness, raspberries juice, then very tart
Ap: ruby pink, frothy of white head
F: tart, cold stired up raspberry juice, grape fruit, high bitterness, heavy carbonation, lemonade without sugar

From notes.  First reviewed 3/18/2011.  Served on tap at Local Option in a snifter.

The base color of this beer is a hazy cherry color, with tints ranging from bright orange to walnut depending on the light. A very interesting appearance is capped with an light pinkish head. The retention is not amazing, but a ring around the beer sticks around for a while.

There is a fair amount of acidity in the aroma, tart grapes, vinegar, and some nice funk.

A full red grape flavor right from the start. The flavor is predictably tart, with an acidic vinegar roaming throughout. Some barnyard funk is present, although fairly modest. The sour flavor lingers after each sip.

Medium body, with crisp carbonation up front. The feel smooths out toward the end. Definitely causes the salivary glands to go into overdrive and creates a moderate puckering sensation, although this falls into the average range of sourness.

Overall: I have been waiting to try this beer for a while now, and it did not disappoint. Due to the grapes, it has an obvious wine-like character, which is enjoyable. Whether it is worth the price tag, however, is debatable.

Tasted at the Triple Rock Sour and Barrel Aged Fest on 2/12/2011. This fruit lambic pours a medium reddish color from the tap. Small to medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is fruity, cherry, tart and woody. A medium bodied lambic. The malts are fruity, tart and funky. Decent carbonation. The tart, sour, sweet are balanced very nicely. Cantillion is Cantillon. Well balanced, subtle complexities, tart and sweet all blended together is an amazing beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and crisp. Aftertaste is slightly tart.

[4209-20111223] 750mL bottle. Tart fruity raspberry-like aroma.  Hazy, dark red amber body with a medium-lasting foamy light pink head. Super sour fruity malt flavour has a long fruity aftertaste. Medium-full body. Delicious. (8/4/8/4/17) 4.1
(@ beerbistro, Toronto, ON)

Ruby red, and pinkish head forms, leaves some lace on the glass. Smell is grapes, fruit, citrus acidity, wine, sulphur, wheat, cherries. Taste is very tart, cherries, grapes, oak, vinegar, citrus, bread, wheat, fruity acidic finish. Mouthfeel is light bodied with low to medium carbonation.

Bottle from Ølbutikken, shared with Bergen Beer Geek Tasting Crew. Pours a hazy purple body with a small white head. Aroma is brett, lemon, red grapes, sugar, hints of horse blanket and black berries. Nice and "vinous". Taste is bretty sour lemon tones with sweet musty grape notes, black berries and hints of stale horse blanket. Soft carbonation. Strange, beautiful and very original - this is truly "beer meets wine". A different kinda lambic, a different kinda magic. :-)
Ruby/pinky body with a thick lasting white head. Fruity aroma (red wine), citrus. Taste is gorgonzola, red grapes. Sour.
Beautiful pinkish raspberry red pour with awesome white head. Taste is mildly fruit and funky with some oak.

Sample at Central Waters anniversary party.  Purple-red pour.  Tart citrus, mild funk, and red wine fruitiness.  Smooth tart citrus, sweet red grapes and wine, and light woodsy finish.  Lightly dry with nice, even carbonation.

nice light pink head, lasting, cloudy amber/rose colour. Heavy nose with wine, dry sulphur, kirsch and balsamico. Powerfull  and fruity yet very elegant. Medium body and good length. Taste is dry with some fruityness, kirsch, raspberries, red vinegar. Very fine. I really like this type of beer.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2012 nuts, floral, red, cloudy, brown foam, heavy cloying, medium bitterness, heavily sour, full body, thick feel, long finish, raisin, cough drop, minimal head, light sweetness, long finish,

2008 bottling, pours a reddish brown, almost copper with no head, just a light fizz on top.  The nose is pure funk.  There is a reaso that Cantillon suggests you drink the fruit lambics within three years and that is to maximize on the fruit.  However, I love the funk so I am fine with letting the fruit go.  The nose has cheese, dirt and leather.  The flavor runs you through the gambit, starts sweet and maintains a degree of sweetness throughout, while saltiness and bitter hit you in the middle followed by a grandios sour exit that leaves you puckers for a bit.  I love this style.  Mouthfeel is very light, super fizzy for a beer that didnt have much head.  I love this beer the older it gets.  Glad I could finally rate it.

75 cL bottle from Beers of Europe, poured into an Affligem glass.  Light red wine colour, with a short burst of fizz and then the head calmed down.  Deep red fruit aroma, but also vinegar acidity.  Drinkable, but not particularly exciting.  Still, its decent.

750 ml from Brewery Creek. What a rich lipstick color, like homemade raspberry jam. Small pink beige head. This color is seductive. The aroma is pungently poopy, and at first several sips the diaper is overwhelming other nice stuff. Penetrating beneath the poop, I first find cheese rinds. So it doesnt look good so far. I have to patiently search for the nice lambic character, the dried cranberry and the nutty malts. The resin, and retsina. As it sits, the dark wine-infested infected old wood character emerges more. Its certainly compelling enough to drink a lot of. The palate is nice, and its all up hill from there. Soft and gentle with a high degree of acidity. Lively carbonation but soft on the mouth. The finish is for me good, lots of straightforward dryness and acidity. Its a very astringent beer. Very little fruit character but does have a nice lingering pure cereal aftertaste. Lots of resin and turpentine in the finish too. Although I was expecting more (its amazing how a 4.1 is a low score for a Cantillion), this is still highly drinkable, offering an opportunity to contemplate the assault on the senses, and hitting the lambic g-spot.

Bottle.  Dark red color with a reddish colored head on it.  Smell is fruity, tart, and full of red wine notes.  Taste is sour but not too sour, with a lot of red wine flavors and tannins in it.  Taste like a glass of wine with carbonation.  Very smooth, very good, and very expensive.  As an occasional thing, this beer was fantastic.

750mL bottle, split 4 ways, pours an opaque purplish dark red with virtually no head. Aroma is intense sourness, loads of funk, dry unsweetened rotting grapes and yeast. Flavour is very puckering in sourness, with loads of very tart, dry red grapes, lots of barnyard funk, no sweetness, and red wine qualities. Very complex, dry, intensely sour and drinkable. Delicious

Served on-tap at Monks on Zwanze day. This is the 2008 version.
A - Pours murky purple/red with a very small film of white head, dissipating down to nothing at all, leaving little to no lace down the glass.
S - Smells of acidic sourness, musty basement funk, merlot grapes; from the skins to the pulp, it is all in there; and some dry oak tannins. Smells like a funky merlot.
T - Starts off with quite a bit of sharp acidic sourness slowly giving way to a mix of juicy merlot grapes and their skins, damp earth, musty barnyard funk, dry oak tannins, and some faint fruity twang at the very end. The finish is a mix of dryness and sourness, lingering for some time.
M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Sharp, vinous, feel with plenty of pucker that lingers through the finish. This is quite complex, yet very enjoyable.
O - I enjoyed my glass of this one. Sometimes the combination of funk and grapes doesnt always work but it really does here. Yet another winner from Cantillon.

This is the best Lambic that Ive had the pleasure to try.  Poured from a 750 bottle into a tulip glass.  Aroma is powerful grapes and a really nice spicy funk.  Taste is light sweetness with amazing grape flavors and a really nice tart bite that isnt overpowering.  Im grapeful to have gotten to try this one...

big big grape flavors. Huge tart and little funk. So far the best balance of
Everything.

Bottle of the 08 at the Cuvee de Castleton release.  Pours a ruby tinged garnet with a thin white head.  Soft Cantillon funk on the nose, toast, fruit.  Funky toast, acid.  Big sour lemon, fruit, funk.  Sour acid, long lingering lemon notes with more supple fruit.

750 ml bottle shared with tkrjukoff @ 3 Små Rum on November 19. pours deep red with a pink fluffy head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace on the glass. Smell is sour with leather, wet hay, gastric acid and funk. Taste is dry and sour with red grapes, redcurrant, wet grass, hay, leather, grape seeds, fresh wood and funk. Its quite peppery and warming. Finish is dry and sour with green grapes. Another excellent beer from Cantillon.

750ml bottle shared with jsprime and joe. pours deep red with a quick white head. big fruit nose with the lambic underneath. very sour upfront, big fruit, long sour woody finish. complex. great fall lambic. highly enjoyable fruit lambic, great way to get to 1500.

Bottle 75 cl, shared with _angst_ @ 3 Små Rum. Pours cloudy ruby red with a shortlived fizzy pink head. Aroma is sour, horse blanket, fruity, berry, vinous and tart. Sour fresh mouthfeel. Flavor is sour, a bit lemon juice, grapes, dry, fresh and tart. Finishes tart bitter and dry.

A taster at tre Små Rum, Gøteborg, thanks to Reza. Pours almost clear ruby with a small head. Aroma is acidic, light farmyard, spices and red berries. The beer feels and looks thick and oily, low viscosity. Taste is light sour, with a weak fruity sweetness for balance. Interesting.

This poured a reddish tinted cloudy yellow color with a white head. Aroma was of tart grapes, some barrel notes and some must.  Flavor was definite wine characters, very very tart. light funk and some yeast. Pretty good.

Fall 2011 Ratebeer gathering.  +++ Sampled from a 750 ml green corked bottle this beer poured a murky red color with a small white head that faded quickly and left no lacing. The aroma was tart grape and must with a Sweettart candy presence. The flavor was incredibly tart with notes of grape, berry, must and dust. The finish was long, tart and astringent. Medium body. Intense.
Bottle. Color red/ruby with small head. Aroma grape, oak, sour, acid. Taste grape, peach, oak, sour.
Unbelievably awesome fruit lambic with tiny, sparkly bubbles and nice smooth acidity.
Bottle shared at destructos TOSPH.  Reddish/pinkish pour with a white head.  Funky nose.  Grape, oak, and barnyard flavors.  Very nice......
Bottle shared with friends. Dark ruby red color, a little murky as well. Flavor and aroma was somewhat sour acid like but still quite enjoyable. Good sour funkness with a nice jaw tickle.
From the bottle. Amber with strong red notes, no real head to speak of after a minute or two. Barnyard funk, slight oak, berries, grapes, citrus. Sour taste balanced with sweetness.

beautiful hazy pale ruby color.  nice little bubbles tracing up the side of the glass.  floral and vinous grape aromas and flavors. some apple/peach hints floating around the musty earthy yeast.  good sourness that gives way to woody-grass and yeasty-earthy fruit-spice.  clean finish, with moderate carbonation.  I liked this one quite a lot.

37,5 cl bottle form 2008. Pours a lovely reddish amber with a very quickly dissipating head, leaving it completely still. Aroma has intense brettanomyces notes. Leather, barnyard, smells like bark from an old tree, musty oak, sweet notes of dark grapes, dried grape fruit peel, and I even get hints of figs which I would never expect from a lambic. Pouring a bit more and swirling it, I immediately get tart notes of peel from unripe white grapes and gooseberries along with mature cheese. As it warms, notes of pinot noir spicy fruitiness comes along and a more pronounced wine barrel character. Taste starts off with a tart grape notes, followed by a sweetness, a bit like an english wine gum. Then classic gueuze qualities with all the yeast notes and classic Cantillon funk goodness and a slightly vineous oak component. Tart gooseberries, but theres a very delicate grape component that rounds the palate off very well, that together with the tartness makes a wine gum-like finish. I think this is up there with Blåbær Lambik and Malvasia Rosso. The grapes in this beer are very well integrated, playing a very subtle and yet very important role. Saint Lamvinus > Blåbær Lambik

Bottle.  Had this a few times.  Pour is slightly cloudy deep pink with a pink head.  Aroma is very tart and sweet with notes of fruit, hey , and funk.  Flavor is funky and sour but with notes of fruity sweetness and hints of lactic acid.  Sweet, funky, tasty.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 Pours redish amber with a pinky white head. Aroma has a nice tartness. Notes of sour berries, grapes, stable, leather, rural, brett, green apples, fresh and general sick! Taste of fresh grapes, citrusy tartness, sour berries, green apples, vinous feel to it, rural, huge freshness. Amazing balance..  Really really a treat. Was blown away!!

Had this again and WOW - this beer continue to amaze me. Just a perfect balance between the funk, the sourness and the fruitiness. Tons of subtle red wine notes, moldy oak, funky stable, ripe red grapes and a nice citrusy tartness. This beer is a Bosss. This rating was 4,5 and my previous was 4,3 so I am going with a 4,4 for now!

Bottle at Craft Beer Co tasting, thanks to Matt. It pours deep red-purple, with a thin white head. The nose is farmyard, juicy red grape, blackcurrant cordial, jam, lemon and chamomile. The taste is red grape, lemon, Granny Smith apple, citrus pith, lime, floral, eggy sourness and sour cherry, with a mouth-numbing sour finish. Medium body and fine fizzy carbonation. Massive drinkability, great balance, juicy fruit and sharp sourness. Great.

Bottle from 2005
Doft: Funky... oh yes, sur likaså... omedelbart gör den till känna att den inte är en liten parvel som sin yngre kusin. I denna finns det mer kraft, helt klart. Ek, torkad frukt och mjölksyra blandar sig i doften tillsammans med funken. Den luktar verkligen helt fantastiskt.

Smak och munkänsla: Oj, här blev jag förvånad. Jag förberedde mig på en käftsmäll i form av syra, men istället möttes jag av en väldigt välbalanserad smak där den extrema syran balanserades upp nästan helt och hållet av en intensiv, söt smak av kanderad frukt och russin. Rent spontant (höhö... no pun intended) känns den mer som en flamländsk röd än en druvlambic! När man dessutom smakade ölen tillsammans med ett hallon så framhävdes sötman helt galet mycket och lät smaken av torkad och kanderad frukt bara lysa igenom. Asgott!

Utseende: Inte bara smakade den likt en flamländs röd utan såg också ut som en. Mörkröd, nästintill brun, färg med ett cremevitt skum. Såg relativt ful ut i jämförelse med glaset blåbær men ack så inbjudande.

After getting my throat (and later my ass) torn apart by a 10 Kriek, Ive decided to give this a go to see if history repeats itself. 2008 vintage.

3.5 A: Lightly hazed plum color. Just about two fingers of barely pink soda pop head that falls quickly and leaves no lacing.

4.5 S: Already I know Im in for a much better experience. Tons of vinous grape with blueberry and blackberry just behind and perhaps a touch of cherry to round things out. Lots of musty funkiness with barnyard notes as well. Small oak contribution. Good balance between fruit and acid. Good bit of fruity lactic acid with just a hint of acetic acid. Very nice.

4.5 T: A good bit of sourness in this, but the acetic acid isnt overabundant. Again lots of grape with nearly as much cherry. The berry twins have taken a bit of a backseat in the taste. Plenty of barnyard and musty funk. This is loaded with tangy lactic acid. Complex and well balanced.

4.0 M: Lighter medium body. Good active carbonation. Lightly creamy and smooth.

4.5 D: Good beer. Definitely sour, but not intestine twisting. After the Kriek yesterday I had a few rounds of the quick step, but I dont imagine there will be an encore performance tonight. Solid all around.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-19-2011 23:10:21

Bottle of 08 vintage. Pours a reddish color with a small white-pinkish head. Aroma is of tart notes, funkiness, red wine grapes, oak, cherry. and barnyard funk.  Flavor is also quite sour, yet not the most sour Cantillon I have had. I get the red grapes, vinegar, funk, oak, cherry and barnyard funkiness. The body is light with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a pretty good Fruit Lambic, but not the best I have had from Cantillon.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2013 2010 Vintage [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Moeder Lambic: served in a Cantillon wine glass, hazy dark pomegranate red/purple hue with a non-lasting pink head, aroma is strong on musty oak, lots of grape skin as swell as some fermenting grapes & healthy dose of tannins, taste is very tart with lots of wine-soaked wood, tannins, bitter grape skins, somewhat odd-herbal taste, lots of brett, definitely acidic with a dry & sour finish that also after a while starts leaning towards the acidic, definitely different from what I expected, the unusual grape skin & herbal flavours do take this beer a quite unusual direction

On tap at Armsby Abbey. Served in a Cantillon long stemmed wine glass. Pours a pink/purple hue with a small pinkish head. Funky aroma with lots of sour, tart fruit scents. A hint of barnyard as well as some oak tannin. Flavor was fruity with raspberry and grape. Nice combination of sweet and sour. Fairly light in body, but you dont notice because youre dealing with the sour funk. Finishes dry and sour. Not for everyone, but I thought it was excellent.

(draught at monks cafe) clearish bright ruby, very little head but a beautiful color. Nose of moss, cherries, wet barrel, smooth and tart. Taste is out of this world. Cherries, black currants, moss, very tart without the acetic or acidic burn, big wet barrel and light red wine Influence, super complex and delicious. Near perfect palate linger.

Pour hazy ruby nice carb with pinkish head. Aroma oak, cherry, sour, tart, tannins, rad grapes, barnyard funk, wet wood. Taste vanilla, oak, red wine grapes, tannins, funk, quite tart and sour, very complex. MF light to medium body with terrific lively carb. Very well constructed with delicious taste profiles the barrel taste comes through nicely and give great balance terrific.

On tap at La Trappe in San Francisco.  Funk and vinegar aroma.  Taste is sweaty farmhouse funk and grape with a major acidic bite - and I mean all of that in a good way.  Woody in the background.  Good stuff.
750mL corked bottle.  Poured red into glass with pink head and small lacing.  Aroma of wine grapes and citrus.  Tastes of sour red wine and oak.  Champagne like carbonation.

Amazing beer! Clear rose tinted appearance with a small head. Wonderful smell of musty wine and brett. The flavor follows through similarly. Great full mouthfeel while maintaining the characteristic Cantillon dryness. Unlike any beer I have had before or since.

750 ml bottled in 2010 shared by cenzo.  Thanks Vince.  Pours a bright cherry red with small white head that has decent retention and leaves a bit of lacing on the glass.  The aroma is a light brett funkiness, red wine grapes, light tannins with a bit of oak as well as a bit of cherry.  The initial taste is quite sour with a little bit of sweetness and the red wine grapes coming through.  A bit of oak and cherry are present as well as some lactic acid.
