The standard Cantillon barnyard funk is present in small amounts as well.  The finish has a light tannic astringency.  Light to medium body with a really good slick mouthfeel.  Low to medium carbonation.  Another great Cantillon beer that I would be happy to drink anytime.

750 ml capped and corked bottle purchased at Royal in Kansas City, Missouri.  Bottled on 21 November 2010.  Opens with a soft pop. Pour is a slight haze ruby pink with a one inch pinkish off white head, which falls noisily. Aroma is red wine tannins, general red grape, grape skins and a nice barnyard leathery Brett.  The Cantillon citrus sour is present as well, though certainly behind the wine.  Secondary is the oak, contributing more of the tannin. The taste is the round Merlot grape, full of tannins, very earthy along with drying leathery Brett and a nice clean dose of the Cantillon lemon citrus sourness. As the beer warms to room temp, it really takes on the feel of a Brett infused red wine. Palate is medium to light bodied, active spritzy carbonation and the sour dry finish. The oak and red wine carry the longish finish.  This was a very unique beer, well executed and certainly worthy of the splurge. With age on this, it must be bone dry.

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Cranberry red in colour with medium carbonation. Aromas are of tart lemon, mild grape, savory herbs, and a touch of mozzarella cheese. Flavours are of grape tannin, wet wood, lemon rind, and herbs. Long on the palate, with loads of good acidity. Another winner from Cantillon.

I think perhaps Im being unfair and giving this beer too low of a rating because this just isnt my style.  I can see the quality put into it, and it is fairly complex, but seems much to harsh and yet insipid for my taste.  Its a bit vinegary both in aroma and in taste.  It seems very dry, and astringent even.

Aroma: Only vinegar
Appearance: deep red
Taste: vinegard and yeast.
Palate: medium body.
Overall: 7/20. It was in terrible condition.

bottle.   Moderate- Heavy oak character, some nice creamy berry parfait fruit character.  pleasant, clean leathery, cheesy funk.   lotta bright yogurty lactic funk.   complex, tasty, well made beer.   like a lot.

Smell: Quite similair to a kriek, grape seeds, applecider.
Taste: Berries, grape seed, a bizarre acidity
Mouthfeel: Sour as hell, dry, very powerful.
Notes: A real sour beer, i like it
Bottled in 2005. Cloudy dark red with a diminishing pink head. Aroma is sweet, moderate sour, grapes and earthy. Flavor is medium sweet, rather sour and moderate acidic. Dry and acidic finish. 230611

2006 bottle. Pours a reddish copper color with lively carbonation and small white head. Aroma of dust, berry skin, ripe plum, cranberry, sour funk, and beautiful oak. Quite floral as well. Just amazing. Intensely sour with massive drinkability, this beer is packed with tart plum, rhubarb, blackberry, brett, big wine and lasting oak. Wonderfully executed, this stands out from most fruit lambics. Cantillon is the best. No doubt about it.

Bottle at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fa.
Pink with a white head. Aroma moderate to heavy acidic, notes of grapes. Flavor acidic, dry. Light body.

Bouteille de 750ml. Capsule métallique et bouchon de liège. Bière de belle couleur rubis, la mousse rose est discrète et laisse seulement un anneau sur le pourtour du verre. Le nez est agréable de vin rouge (normal), de levure sauvage (wow). La bouche a une bonne acidité, les saveurs vineux sont puissante.

On tap at RattlenHum.  Cantillon gets very high marks here on RB, but I think it is still an acquired taste for a lot of folks.  I am working on it myself. St. L had a tangy aroma and a nice russet color.  Taste of lemon, herbs, a little yeasty funk, and a zesty bitterness.  Good!

tap at RnH - huge sour nose, berries. Sweet berries, wine grapes, oaky, earthy funk. lip smacking tartness with a smooth lactic feel, with plenty of citrus. Smooth, almost creamy body with the perfect amount of carbonation.

Purple grape colour, almost red wine, light carbonation, no real head. Aroma very reminding of red wine, berries: grapes & blackcurrent, oak, some tartness coming through. Flavour is very reminding of red wine. Blackcurrent, forrest fruits, vanilla, oak, quite astringent. Brett and Cantillon flavours become more pronounced in the middle, tart wild yeast with a light maltiness. Finish is rather dry and astringent. The depot, last bit of the bottle, is very nice too. Very fruity red wine there, a bombshell in flavours.
(27 May 2011. From bottle, at the brewery. With thanks to Dan Ashley and friends for sharing)
Aromas of funky dark berries.  Flavors raspberry and currant with a slight tartness.  Overall a very good lambic.

Säuerlich im Geruch, weinartig mit erdigen Tönen. Säuerlicher Antrunk, dem ein kurzes fruchtiges Aufleuchten folgt. Im Mittel intensivierte Säure, die sich bis an die Grenze eines Essigs steigert und dadurch die Süffigkeit einengt. Auch im Nachhall noch sehr starke Säure im weinartigen Aroma. Anfangs recht gut. Die äußerst starke Säure schränkt den Genuß aber stark ein. Sehr schade und leider nicht mein Fall.Test vom 2.6.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Sampled from a bottle at Delilahs Lambic Fest (Chicago, IL). 2007 Vintage. Amazed I havent rated this yet. Double pour. Pours a nice murky reddish brown hue, a touch rusty with glowing reddish edges. A decent sized frothy whitish head dies to a solid film and laces well, sticks around. Aromas are very grapey throwing some Concord and muscat grapes, sweeter slanted with a good kick of sour grapes, red wine tannins and wet oak come on at moderate strength. Bringing some healthy wet oak, faint vinegar, and more sourness, and good kick of bretty funk as it warms. Perfumey with big grape presence, sweet yet dried out with the red wine barrel and funk. Initial is a nice lighter end of medium bodied witha. Good fizzy lively carbonation, purple grape sweetness moves into moderate sourness, backend throws some touches of vinegar as it goes down, with red wine dryness, dry barrel tannins. Really tasty, easy to drink, and flavorful with a sour red winey finish. The brett stays at bay, keeping this sour and dry with the touch of mellow purple grape lingerin in the beginning, yet sweeter on the nose. World class lambic here.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2014 75 bottle shared in De Groote Witte Arend.  Pours slightly hazy red with pink head.  Tart aroma and flavor with grape, blackcurrent.  Light carbonation.  Well balanced very enjoyable beer.
Draft. Pours amber red with an off white head. Funky and tart aroma, with acidic and grapey notes. The flavor is tart, earthy oaky, and acidic, with some grapey and lemony notes. Good stuff.

75cl bottle, shared with friends, red/purper coloured without any head. Sour smell, taste: some sour and sweet balanced beer with some vine components, blueberry, grapas. Great and refreshing one! I love it!

12/05/2011 75cl bottle @ home - BB: n/a (2011-205) 
Little cloudy deep ruby red beer. Nice pink head, dissipates immediately. Aroma: lambic, very sour, bretta. MF: little carbon, medium to light body. Taste: green apples, zest, lemon juice, typical bretta, little wood, raspberries. It is not until the aftertaste that you get to taste the grapes, a little vinous, sour raspberries, lemony.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2013 Draft at 33 served in a wine glass. Pours a cloudy ruby color with a thin pink-tinted ring for a head. Aroma of vinous red grapes, light balsamic vinegar, oaky funk, and a phenolic note that comes off as boozy. Flavor of tart red grapes, balsamic vinegar, lemon juice, and more oaky funk. Medium-bodied, with medium-high carbonation and a tart, vinous mouthfeel. Really nice fruit lambic with a lot of grape character. Re-Rate: 2005 vintage. Holy moly, get your hands on a 2005 bottle of this. Incredible how it all comes together. Rating upgraded to average between the fresh and 2005 ratings (3.8 and 4.5).

(Vintage 2010)  Le liquide qui a une robe rouge se présente sans tête mousseuse.  Au nez, les levures sauvages et les bactéries sont bien entourées par des notes presque sucrées de raisins rouges.  Le merlot et le cabernet franc apportent une belle finesse et des parfums complémentaires de baies rouges.  Au goût, lacidité est agréable, justement piquante et habilement harmonisée par les fruits de la vigne.  On perçoit aussi de belles notes boisées qui sont la résultante de lentonnage.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps léger avec un pétillement très faible et une texture aqueuse.  Belle finale longue et sèche, agréablement remplie de raisins juteux et aigres.

2009 bottle. Pours a nice not-quite-clear pinkish amber with a vanishing grey coat. Aroma of musty grapes, cider vinegar. Slinky mouthfeel is very Champagne-like. Taste is fruity and balanced with the acid there but not particularly prominent until a very dry finish with grape skins. Intense red grape and berry flavour, but not so much depth in the funk. Maybe caught this one a little too early - I quite like the balance but the wine grapes are a bit much.

750ml Bottle 2007 vintage. Pours out a redish maroon topped with a pink head. Aroma was of vinegar, citrus, grapes, barnyard funk, oak, and some berries. Taste was nice more of the grape and berries. Along with a nice balance of tart and sweet a very well done lambic.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Che Siete. Dark , brilliant slightly hazy red. There was a bit of a pink head, but it faded pretty quickly. Very fruity aroma. Blackcurrants, dust, berry tartness as from redcurrants, grapes. Oak. Very acidic. The saliva just flows all over the place after a sip of this, like my favourite candy (Fox) when I was a kid. Enjoyable, but challenging. The massive sourness could become tiresome after several glasses, but two was utterly tasty. Lightly carbonated, light bodied.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2012 Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Pours a deep red, hazy colour with loads of bubbles. Aroma of tart, sweet berries, some barnyard notes and citrus. Flavour of strong, tart berries, cherries, dry oak. Medium bodied with a dry, juicy, tart finish. Very good and will probably be even better after years of aging. 8-4-9-4-16 4.1
750 ml bottle. 2009 vintage.
Pours a deep beautiful ruby colour with a pinkish head. Aroma of strawberries, grapes, oak and some interesting floral notes. Flavour is really pleasant with its tartness and vineousness; strong strawberries, grapes, tannin, some honey-like sweetness and strong dry woodiness. Medium bodied, dryish mouthfeel and a berryish, dry, tart finish. Close to a rich, deep fruity red wine. This has improved a lot, just as I expected. A top notch lambic in my book.

Tasted on 3/16/11 on draft at Local Option.  Pours cloudy red-brown with an average pink tinted head that quickly recedes to a thin collar of lace.  The nose is fruity balsamic vinegar, lightly sweet caramel, dusty chocolate, grapes, very tart and sour, and a bit of barnyard funk.  The flavor is sweet and tart grapes up front, moving to dark balsamic, malt, and a solid dose of sour lemon and barnyard funk.  The body is medium with lively carbonation and a long tannic, sour grape, and lemon finish.
Re4d body, white head. Aroma of vinegar, berries and wine. Falvour has lots of sour berries and wine.

Beer on draft, I was shocked when this was on draft at Churchkey, promptly ordered. Beer was purple and cloudy. Had no head and carbonation was low. There were a few bubbles but they failed to generate any lacing. Looks really interesting, kind of like grape juice.

Aroma is sour, citric with a hint of acetic, perhaps a little lactic in there as well. There is a slight sulfur aroma to it.

Minimal front flavor, beer is light in body. Drinkability high. The tartness gets you, its grapey and slightly sweet but in a sour and sweet sort of way. The flavors develop better on the back palate than the front. Its a great beer. There is not a lot of body to it and there is nearly no carbonation in the mouth. I really enjoyed it.

Serving type: on-tap

Draft. Reddish beer with a pinkish head. Tart/sour aroma with red fruit and red grapes. Tart/sour flavor with red fruit, red grapes, and a light sweetness. Medium bodied. Tart/sourness lingers with red fruit/red grapes and a bit of oak.

Deep red/purple color with minimal head. Big oaky, tannic red grapeskins, sour fruity aroma. Puckering sour and tannic flavor with a lot or red wine character. Spritzy. A touch of dusty brett and barnyard bite. Interesting stuff for sure. Very similar to red sparkling with with brett. This seemed a little over-oaked/tannic to me but  was still very enjoyable. Blurs the lines between wine and beer.

Last had on tap at LO.  Loved this much better than I had from the bottle. A beautiful almost purple color that looks better than Blabaer. The aroma and taste are tart barries, a little lactic, nice hore notes. Crushable, one of the best Cantillons.

Thanks bro!  Pours a translucent deep orange hue with a small pale head.  Slight citrus aroma, but mostly smells like rubber.  Intensely sour, with some grape, and grapefruit/orange citrus.  Sharp and juicy with a sourness that lingers to the next sip.  This one is quite complex, but if youre in the mood for something sour, this one will oblige you.

I lost my notes for this but it poured an amazing berry red color with notes of grapes, burgundy, oak, pomegranate, currants, funk, acidic citrus, and a slight sweetness. IT was near flat, almost like wine or juice. It is amazing.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2013 Bottle 750ml vintage 2010 @ Geokkjer
Pours hazy amber with a off-white head. Aroma is sour with notes of barnyard, grapes and horseblanket. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with a long sour fruity and dry finish. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Bottle 375ml
Pours cloudy red with a off-white head. Aroma is sour with notes of wild yeast and hints of red grapes. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with a dry finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft. [7 4 6 3 13 - 3.3 3/14/2011]

Draught @ Kaisla, Helsinki

Pours dark red, nice color. Aroma is fruity. Surprisingly easy to drink, mildly carbonated and sour.

75cl bottle. Pours a cloudy cherry-like colour with a small pink head. Wonderfully complex aroma: grapes, hay, horseblanket. Lightly sweet, moderately acidic flavor becomes a moderately sour. Acidic dry finish. Nice grapes presence. Medium body, sticky texture, lively carbonation. Huge, stunning brew.

Draught at Kaisla, Helsinki, Finland.
Hazy dark amber colour with tiny pink head. 
Sourness, cassis and berries in Lambic aroma.
Flavour is sour with berries, red berries and cassis. 
Some vinous touch.

Dark hazed amberish orange, thin white fizzy head.  Funky grape and musty wood aromas warm to soft swirls of fruity vinegar and farm.  Mouth puckering sour lemon acidity is nicely balanced on a foundation of red grape skin flavors and touches of fruity oak throughout.  Light to medium bodied, moderate carbonation, sour funk finish.  Cantillon rarely disappoints

37,5 cl bottle vintage 2005, pours reddish with a very minor head, aroma consists of brett, funk, lemon and wood, taste is similar to the aroma, slightly sour, super smooth and balanced, the grapes are pretty much gone at this point, but still a lovely beer.

Bottle shared by BOLTZ  thanks Jason!  Pours cloudy amber with a thin off-white head.  The nose is rubber, light barnyard and sour grapes.  The taste is light funk, grape skins, red wine vinegar, faint tannins and sour grapes.  Medium prickly body.  Nice lambic.

Served on tap at Ebeneezers

Poured into a wine glass. dark ruby color with almost no head at all. Aroma is very vinous with lots of sour funk. Tastes how you would think it was going to taste. Lots of lactic sourness some barnyard funk and lots of red wine taste. Puckering mouthfeel, crisp body. Its hard to draw the line here. I enjoyed this brew, but thought it might have been too wine like.

Bottle. Aroma is green apple, hay, barnyard, brett and faint Belgian hops.
Flavour is extreme sourness. Loads of green apple and some hay and grapes.
Intense. A bit too intense to notice subtle nuances.

bottle, that my dog sitter must of thought was wine because it was open in my fridge. deep pink pour, funky, earthy aromas. Acidic tartness, not overly tart (not sure when she actually opened it). berry flavor, red grapes. very drinkable & i just drank basically the whole bottle. I believe this is thanks to Rudolf or IPFreely
Rating # 1001.Bottle.Pours red orange with an off-white head.Aroma is funky, barnyard, lemon and grapes.Flavor is sour and grapy with some lemon notes.Puckering sour and dry finish.Oh so nice .

Clear red color, instantly dissipating white head. Aroma is earth, fruity grapes and some red wine. Very sour flavor, yet very refreshing and fruity. Slightly watery palate thoug. Still an awesome brew.

Rating #1100! Thanks to Devon for shelling out $40 for this particular bottle, which had been staring at me from a shelf in the local bottle shop for a years worth of visits. Shared at the December Santa Cruz tasting. 
Pours a cranberry juice color with a small white head that evaporates quickly from all the acidity.
Aroma is funky and sour with plenty of blue cheesy bacterial aspects aside lemons and unripe grapes.
Flavor is extremely characterful, even for Cantillon. Very sour but also quite sweet with rich winey grape notes and other jammy fruits. Very acidic, unripe berries and lemons. Tons of funk as well. Horsey and cheesy and musty. Some tannic/oaky stuff too. The whole gamut.
Dry finish on a medium, fulfilling body. What a classic.

2006 Bottling. Hazy violet-rose with a thin, fine pale pink head. Potent, clean sour aroma with touches of dark fruit grape notes in the background.  Hugely sour with a dry, softly fruity flavor profile with a touch of grape skins. Body is very light with great dimension.

08 bottle.  Light rust-red in the glass with slight carbonation.  Aroma is wet oak, funk, and grape.  Taste is light tart up front, grape through the mid-palate, some background funk, and a fairly precise, clean finish with lingering oak notes.  For me the body is key in a lambic and this beer came across as degraded and a bit watery - shame really.  Good but not as exceptional as I had anticipated.
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2011 First beer of 2011. Pours pink grapefruit. Nose of tart fruit and fermented grapes. Taste of white grapes, grapefruit and tart citrus. Effervescent.

Delicious, but not my favourite Cantillon.  The burgundy barrels seem to even out the flavor more than I want them to be evened.  I prefer very sour and funky lambics, and this just didnt quite do it.

Bouteille de 750 ml, embouteillée en 2008. Arômes de brettanomyces, de fruits rouges légèrement tanniques. Notes de chêne humide. Très belle robe rosée et trouble, peu de mousse et effervescence moyenne. En bouche, la bière est très sûre, à la fois lactique et citrique, au point de piquer les lèvres. On retrouve des notes de brettanomyces bien développées ainsi que la présence de tanins de fruits mûrs. Légère présence du fût de chêne. Intense et très complexe.
Bottle, shared with Dave. Hazy purple pour, fizzy fine bubbles. Aroma of funk and sour berries. Flavours of unripe berries, light wood, lactic acid. Tart, acidic finish. Refreshing.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
2006 vintage on tap at Capones - December 16, 2009.

A: Pours a nice dark crimson with ruby hues. Very minimal head. Looks a shade lighter than cranberry juice, with a bit of tawny paleness to it.

S: Not the best aspect of this beer--smells a lot like balsamic vinegar without much of the underlying fruit coming through. A tiny amount of underlying grape scent.

T: Quite tart with a bit of barnyard horse blanket. The vinegar from the nose is not nearly as dominant, and flavors of grapes, berries, and red wine come through.

M: Quite dry with very subtle carbonation.

D: Very high--every sip reveals greater complexity and no amount would seem to be enough.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 12-20-2009

Bottle. Shiny red, opaque colour with almost no head. Aroma has lots of fruit, lovely sour berries and oak. Lots of tart apple/pear, vinegar, red wine and sourness. Very nicely balanced. Taste is moderately-highly sour with a nice wineish palate. It has some nice dry notes as well, with some barnyard and syrupy sugar. Medium carbonation, long duration.

750ml, 2003 Vintage.  Pours a hazy purple with a little spitty white head.  Nose is tart, berries, flowers, a little dusty.  Flavor is tart, berries, blue berry, hay, grass, farmyard, perfume, grapes, a little wood.  Full bodied, tart finish.  Has held up really well.

Bottle, hazy purple with a thick head. Aroma is fruity and tart with grapes and sugar.  Flavor is acidic but less than the usual cantillon with sugar, tartness, funky notes, and a nice mix between lambic and grapes. A good lambic.

Bottle from 2005. Clear, rosé wine-like red, with a frothy, white, pop-like head that dissapears almost immediately. It looks really good in the glass! 
Aroma of old hay, tart, some sourness. Taste is medium sour for a Cantillon, dry on the tongue, a little vinegar and fruitiness. Very light body.  I had hoped for more character from the grapes, maybe that will come through in a fresher bottle? A really refreshing beer. Give me another bottle.

bottled in 2005. aroma of sulfur, gunpowder, cherries, sour cream, barnyard and manure. the taste is sour and earthy. barnyard, vinegar, sulfur, sour cherries and cranberry juice is in there. I prefer this beer slightly younger but its still fantastic.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2013 750mL 2003 ed courtesy of ygtbsm94. Pours a ridiculous muddy deep purple with a fizzy white head. Aroma of musty grapes, oak, wine spritzer, Taste is red grape skin, oak tannins, earth, prickly dryness, citrus tartness, slightly acidic, plus a medley of fresh berries (tart blueberry and strawberry comes to mind). High carbonation, effervescent. Not a whole lot of complexity and not too yogurty lactic. Obviously need to try more vintages of these- good thing I have a few cellared. 10/24/2010 8/4/7/4/14=3.7750mL 2008 ed. shared with my wife in Paris, France after picking up this bad boy at Cave a Bulles. Inky purple pour, generous purple foam. One of the most beautiful beers in the world. Bright, seedy near LP Kriek nose full of juicy raspberry and blackberry. Taste is similar- lactic, seedy, fruity with more finesse than LP Kriek. There is a berry medley complexity and very little acidic bite. Instead, it is refreshing and sharp with a quick, lactic finish. Really a treat to savor. There is a cult following for St Lam and for good reason.

2003 bottle shared by ygtbsm94: Pours a transparent bright ruby red with a small-bubbled stringy-lacing white head.  Aroma has some tart vinous notes and a touch of oxidation.  Starts with some light effervescence and lots of acidic tartness with some grapey fruity notes and oak complexity.  Finishes with some stomach-warming acidity. A unique beer but has a bit too much acidity.

Light crimson/plum colored pour with a small ivory head that diminishes into a ring around the glass.  Aroma filled with lemon, brett funk, and perhaps a hint of wood.  Flavor is more mild and less puckering than any Cantillon Ive had the pleasure of trying (although I did sample it after Flaming Fury).  This one brought some citrus and lots of grape, accompanied by some funk and lemongrass.  Medium mouthfeel.  Not bad.

Bouteille verte de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de cerises sûrettes avec une pointe de raisins. Apparence: La couleur est rouge légèrement voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de raisins et de cerises sûrettes. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement acide. (Rating #3282)

Pours hazy pinkish tawny with a thin mostly receding off-white head. Notes of cherry, tart acidic fruit, oak, wheat, dusty grape. Medium bodied, moderately acidic with lush carbonation. A refined and enjoyable lambic.
Sour with a fish tank finish. It smells great but has a dodgy finish. Not the most wonderful of the lambics.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2016 Bottle split with pat. Pours a deep hazy purple amber body with nice white lacing. Aroma is sharp tart grapes. Mouthfeel is ultra mouth puchering sour and tart with notes of grape, citrus. Revisited again with Paul. 2012 vintage split in March 2015. Pours a bright pinkish purple with beautiful white lacing. Mouthfeel is really finding a perfect balance between sour fruit and tart candy; notes of tart grape, sweet tart candies, raspberries, funk and nice earthy funky fruit. Incredible.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2010 Bottle. 25.4 oz. Drank at Belgian with James and Steve. Pours light rose pink with a thin, wispy, white head. Slight, gentle lacing throughout. Aroma of funk, sweet cherries, oak, lime, sour grapes, and tons of Brett. Medium bodied with a full, dank, heavy palate. Finishes dry and sweet. Excellent fruit lambic with excellent company.

A-pours a transparent deep magenta color with a light pink creamy head.

S-the nose has a great balance to it, notes of dry red grapes blend together with a fair bit of a leathery brett funk, lots of fruit sweetness lies behind with red grape and strawberry with a light acidic note to it.

T-tons of sweet that plays throughout the drink, lots of red grapes and strawberry notes, a fair bit of brett lies in the middle with just a hint of leather to it, the back adds notes of lemon that seems to dry the mouth.  the sweetness, as mentioned, holds throughout but is balanced and kept in check nicely.

M-this is smooth and creamy on the palate with spot on carbonation and a great medium to light body to it with a semi drying finish.

D-this beer is delicious and I wish this was constantly around.  the balance and flavors works so well together with a glorious sweetness melded with brett perfection and an awesome semi dry finish.

Draft... beautiful cherry red pour , thin wispy white head , no lace . Acidic , dry brett aroma with a tart fruit note .  Dry woody flavor with vinous notes . Light acidic and dry . Very tart , dry fruity finish .  Very refreshing .

Bottle.

A - Hazy plum with lots of bubbles. Average sized, foamy white head with very slight pink hue. Disappears fast leaving almost no lace.

S - Fair amount of acidic grape with some tart aroma from some ripe cherry. Hints of woody/oak aroma.

T - Vinous grape and cherry is dominate. Good amount of tart and acidic flavors. Some red vinegar type of flavors as well. Very much like a wine with typical lambic tastes as well. Slight oaky and earthy taste. Slightly puckering finish.

M - Medium to light body with lots of carbonation. Spritzy, tingly feel with a puckering and slightly drying finish.

D - Fairly drinkable with a fair amount of sour/tart puckering flavors, but these arent too strong. Would drink it like a wine.

Notes: Bottled 18 Sep. 2008. Very vinous beer that would make a good substitute for wine. Slightly puckering and sour but it isnt absurd and is still tasty. Definitely a unique tasting beer that is worth a try.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2014 Bottle. Pours a hazy, maroon-ruby with a fine, off-white head. Pungent, sour aroma with some ripe fruit notes. Very sour flavor rife with cherries and grapes, along with strong acidity and mild funkiness. Medium bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Finishes with mild sweetmess and lip-puckering sourness. Very good stuff. (August 2010, Score: 4.0)Bottle shared at Craft Beer Co. Sunday Tasting, thanks to Matt. Beautiful red-purple pour with a light, pink head. So fresh its scary. Grape character is there but mild. Medium sweet flavor. Mild sweat. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Crisp but mellow sour finish. Just unreal drinkable. So refreshing. (September 2012, Score: 4.4)Bottle split with Bruce and Colin at De Heeren van Liedekercke - Denderleeuw, Belgium. Vintage 2004. Pours mostly clear red with a fine, white foam head. Great stuff. Damn sour, with lots of richly tangy berries. Light bodied with prickly average carbonation. Cleansing finish with lots of refreshing, sour berry character. Lovely. (March 2013, Score: 4.3)

75cl bottle at home, vintage 2007. This lambic has been made with Merlot grapes but you would be lucky to tell. Its like a fruits of the forest lambic. Decent funk and taste. Not the most sour but quite balanced. Sweetness in the background. Interesting lambic.
On tap at Ginger Man.  Pours a dark plum with no head.  Aroma is intense grape and purple fruits.  Taste is tarte but full bodied with great tannins and grapes.
Bottle. Very nice balanced sour aroma. Nice reddish amber color with a white head. Very nice fruit and balanced sour body. Nice balanced sour palate. Very nice.

[bottle]
Fruity and spicy aroma of red wine, lotus root, and sour oaky vanilla cherries. Light Chianti wine colored under white foam that recedes to a patch and ring. Flavour is like a dry red wine with gueuze mixed in it--in a good way. Begins dry and sour like a lambic and then develops into a pleasant grapey goodness that is complemented by a subtle oak flavour, ending with a tingly, tangy zip. Almost mouth puckering, medium carbonation--more than usual for Cantillon, lotus root finish.

bottle - light hazy red purple beer with no foam. Aroma is quite fruity and has some vinegar notes. Flavour is sour with a relative strong grape touch. Very fruity and refreshing. Medium to low bitterness.
Pours deep red with white head, aroma is horse blanket, grapes, lemon, and funk. Taste is funk, sweat, grapes, and some tannins. Awesome, wish it was more sour but delicious.

Bottled in 2008. bring on BA brought this one.

"Lamvinus" is a portmanteau word that combines "lambic" and "vinus," like the beer itself which combines lambic and wine. Notice too that the bottle is both corked and crown capped. There are wheels within wheels.

Cantillons standard flavors of equine legpit and hobo blanket are cushioned by a layer of grapes. Many, many grapes. So thick is the red juice that precious little sourness emerges. The whole package is wrapped up with oak.

Too bad the price is vinous as well. Grape lambics just arent my thing.
user_location: The Court of the Crimson King, California, USA

text: 750mL bottle, October 2009.  Pours sparkling cherry red with a frothy light pink that subsides to a ring.  Funky, metallic, acidic aroma with wooded merlot in the background.  Mellow and quite rounded flavour; fruity, slightly sweet and a medium level of tartness.  Light bodied, above average carbonation but quite creamy through the finish.
7th March 2010. Draft at Moeder Lambic. Hazy pink beer, no head. Sourish and a little musty. Sourish fruit with a whisper of red wine in the finish. Crisp. Not bad.

Cloudy Strawberry

Wonderful aromas of fruit. Hint of deep mexican coffee smell. Downwind from the barn. Wood, dirt, earthiness, over-ripe strawberries. 

Taste of fruit turns into tartness that covers up any trace of alcohol. Strawberries. Pomegranite.

Very tart. 

Taste like they took cheap champagne like a Pol Clement and poured it over pureed ripe strawberries so you have the essence of a sparkling wine. You dont get strawberries from merlot usually. A rose of merlot in beer form. Enjoy if thats your thing. 

Pair with chocolate - flourless chocolate cake. Caramelized Pear salad.
2009, 750ml bottle. Deep red colour with a small pink head. Fruity aroma with notes of redwine and barnyard. Flavour is vinous, medium sour and quite fruity.

750ml bottle.  I think this is the perfect fruit Lambic.  Pours a mostly clear reddish pink with a small bubbly off pink head.  Nose holds nice tart cherry, dry oak and some vinous notes.  Amazing tart cherry and oak on the palate with light acidity.  Very drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2011 Bottle at KØ10. Good citric fruit aroma, nice earth notes as well. Cloudy deep red colour. Very small pink head. Good citric flavour, vinegary. Good fruitiness. A bit sweet for the style, making it more balanced than most Cantillon beers.

Sampled at DØE Beerfestival 2010, TAP1. Pours a muddy reddish beer with a weak head. The aroma is acidity, redwine and tart. The flavor is close to the nose. The palate is acidity. Overall an average beer.
Fresh poopy grapefruit, yummy. bright crimson, slightly hazy. Sharp pie cherry and fresh lemon, explosive and juicy. do not get much in the way of merlot or barrel, but I likes what I gets.

2007 bottle. Wonderful, complex aroma of lemon, cream, yogurt, grapes, wine, and barnyard fund. Pale purple color with a nice bubbly head and good carbonation. Wine or beer? flavor, huge ass funk, medium-strong sourness with a big, dirty Cantillon dryness. Interesting in a different way than the cherry and raspberry lamics. Lovely.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 2007 Vintage split with the lady while enjoying some homecooked paella. 
A: Ruby-red tinged brown body... quick forming fizzy white head which quickly dissipated to a tiny single bubble thick ring. no lacing.
S: Sour, funky, fruits meet soft, subtle grape skins of the merlot. Slight oak notes in the background.
T: A wonderful blend of beer and wine like components. The beer component contributes a slight bitterness and luscious sour/tart fruits.. cherries and perhaps a slight raspberry quality.. The wine component contributes bold grapeskins, plums and assort dark berries. Finally, the barrel contributes a light oak and vanilla undertone. Incredibly complex and sophisticated.
M: Sublimely refined. Nice puckering initial feel followed by smooth fruitiness. Clean finish. Light bodied.
O: This is a superb brew to have with a nice hearty dinner. One of Cantillons most consistent offerings.

I have had this before on tap but this 2006 bottle was an incredible sour and worlds beyond the draft experience. I split this among three snifters. Yes you want to share this one. It had a light white bubbly head that disappeared fast and left a thin ring of bubbles around the glass. The color of the beer was a beautiful reddish peach in color. I expect this was from the age because my tap pour was much more burgundy. There was definite signs of barrel ageing to the appearance as well

The aroma was that incredible unmistakable Cantillon funk. The first time you smell it you will never forget it. To say this brew was sour would be understating yourself . This is one of those sour patch kid type brews but with out any sugar to balance it . I had this while smoking a fine cigar and the flavor just cut and cleansed the mouth at every sip. It was not to say so sour that it came off a vinegar but it was more like eating a hand full of sour grapes or a tart piece of fruit. The carbonation and the mouthfeel reminded me of a fine champagne.

This is a great brew I loved it but I do think it takes time to appreciate a sour and the age of the bottle greatly changed the flavors from the glass that I had fresh also at $35.00 a bottle its not cheep. It was a great experience and one I will love to have again but not something I expect every day. Another hint is you have to split this bottle with someone who will appreciate it. There is no way I could drink one bottle myself one glass was enough at a sitting
Pours cloudy reddish copper with a white head. Aroma is acidic, leather, barnyard and horseblanket. Flavour is acidic, leather, redwine, horseblanket and some barnyard.

Bouteille 750ml, courtoisie de JulienHuxley. De couleur brune-rouge et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées aigres sauvages (raisins sûrs, notes de pommes et de cerises sûres), léger de fromage vieilli et de bois humide, avec des notes de fût de chêne. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-fort et une texture aux petites notes visqueuses et vineuses. Goût de levures sauvages fruitées aigres (raisins sûrs, léger de pommes sûres, traces de cerises sûres) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un léger goût de fromage vieilli avec des petites notes herbeuses puis en finale un léger goût boisé (fût de chêne et bois humide) avec des traces de fruits (framboises, raisins vineux) en finale. Post-goût moyen, aigre de fruits (raisins aux notes vineuses, 
léger de pelures de pommes) avec des petites notes boisées.

qualcosa di assolutamente incredibile! un prodotto di una raffinatezza comparabile a vini e champagne di media/alta qualità.... bevuta spillata al ma che siete venuti a fà sono rimasto di stucco prima dal colore luminescente rosato poi dal provumo vinoso e intriso di note fruttate di ciliegia fragola frutti di bosco botte di rovere.... AMAZING

Poured from a 750mL bottle.  Poured a light purple with a pinkish head that quickly dissipated.  Lots of carbonation with bubbles exploding when they reached the surface.  Aroma was very tart, and the flavor was similarly tart.  Neither of which were unpleasant.  Flavor also had some grape and some wood present, but neither were as prevalent as I had expected.  The flavors came off more like a sour and acidic grape juice than anything wine-like.  Beer seemed very thin, too.  Just like the finale for Lost this beer let me down somewhat.
Red-pink and hazy, pinkish head. Classic Cantillonaromas but with even more tart fruitiness. Also a very faint hint of horse dung though. Very acidic taste, no sweetness and bitterness. Very tart.

I had been saving this bottle for a special occasion and decided to crack it open for beer number 1500. 

Bottled 11/18/2008. The beer pours a reddish-brown-amber color with a white head. The aroma is very tart with some oaked notes. The flavor is tart grapes with some oak. The tartness is very intense but it is not overwhelming. Light-medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. This is a great sour ale that was worthy of being beer number 1500. Cantillon has done it again.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2012 Sample. Unclear amber/red with very small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, tart, barnyard and berries. Flavour is malt, barnyard, berries, little acid, fruit, tart, sour and wine.

Bottle @ Copenhagen Beer Fest. This is a top class Cantillon lambic! It looks fantastic with its weak red color. No head. Sour, vinous aroma with scandinavian forest notes. The taste is (of course) sour, but without being bitter and with a nice sweetness to it. Lots of nice blackcurrant! I like how the oakening has added fruit and berry notes to this beer, rather than turned into a winemonster.
Bottle.  Musty vinous malt aroma.  Cloudy reddish brown color with minimal head.  Crisp tart up front followed by musty, dry malt flavor.  Nice musty aftertaste.  Only mild acidity.  Excellent.
Bottle 0,75ltr: Burgundy-red coloured ale with the grat an marvellous sour taste, also its got an good viny appearance.

Tasted 2010-04-23. Bottled in 2005. Pours hazy, pinkish amber with light pink head. Aroma of vomit and rotten apples. Very acidic on the palate. Taste is funky with barnyard, hay, citrus, vinegar, vomit and apples. Very powerfull - especially considering the age. No bitterness. Much more in-ya-face than some fresh lambics Ive had. This is one of the better lambics IMO.

(Bottle at Cantillon)
yeasty, fruity and bitter aroma.
pours clear burgundy with pink rocky head.
flavor is on the sour-side but fairly well balanced by sweet fruity wine.
its light, dry, somewhat fizzy, and has nice horse finish.
overall its very fresh yeasty tasting and vinous.

pours purple with a huge quickly disapating purple head. Smells like wine. Flavour is very sour. I taste brett. It also has a very distinct wine flavour. Very unique I have never had anything like it. I am not site how I feel about it. Its like of is trying to be two drinks at once. Nice to drink I like that the fruit is not overly powerful. Well done.

Appearance is dark red. Gorgeous on the eye. The head soon dissapears. The taste is tart; cherries, acidic elements and a good red wine ala Burgandy style finish. No rubery texture though. Poured from bottle at home. 75cl bottle acquired from Beermerchants. I love Cantillon and this proves to be just as good and pleasing as other Cantillons. A sensational lambic. This has a sour edge and a lot of tart. Quite fresh.

On tap at Maproom. Served in wine glass. Pours deep red with pink head. Aromas of sour fruits, vinegar , and some funk. Flavors of sour cherries, grapes, and some funk. Nice sour lambic. Pretty damn good.

Bottle. Pours cloudy red-purple, thick pink-purple head doesnt stick around, poor lacing. Nose is red wine, grapes, brett, mild horseblanket, berries; tart and very tasty, sweat, brett, berries especially raspberry, tannin, leafiness. Not the most complex Cantillon Ive had to date, but a hedonistic delight!

Quite the lambic. Poured into small sample glasses with only a bit of off white head and no lace. Color is a copper amber. Aroma is musky, malty, yeasty, oak, hint of the grape and acid. Flavor is much the same with the grape coming out in the finish. Great body and carbonation. Finsh is like flavor and medium in length. Clean finish but not really a session. This is a beer for the true lambic afficianado minus the fu fu.
Pours a deep bright reddish purple color.  Fruity wine like sour aroma with notes of dust. Champagne-ish palate. Really sour and surprisingly bitter.

Bottle. The smell of grapes, sour and fruity, later also light sweet, some champagne. The small white creamy head disappears fast, the body is clear and dark red. The taste is sour, fruity, rather light and very drinkable. The body is light, creamy and fizzy with a lot of carbonation. The finish is very dry.

Bottle from MaltOMeal Pours a cherry and strawberry red with a nose of rotten and soured cherry rind and watermelon vinegar.  Flavor is sour floral cherry juice with a slight cedar finish.  Lingering mouthfeel.  Awesome.  Just awesome.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Pours a hazy purple with a bright pink head. The aroma has grape, horse blanket, berries, soft fruit, and onion. The flavor is very pleasant. Grapes, tannins, onions, soft fruit, horse blanket, and plums. Spritzy mouth feel. Very pleasant.
From the bottle .Light reddish hue.  Medium body with nice feel on the palate. Tart sourness. Fruit of the grapes very nice along with earthy qualities. Oakiness of the barrels. Great beer.

Pours a cherry blood red with white head. Nose is subdued funk in the mouth it is smooth and rather austere. It is not overpoweringly sour or funky and drinks really well. At $32 its a luxury but otherwise top notch.

A: The pour is a murky reddish-purple color with a minimal rose colored head.

S: A fantastic aroma of grapes and must along with a wonderful acidity and yeasty barnyard funk character.

T: The flavor is similarly fantastic with plenty of lactic acidity to go along with sweet and sour grapes. The oak and Brett offer up some nice tannins and funk as well.

M: The beer is mildly carbonated with a dry finish and a medium body.

D: Possibly the best Cantillon beer Ive had to date (yes, even better than Blabaer and Crianza). Id pick up another one of these any day!
Tap at Churchkey.  Dark red pour with a thin white head.  Funky lambic aroma.  Lots of vinegar...a bit too pungent.  Flavor is fantastic though.  Fresh oaky grape flavor with nice sourness.

Draft at Novare Res in Portland, ME. Pours a gorgeous ruby red color with a big foamy pink head that rapidly recedes to nothing. Nose is lightly funky with lots of sour acidic and some light lactic notes and some nice cherry notes with grapes mixed in as well. Palate is active, playful and quenching. A biting sour and acidic note with the grapes mix quite well. Excellent hints of funkiness appear as well.

Thanks to GodofThunder.  Pours a cloudy semi-purple amber.  Very funky nose with a hint of grape.  Excruciatingly deliciously sour with a slightly sweet finish of red wine.  Excellent but what do you expect from Cantillon.

thanks to Godofthunder for sharing @ RBWG.   Tart berries on the nose, funk and sour notes.  Pours a hazy pinkish red with a very thin white head.  Tart raspberry and blackberry with sour strawberry notes, wine-like grape flavors with a nice acidic tartness.  Very nice lambic!

bottle.  I shared this at the January RB tasting.  Pours a beautiful reddish color.  Nose is super sour, musty, stinky feet and oak.  Taste is of sour grapes with some oak.  Perfectly sour fruit.  Yum!  Mouthfeel is sour and dry.  Perfect sour.

Bottle. Pours a hazy reddish colour with a lasting white head. Inviting aroma of tart grape, hay, earth and leather. The flavour is devine - not surprisingly its taken on a distinct red wine character and its bloody good! Also oak, leather and earthy spice as well. Tart and dry in the finish. Amazing balance all round. I love the subtle complexity that Cantillon manages to achieve with these beers. Definitely worth seeking out.

Drank this 750ml bottle on my 2nd wedding anniversary. Hazy, orangey red with a light pinkish head that disappeared completely. Woody nose, lemony lambik in the background, just a hint of grapes. Very well crafted.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2010 Thanks to 17thfloor for buying me a glass at the Maproom in Chicago. Pours a beautiful deep glowing red with a small white head around the edge. Aroma is so nice, vinegar abounds along with brandy, red wine grapes, nice oaky and very much earthy quality to it. Flavor has even more depth. The true vinous character comes out, sharp tart cherries, sour grapes, very strong wood character amongst other dark fruits. The balance of the wood, earthy malts and sharp tartness is in perfect harmony. Medium body and a soft carbonation. An amazing beer, exact balance and the perfect meld of the wine and beer cultures.

Bottle thanks to maltomeal shared at the Houston January RB tasting. Color of tea and hazy. Nose is super funky, tart, old shoes. Taste is sour, musty, very dry, light wine notes-did I say dry? Light body and very drinkable. Yum.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Opaque red, thin pink head that goes away quick. Nose is full on brett, but the grape brings a juicy note in the back that edges off the strong barn and sweat elements, putting it right on the edge of great before going overboard. The flavor is a fruit blast, with grape, strawberry, and lemon as forefront for the dusty brett and leather hints in the back. As it warms, a malt/lactic sweetness emerges on the mid-palate that reminds of milk chocolate, yet the flavor does not break from the previous harmony.  Weight and carbonation are 100% spot on, finish is long in sweet fruit at the front and drying lemon at the back. This is crafted beyond measure, the fruit-brett marriage perfectly in tune throughout the experience. Is "Best Cantillon beer Ive tried" too little or too much of a compliment?

(bottle, 2009) pours a hazy ruby red colour with a quickly diminishing pink head. fruity aroma of citrus and red grapes, cherries, lightly funky with some notes of grass. flavour has strong notes of leather and citrus fruits, the initial sweetness quickly gives way to the trademark mouth-puckering sourness. medium body with subdued but lively carbonation.

wicked barnyard aroma, lots of funk, and hay, and a great mix of sour red wine to go with it. The flavor is powerfully sour, and funky! wow, this is outstanding, the vnuous qualities comes through in the long dry, sour finish. another classic by an outstanding brewery.

Thanks to Maltomeal for this beer. Pours a strawberry-peach red with a nice red-sea foam head. Sweetly sour nose with hints of lemon, grape and spices. Flavor is very approachable and goes down pretty easy with vinegar, grape and actually some chlorine flavors. Great finish of oak and grape.

Bottle.

Beautiful cloudy red color with a very small pinkish head.

Fruity aroma with some grapes and berries, also some leather, funk and earthy notes. Not that sour. 

Very mild sourness for being a Cantillon. Some grapes, citrus and earth. Not very carbonated. Finish was dry. The bottle was from 2005, refreshing and easy to drink. A solid beer.
Bottle at Ølbaren.Nice hazy reddish colour with off-white head.Aroma is sour fruity of greaps and vinagar a bit like german white wine,this is just much better,light bitter finish..
On tap at Capones.  Pours a clear fruit punch red color with no head.  Aroma of light funk, red wine and sour cherries.  Taste of funk, wine and sour cherries.  Tarty taste.

Pours a pale hazy red color. Aroma is fresh with plenty of tart fruity and some funky notes aswell. Taste is funk,grapes, tart fruit and some serious leather notes. Lactic acid and some vinegar can also be found. Solid beer!
Bottled 75cl. Beautiful reddish color. Great aroma of burnt match, brettanomyces, red wine, candy sugar, vinegar, very faint coconut and lemon peel. Wonderful taste. A fantastic beer.

The color is reminiscent of the pulp in a red grapefruit. Hazy. Slightly off-white minimal head that settles into a nice little ring of lacings. Very good aesthetic qualities.

Pleasant qualities of red wine with tart fruity aromas (grapes). Beneath, the Cantillon signature smell lurks - Wet hay, matured cheese and yeast, rather funky. A delightful and edgy smell.

Plenty of tart fruit flavors with a prominent but subtle character of grapes. Noticeable taste of fruit pits. A light sweetness balances the tartness and the acidity that is gaining momentum. Not very funky, but theres definitely a taste of hay. In general, the taste have some similarities with a tart fruity sparkling wine. Subtle note of wheat, basically no barley. The finish is sour with notes of grass, earth, nuts and fruits.

Light body, very tingling in the mouth due to a lively carbonation. The finish is slightly dry. Excellent.

A fantastic lambic, a real work of art. The character of a sparkling wine this one showcases is fantastic.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)

Bottle courtesy of my brother at Falling Rock during GABF. POurs a pale red. Nose is giant funk and tart fruit. Lactic acid, sweet and sour berries, vinegar, old red wine. Flavor is a decadent mix of intense sour, acidity, unripe grapes, red wine vinegar and chardonnay. There is nothing like Cantillon.

Pours beautiful pale ruby red wit no head. Soft nose of grapes and barrel accompanied by a light funk. Flavor is more full than the nose with the same influences with a very slight tartness. Delicate on the palate.

Bottle. Squishy cork and intense funk escaping the bottle got to me, I let it air out about an hour before pouring. Beautiful red/purple pour with a pinkish white head.  After the first big whiffs of the classic lambic sweat and barnyard aromas, I pickup some distinctly winey aromas, lots of grapes, dried cranberries and a bit of oak. Taste is still very lambic like with some earth and a grape/wine finale. Absolutely fantastic palate, this beer demands to be drunk. As I drink, the strong sour aromas and taste fade out and make way for all the fruitiness this beer possesses.

At Brouwers Big Wood 2009. Dark ruby, raspberry pour. Thin pinkish head. remarkable, never have had a beer like this. Tart but robust. dank, musty with full flavor. Overall a touch undefined. Sour isnt overpowering, slight raspberry fruitiness. very flavorful.

750 ml capped and corked bottle poured a clear reddish purple with a small ring of pinkish foam. Aromas of red grapes, barnyard funk, light leather and a hint of vinegar. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry tart finish. Flavors of red grapes, funkiness, leather and light vinegar with a crisp dry lingering tart funky finish.

Bottle. Pours a very deep burgandy, quite murky, with very dense slightly pink head.. No retention at all nor is there any lacing. Aromas of sour cherries, lemon acidity almosts and a little funk. Flavours are pretty much the same with plenty of sour cherry and oak. Plenty of vinegar and just a little funk. Nicely balanced. Great beer.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2011 It smells like slightly sweet vinegar and has a clear bright ruby red appearance, no head. It tastes tarty all over the palate but smooth. We had an aged 06 on tap in December 09 at Capones - aged perfectly.
Had the 06 and 08 on tap at Monks in August 2011. The 06 was done, all red wine vinegar. The 08 was awesome, carbonated well and the merlot grapes from the barrels were awesome.

Hazy pink pour with nice lacing.  Wheaty barnyard funk aroma with some nice vinous fruit.  The flavor is tart red wine and dry grain with a nicely balanced Cantillon sour finish.  Dry medium body with moderate carbonation.

750ml bottle into Tumbler glass. Body is cloudy dark red-brown with a large dense pale pink head that dissipates quickly to leave a lasting film that laces. Aromas of sour lemons, horseblanket and faint red grapes. The tongue is very dry with a powerful lemony lambic sourness before finishing with a subdued sweet fruity tartness. Seems quite light bodied with a slick smooth yet lively mouthfeel. Gets even better as your palate adjusts to the rather harsh sourness that is typical of this brewery.
$70 bottle at dirty Truth Northampton, Ma. Wild berries, but not overwhelming and vinegar. Merlot like flavor with a superb tartness

Bottle. Attractive dark red but no head. Bottled Nov 2008. Familiar cheesy salt lambic nose. Flavour seems somewhat subdued without the expected snap. Has all the elements; cheese, salt and fruit but flat. Grapes seem stronger in the finish and aftertaste. Grapes not as dominant a fruit as others such as cherries.

A fresh nose of blood orange and apples. Taste is of wood, red currant and red grapes. Finish is bone dry. The fruity character comes out very well and its balanced with the acid. Almost no funk, which is a bit unusual. Lambics are often very acidic and a bit soapy, but not this one. It could be the best one Ive had in this style.
Aroma of fun, red fruits and red wine. Appearance is red with small white head. Flavor is sour with funk and grapes. Overall an amazing beer.

750 ml bottle thanks to Eric. Drank at our early November 2009 blast. Pours a very cloudy brown with small bubbles pushing through. A sweet oak and grape nose, very tart seemingly and light funk. A very complex character; its dominated by a wine/vinous flavor, loads of sour grapes and barrel. Tart but not too much so, a lot of sweeter flavors. Very complex and nice.
Pours a clear plum color with no head.  Aroma of wine, funk, and fruit.  Flavor of grape, yeast-funk.  Sour and tart with a hint of sweetness.

Pours dark red tending brown with a nice pink head that settles very quickly. Nose has trademark lambic funk, very tart red fruits hiding beneath dusty, salty notes. Palate is perhaps a little fuller than I expected but quickly dried up with high carb & racy acidity/tartness. Finishes quite dry with oak and tannic notes aswell. Awesome beer! A touch fuller than most other cantillons but huge tartness one expects from this brewery. Almost cross between gueuze and oude bruin/Flanders red.
Bottle:  Poured a wine like plum color with no head.  The aroma was funky, grape, and sugar.  The flavor was sour grape and funkhouse.  Overall, a wine like beer that was excellent.
Pours a red color with a fine white head. Has a wine smell mixed with brett. Has a sour grape juice taste to it. Not as sour as Cantillons other beers Ive had.

I had previously tried this beer in bottle a year or so ago. Now on tap. The beer was served with no head to speak of but with a vibrant red hazy body. The nose was very Cantillon as expected. Nice and earthy with a real vinous quality to it. As if the nose was not enough, the taste gives you even more. There is a sweet but yet very sour, barny punch to this beer. It all works out very well if you are a fan of lambics and very sour ones for that matter. Just really really tastey and pleasing to the taste buds.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2013 Generously provided by Scott from Walts cellar. 2011 bottle. Cranberry red pour. Nose is tons of Brett, Brett c (pineapple), funky, farmhouse, blue cheese, hint of grape, oak. Insanely complex nose.  My toes curled smelling this beer. Just so many layers. All I want to do is smell this beer. Flavor is an insane balance of funky brett, barnyard, tartness, hints of oak, grape mustiness, tartness, tons and tons of flavor. Hints of grape. Nice and dry mouthfeel. Lively carb. This beer gave me a full on chub. 

Original rate: 8 3 8 3 15 Thanks to Dr. Bill at Stone Sourfest. Red pour. Aroma is tart, cranberries, and a bit tannic. Flavor is cranberry, tart, delicious.

750ml bottle, dated Nov 08, brought back from the brewery in Brussels, it was 8 euros there compared to 13 euros at a couple stores in town - Pours light red/violet with a small head.  It smells of grapes and wild yeast.  It has a very dry flavor with loads of lambic funk and a tart, subdued fruitiness.  Its light bodied and finishes dry and funky.  Very enjoyable lambic.
red, brown, hazy, white foam, light body, soft carbonation, long finish, lightly bitter, medium sourness, very good complex beer.

2008 bottle. Pours pink orange, with a light pink head. Extremely sharp aroma. Im getting heartburn from smelling it. Very dry flavor, sort of earthy, twigs, fruit stems, hops(?), wood. Moderate carbonation. Slightly bitter grape skin finish. Tannic red wine notes only noticed after given time to build up. No doubt this is good, but not quite worth the exorbitant price. Once I become rich, Ill definitely revisit this, and put away some bottles to see if it improves.

Bottle from beermerchants. Pours a nice scarlet red. Aromas of summer fruits, sourness, very acidic. Flavours of strawberries, sour cherries, oak. Wonderful lasting flavour. Finishes sweet and sour. Another cracking lambic from Cantillon!

Purchased this one at vintage estates in Boardman, OH after hunting this one down for a while. 

Pours a very wine like dark red with minimal head. What is there is a crown. 

Smell is surprisingly subdued from what I was expecting. Grapes, a little vinegar. 

Taste is very good, not nearly as sour as kriek, nice mix of sour and grapes. Good, great even, but Im a little shocked at how high this is rated. 

Mouth is where a lambic should be, relatively thin and heavy on the carbonation. 

Very easily drinkable but I dont think Ill stop back here due to the price.

2008 bottle from the brewery.  Cloudy reddish-purple color with a white head.  Aroma of tart grapes, funk, and horse blanket.  Really nice, full, sour flavor with oak, funk, red wine grapes, and cherries.  A touch of sweetness balances out the acidity a bit.  Palate is sharp and biting yet fairly full and smooth with lingering funk.  Really solid lambic overall.

750mL from the brewery in 2006.  Yum.  Great funky, sour aroma; so complex.  The barrel comes through as well.  Amazing flavor.  The wine complements the acidity so well.  And better yet - only 8 Euros!!  (ok, there was a plane ticket to buy).  Wonderful complexity.
rich red pour with a small amount of white head...great grapey aroma...wonderful tartness...sweet finish

Pours a bright cloudy ruby red with a white head.  Aromas of cherry pie, concord grape wine without the foxiness, and some great lambic funkiness.  The flavor is quite sour as expected yet is refreshing with notes of intense grapes and funky oak.  The funkiness lingers on the palate.  This is a fine combination of fresh fruit and oaky lambic goodness.  Very nice.

Bottle of the 2007.  Aroma is red fruit and red grape pomace with hints of horse blanket.  Tart fruit flavor with an oaky finish.  This could use a few more years in the bottle and I bet the fruit forwardness will drop out some and the secondary complexity with start showing.  Quite superb now at any rate.

Tap @ SDBF09. Ruby red pour. Was very happy that this was on tap, would had to drop >35$ for this bottle otherwise. Great lambic here, grape and oak flavors balanced with tartness. Great mouthfeel and finish.

Draft at Naked City as part of the sour tasting.

This was easily the beer of the night, defeating 13 other challengers with only Girardin Black coming close. Its crazy how good this is -- and super-drinkable, as well. Beautiful ruby pour  with very little head. Deep vinous aroma with an absolutely classic Cantillon profile, dry aged-hop funk. I just cant get how good this beer is. Amazingly drinkable and complex at the same time; I need to lay a number of bottles of this one down.

Vintage 2008 shared with craftycarl21. Pours opaque purple burgundy with a one finger light pink head that slowly subsides. Aroma is fresh grape, some vinegar, and tart vinous qualities. Flavor strikes an excellent level of tartness, ripe with vinous notes and loaded with oaken grapes. Some funky notes follow as the brew warms, with some earthy dryness following. Tannin and acid are moderate and quite manageable, though add a a certain complexity. Palate is moderately carbonated with a smooth, slightly vinegary and bone dry finish. This is incredible.

Pours a cloudy light burgundy with pink tones. Head was rather large and fizzy, but dissipated quickly. Aroma is tart and vinous,with grape and vinegar notes- not too aggressive or tart, but the background of the brewing process is made clear. Upon tasting, my first impression was how drinkable it was. The tartness was well put forth, but not assaulting; the grape and oak from the aging process was prominent and delicious. I already spoke to the drinkability, but the finish also helps create a great overall mouthfeel; the finish is dry as a lambic should be, but still has a great flavor kick. One of my favorite lambics so far.

Lucky to get to taste this at Stone Sourfest.  Rose colored brew with white champagne head and lace.  Nose is super tart and yeast.  Big sour taste.  Sharpness aplenty.  Oak and cherries.  Dry finish in the mouth with a huge pucker.  Good one!

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2011 Tap at Ashleys. Poured a dark ruby red with a reddish head. Aroma was quite tart with notes of grapes, raspberry and cherry. Flavor is very tart with a grape flavor throughout. Truly one of my favorite lambics.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2013 Unlabeled bottle being poured by Dr. Bill at the Stone Sourfest. Pours with a hazy pink body and a white head. Aroma of wine, cherry and leather. Taste is wine, cherry, vinegar and leather. Decently sour. Light body and carbonation. Dr. Bill had us try to guess what it was...we gave up before he told us. 3.8

 2011 bottle from Walt. Pours with a clear reddish pink hues and a long lasting white head. Huge elegant and funky must, raspberry, leathery currant dark fruit. Lightly Lambrusco like, despite the grape choice. Black pepper phenols. Flavors are intensely acidic and fruity, intense funk. Jammy and peppery. Lots of burgundy notes. Quenching, lively carbonation, subtle tannin. Incredibly elegant.

Sampled from a bottle at PIB. Our friend Travis picked this one up without really knowing what it was, and he was not ready for the sour! Pours a hazy red with a middle sized red head. Aroma is vinous, cherries, brett and light oak. Flavor is funky and sour, nice burst of cherries and incredibly refreshing. Would love to get my hands on some more lambics.
Good just good lambic. Bubbly newer lambic, but the oak aged character is welcome. A nice woody quality and tart.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2011 Bottle @ PIB...  Poured a hazy, murky pint with a white head.  Light raspberry aroma with some yeast.  Acidic and dry with a fruity berry and cherry flavor.  Could taste a lot of grape and fruit juice tones.  Funk and sweaty yeast tones.

Bottle shared by Anker. Fantastic looking Lambic. Hazy reddish body with a medium steady pink head. Berries and fresh fruit in aroma with some citric notes. Grape fruit, berries and sour grapes in flavour. Creamy body. Nice.

Lovely pale red look, no head worth mentioning. Harmonois bit a bit weak typical Cantillon aroma. Mouthfeel is slick, clean and sharp, so is the flavour, with very light funk. Wet cellar notes and a balanced fruity sweetness that lingers alongside the acidity in the finish. Nice.

Source:2007, 750 mL bottle shared by Steamhead. 
Glass:Taster. 
Appearance:Poured a ruby red color with a huge, but quickly diminishing pink head.  
Aroma:Notes of grape, horse blanket, raspberries and strawberries. 
Flavor:Very sweet.  Grape dominates.  Not as sour as I expected. 
Palate:Light body with bubbly carbonation.
Overall:Age probably would have done this bottle some good.  Very sweet, with almost no sour/brett character on the palate.  Still, an excellent Lambic.

Bottle.
Pours a hazy ruby with a nice reddish head. 
Aroma is lovely and typical Cantillon. Humid cellar like, dry-bitter grape and weak notes of fruit. 
The flavour is more sour grape like than bitter but still dry, with notes of hay, pine, earth and wine grapes.
A little ageing would properly do the trick and make this one my absolute favourites!

2007 bottle.  Pours a clear strawberry with a spotty head.  Big brett is the first impression, more so than in most lambic.  Kind of an earthy one, and theres red berries of all kinds.  Sounds very spritzy.  Very sour, very tart.  The brett doesnt really shine in the flavor, though its integrated enough.  Significant sour grape presence.  Very thin, per the industry standard apparently.  I wish there was more yeast complexity and body, but nice, quite nice.
Bottle sample at Muckfest 2009 Day 1.  Cloudy dark red pour with no head.  Fruity and sour aroma.  Acidic vinegar flavor with flavors of wine and berry.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2012 Original rating. 750mL Bottle. Thanks James! Aroma is a fairly plain straight forward horsey funk, cotton, and lemon juice acid. A little acerbic grape skin. Pours a brilliant, vibrant flaming clearish red. Wow. Rose-tined head. Subtle mingling of lactic and citric acids. Champagne-like. The grape doesnt jump and just lends a gentle, lightly vinous, addition of color and citric acid. Rich and tangy. Incredibly refined and delicate. Long, long, dry finish. So much softer than most Cantillons. Excellent. A wonderful sipper. 8/5/9/5/18=4.5 

I wish I knew what year my first, original rate came from.

2008 Bottle. Thanks for sharing Sam! Super cheesy, horsey, funky wild olive aroma. Super tart, super lactic and biting. Theres some nice vivid fruit skin. Bloomy rind cheese qualities throughout. Goat cheese sharpness, almost. I dont want to start anything, but this does have a bit of a salty, harsh pickle-juice character to it, especially when compared with the 2005 bottle. 8/5/7/3/14=3.7

2005 Bottle. Thanks for sharing Mike! A clear favorite for me, of the evening. Soft creamy raisin aroma. Clean and intergrated toned down citric, lactic, and fruit flavors. Not harsh at all, with a soft sweetness coming up the back. Graceful and elegant. A really stunning beverage. 8/5/9/5/18=4.5

Nose is strong of wood, red wine, berries, and slight funk. 
Pour is a deep red with purple highlights. 
Taste is heavy of red wine on the front, wine grapes turn sour, then the woodiness takes over and finishes with a nice funky earthiness.

750ml bottle. Bottled in 2007. Served in a Smokestack chalice (v2) a little colder than needed. Gentle aroma, at first, possibly due to the temperature of the beer. What I can coax out of it is slight funky brett, a little wood, some acidity and a berry like fruitiness, akin to black raspberries. Reddish purple color with a smallish offwhite/pink head. The fruitflies seem to appreciate the aroma and or flavor since I just picked one out of my glass. The intial taste is somewhat tart, with under ripe berries, vanilla and some subtle barnyard characteristics, followed by a rush of acid, with the acetic aspect more noticeable, and some nice berry and general fruity flavors. There is more ethyl acetate (fingernail polish remover) than I would care for, but it is not over the top. Im not sure that I could distinguish the fruit in the beer as being wine grapes, but I do get a nice berry flavor throughout and lingering into the finish. Once again, this is a Cantillon beer that I do not find overly sour, yet I am not sure if it is the beer or me, probably the latter. The beer seems to come into more of its own after warming up, there is more rich fruit flavors counterbalanced by a nice sourness that feels more lactic than acetic, inasmuch as it is more gentle for the amount of sourness presented than it would be if it was all or mostly acetic. The second glass seems to be a little more of most everything; more fruit, more tartness, more wood (still subtle), but less barnyard. This is a well made, imaginative beer, but it comes at such a steep premium that I doubt I will ever try it again and I am fine with that.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2011 (Draught at Pikkulintu, 20110805) The beer poured deep red and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and pinkish. Aroma had sourness, grapefruit, wood and berries. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sourness, grapefruit, berries, grapes, wood and low bitterness. Aftertaste was tart and sour. 

(Bottle - 0.375 l, bottled in 2007, at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2009-06-27) Ruby red and almost cloudy. Small white head. Sourness, berries and wood in aroma. Medium bodied and bit dry palate with medium carbonation. Berries, grapes, sourness, wood, bread and bitterness in taste. Berries and sourness in aftertaste. I prefer more sour lambics but this was nice, too.

Got this bottle from Ryan just returning from Belgium.  Cranberry red body and pink head.   Crisp, tart, dry flavor with a sour finish.  This is the first legitimate sour beer I have had and I would definitely like to have more of it in the future.
Nose=merlot and tartness. Pours a darker cloudy plum color that is quite beautiful.  Smoother but not as crisp as the other Cantillon with a dry finish.

750ml bottle. Poured red with a pink medium head that is short lived. Aroma is barnyard, light sourness but not much fruits. Felt some tiny hints of wine as it warmed up. Taste is light sourness, dry but still not much fruits. Very drinkable and refreshing but I would have hoped for a much more fruity profile. There are small hints of cherries and grapes to be found but really discrete. Still, is is a really fine lambic that is very enjoyable and tasty. Also quite drinkable since the sourness is not too powerful. Carbonation is not very strong but full of small bubbles tickling the back of the tongue. I will have the chance to re-rate with my other bottle !!

Pours a dark and almost clear burgundy color with lots of bubbles and a pink foam head.  Aroma is sour fruits and oak.  Flavors are again fruity with a cherry  and grapes wine and a strong sour finish.  It is very dry and refreshing at the same time.  Better when served cool and drinked on a nice hot day, makes a great afternoon.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Harsh, almost vinegar and fruity aroma. Hazy, deep red, pink head, good lace. Light sweet, sourish, light bitter, real fruit, cherry, strawberry, hint of leather. Medium bodied. Great stuff.

Bottle from jessup plaza. poured a reddish color with a nice head. aroma is sour cherry, funk, oak. Taste is nice sour cherry and some hints of wine on the back of the mouth. thin mouthfeel. Very nice.
This is very thick drinking with a slighlty sour, wine-like flavor of tart grapes.
Tap at Publick House.  Great brew, really enjoyed this one.  Sour cherry aroma with similar taste.  Wine flavors come through sourness.  Great grab.

On draft at the Brouwers sour ale fest. Pours a bright reddish copper with a ring of bubbles. Cherries and raspberries, with more of a barnyard funk than the kriek or the framboise. This one smells really nice - some apple cider with the brighter, tarter fruits. Slightly watery, but it has a great flavor, in line with the aroma, adding some dry red wine to the mix. Really nice.
Copper with hints of cherry with white fizzy head and lace. A sour tart cherry/grape aroma. Very nice sour with a nice dry finish. Medium bodied with good carbonation. A very nice tart beer.

On tap at Novare Res.
Pours a golden red color.  Aroma is mildly funky, theres a bit of sour aroma, but it smells like a gueuze at first.  Flavor is a little different, its super dry, but the red grapes give it that red wine flaver.  Again its very subtle and has more of a gueuze like flavor...almost a cheese yogurt thing going on.  Another delightful Cantillon!

Bottle pours deep reddish with some brownish highlights.  Funky barnyard aroma along with wine, Merlot specifically.  Luscious mouth feel with big wine like body and some slight gueze like flavors.  Smooth finish.  Not bad and I am not a  wine fan.

On tap @ Map Room. Deep red fading to beetroot @ edges w/ an effervescent pink bubblyness @ the top; sour grape and cherry aromas; sour vinous flavor w/ grape skin, acidic bite and a woody dryness. Similar to the Vigneronne w/o the sea salt and more fruit. Nice. Sweetness perfectly moderated and quite tart.

on tap at maproom....slightly hazy red berry pour with a light pink milky white head...enticing aroma of strawberry and red fruits upfront with some barnyard and funk accents on the backend... tart and cheesy flavors.  berries with subdued funkiness and lots of red fruit flavor.  tart dry finish with a fluffy light mouthfeel that lends to its smoothness and drinkability.  only if it werent so expensive.....

Sampled at Beerhawks Beer Gods in the Boro, aka 1000 Bottles of Beer on the Wall, By God Beer God Gathering, BG1K Tasting.  My dear god.  This is the type of lambic that turns me off entirely.  Pinkish red pour with brilliant white head is extremely appealing, but that is quickly followed by the aroma of smelly butt cheese.  Way to tart and not even fun to try.  But maybe ill get into this style eventually...

Bottle. Sour and yeast aroma with plenty of grapes and some wood.  Nice unclear red colour with small white head. Sour and fruity flavour. Both appearance and flavour is close to rhubarb. Prickly nose.

bottle shared by thecheeseman:
pours beautiful dusky red grape juice colour with little to no head. aroma is great full of grapes slight sour and funk a great fruit to it also. flavour is so smooth with a little sour and just a fantastic fruit. finish is just as smooth as can be.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2010 Rating 1002, shared with funkybrewster and xnoxhatex.  2005 cork.  Pours a murky  pinkish orange brown with a fine white froth.   Super funky barnyard aroma, very tart and nostril stinging, lightly cheesy, hint of berries, dusty yeasty funk.  Fantastic tart super tangy quite sour funky lambic and old wine flavor, pretty amazing, I really enjoy this, moldy funky berries, just a hint of vinegar, fantastic woodiness towards finish, with huge lingering slightly tannic crusty wine aftertaste.  Just a tad soapy. Medium bodied, a hint of creaminess, super fine sharp carbonation.   I love it.  Not as clean as most lambics but has great character. 9.4.9.4.18 . . . . . . . . .  [several ratings from draft... damn this is good!]

Been wanting to try this even before i had a real lambic.. woah, very refreshing, lots of fruit and sour raspberry .. . stinky! off fruit and sour .. . some wine to go with the fruit.. great stuff.. . WL cross off, originally put on 5/22/2006 .
UPDATED: MAY 9, 2010 Pours cloudy purple red. Smells of very tart grape. Taste is sour grape with a burning sour finish. This is a great curveball when had with other beers in a tasting.

BeerHawks Beer Gods in the Boro, aka 1000 Bottles of Beer on the Wall, By God Beer God Gathering, BG1K Tasting. Sample from a bottle thanks to BeerHawk.  Puplish plum red with a quick white ring.  Aroma is huge oak, wooden, funky lambic.  Lovely with a touch of light wine grapes.  Taste is more lambic acidity, oak, vinegar with just a touch of burgundy grapes.

Bottle at the Belgian Beer Fest 09.  I tried this right after the Vigneronne.  I liked this one much better.  Bright red/purple color.  Very sour, cherries, grape, oak, funkiness, berry, wild yeast, and bread.  Some wine notes.  Complex, this was excellent.

Draft at Memphis tap room.  Pours a maroon body with a thin lacing.  Very nice vinous tannic character, lightly woody with a balsamic vinegar body.  Tart dry fruity and mildly funky.  Awesome beer!
I enjoyed this significantly more than from a bottle.

Bottle from Butters.  Pours an opaque brown body with hints of purple.  Smells of rubber, sourness, and some red wine notes.  Sour flavor with a note of wine to it.  Horrible.  For what it is, it is good.

Crushed with Jakebra and co.  Thanks to the dude who picked this one up.  Sour, tart, fruit, funk.  A beautiful lambic.  Cant say anything that somebody hasnt already.  It was quite awesome.  Thats all I got.

750 ml bottle that was bottled 25 Oct 2006 purchased at EZ Liquors. Pours a rose color with a small bubbly whiteish head that quickly and totally diminshes. Super tart aroma with notes of wet leather, funkyness, rose petals, yeast. Medium body with strong carbonation. Flavor is very tart from acidic citrus notes, floral petals, slight woodiness, some grapes as well. This is some seriously drinkable lambic but at close to $30 a bottle and easily accessible Im not sure when I will be buying one of these again.

Rating #1800 ~ Bottled 2004.  Pours as a color cross of rose, bronze and orange with no head to mention.  The aroma has a dull sourness, dry red wine, lemony, fairly rough / grainy and some wild yeast.  Medium body that starts out lightly rough then smoothes out and is velvety until the finish when it seems a bit grainy - very interesting how the palate feel progressed.  The flavor starts with smooth and sour citrus and red wine dryness.  The finish is clean, dry, sour and a bit funky.  Very nice lambic.

Spuyten Duyvil.  2006 Vintage.  Poured a hazy red color with a pink head.The aroma was tart with strong leather and horse notes.  Yes!  The flavor was tart and woody with vinous notes.  Dry finish and light body. Woody and oxidized sherry aroma.  Some cherry in the flavor.  Dry with an acidic burn in the throat.

37.5cl bottle from ølbutikken, bottled 2005, tasted feb. 2009, 3-4 yrs old.
clear red with a sall slightly offwhitepinkish head that lasts for a minute.
